story:
How long do you wait for hot water?

We all want to do the right thing, and sometimes those are the littlest things! Just think about the water that we waste every day while we wait for the shower to get hot. The average amount wasted is between 3 and 6 liters. Multiply that over everyone and we’re wasting millions of liters of fresh, clean water every day! We want to create a community of water savers.And it all starts with this simple, elegant idea that lets us repurpose that water in all kinds of great ways.

You’ll love your water tote. It captures the cold water while you wait for your shower to get hot. You can then re-use it to water the plans, refill your pet’s water bowl, clean. (Even flush!) It’s also a handy, foldable garden sprinkler. It’s easy to use, and when you don’t need it it folds up nice and compact.

(1) Hang your tote in the shower. (2) Put your flexible shower head into the bag. (3) Fill the bag with the cold water that comes from the shower while you wait for it to heat. When the water’s hot, shut the tap and you’re ready for your shower. (4) You’ve just saved around 3 liters of water — ready for you to use later in the day!


Take the hose with one hand and the handle with the other hand, tip the bag and pour water making swirl. Save 3 liters from bag plus 6 liters from flush.


One hand holds the spout, while the other holds the main handle. Tilt it and you’re watering plants. It’s easy!


We’re pretty sure your dog will love it, too.


A great excuse to start your veggie patch!


You can also use your recaptured water for cleaning around the house.


One bag, one smile!



Use the water when you need it.






On/off.

Fasten the hose.

Flush!



The material used to produce this tote is TPU (thermoplastic polyurethane). It is a top plastic material with qualities like high resilience, good compression set, plus resistance to impacts, abrasions, high level of elasticity, elongation. It’s probably the best plastic material that we found in order to get a long life cycle. Also meets FDA (Food and Drug Administration) requeriments for EEUU.

It’s flexible…

And puncture resistant.

Prototype.

We are fortunate to live in a part of the world where, for something comparable with magic, when you need water you simply have to open a tap and voila! It's there. That puts a great responsibility upon us. Spending only the water we need is something we have to raise awareness about. We will all agree on, that wasting water is a bad habit we must change. One day, while telling our children one of those, almost daily, reflections about the importance of water you don't get tired of repeating them. "Spend only what's necessary", "do not open the tap full blast", "use a glass to rinse your mouth after brushing your teeth "," water is life ", One of our kids asked something along the lines of: "Why do we throw that water then? " Oops! The question seemed to make sense, right? We had to do something. Create something different to remember every day, the newfound commitment, but at the same time fun to use and user friendly. We were thrilled by the idea so we shared it with family and friends who were even more enthusiastic than we were. It seemed everyone was aware of the same problem.

California drought.


We got involve almost without realizing it, and scarce resources, in a short production of bags. We have marketed it in Spain through our website and peoples' reaction has been amazing. However, we believe there are things to improve in the manufacturing process in order to make it more competitive and professional. In this first stages we have done some things on a "craftsmanship level". It's time to professionalize production if we want to reach everyone. If we don't think big we run into the risk of leaving this project on just a good idea.

Our goal is not just selling a bag that saves water. We want to change a behavior. We want to create a huge water-saving community, a social movement built upon common sense. With people who value important things. For that we will create an app, which will let you know how much water you save each day and how much water we saved all together. It will also offer simple, practical advice on how to do it and it is likely to become sad if you don't save water ☺. Everyone saving water, will be part of a water-savers community. We would like to manufacture a significant number of units and professionalize processes, keep researching and look for the best partners. For that we need the support of each one of you. Help us save water! 

Water is a scarce resource. As modern society and as privileged inhabitants of a place called Earth, we believe we have a responsibility. To be aware and appreciate something we are fortunate to enjoy every day. People who purchase this item, share our video or simply tell a friends will contribute to change the world. They will get people thinking about something very important. Many of you may not acquire #WaterDrop, maybe you are already using a bucket, or taking a cold water shower from minute one, or maybe you simply think you do not influence the outcome... but you will. You will think about it and that is already a very important step.




We like the bag’s simplicity. Kids love it, it is an easy to carry and user friendly water can. Everyone congratulates us for how simple it is. But a simple product does not involve a simple and low cost manufacturing process. We have come a long way! We have made mistakes and we have found solutions. We learned a lot. So far, all our energies and financial resources have been allocated to manufacturing one model. The process does not end there, we need a push to study alternative materials, thicknesses and finishes to produce 2 aluminum molds adapted to the new production demands. Another part of your contribution will be devoted to develop an app. to create a water- savers community to gives meaning to the whole project and that will unite all water-savers in the world. For this project we counted with lots of partners -now already friends- who believed in us and our project and gave us, in addition to their love, lots of work hours.

Araceli, our graphic designer and illustrator, zigzagshop.es

María Beltrán, Amparo Tordera, Encar Ferrando, Max Israel, Eugenia Williezko, Marfil, Sali Pallares, Marta Piquer, Juanma Dapcich, Martín Dapcich, Valentí Acconcia, Cath Board, Jesús Riaño, Luis Iranzo, Nefer Lopéz, Esteban Salvemini...

We are a team of 3 people, hovering our 40 and therefore, some of us already have children. We are, consequently, at a vital moment in which you realize there are things in the world more important than oneself and that the future is something that undoubtedly will come. In the best way possible and applying all the common sense you are able to, you try to educate your children to value the things they can enjoy every day and we certainly all agree, are a gift. A great gift. The gift of water.

We like saying thank you. We feel good when we say it. Apologizing when we're wrong and smiling whenever we can, it's something we love doing. If you read the whole presentation and got this far, thanks for your time. If you also want to take care of our water resources, thank you again. If you will not help but you are going to take a shower with those first litters of cold water, many thanks to you. It will make us very happy if you follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or Pinterest.


Risks and Challenges

We would like you to have our product at your house on March 22nd the latest, do not forget to book the day! It is Worlds Water Day! We are aware of challenges ahead, it is a bumpy road. We are committed and have a goal. We want to save billions of liters of water every day and we want to count with you, your family and friends. We will have to test product iterations, materials, thicknesses, textures, finishes. All will work perfectly. Once the best material and thickness are chosen, we'll get to make the molds. When everything is perfect, we will manufacture. Our suppliers are aware of the compromise we make with Kickstarter bakers. Nobody will fail. Once the bags are manufactured we will only have to screen print the chosen design and deliver them. We are very excited, we are impatient. If you have any questions or suggestions we will be happy to discuss it with you.




Breve reseña

Los colaboradores financian ideas con las que se sienten apasionados y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.

Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Presenta más detalles:

  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.

El impacto

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.

Riesgos y desafíos

Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  • Recuérdale que use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Y eso es todo.

One hand holds the spout, while the other holds the main handle. Tilt it and you’re watering plants. It’s easy!

We’re pretty sure your dog will love it, too.

A great excuse to start your veggie patch!

You can also use your recaptured water for cleaning around the house.

One bag, one smile!






Use the water when you need it.






On/off.
Fasten the hose.
Flush!







The material used to produce this tote is TPU (thermoplastic polyurethane). It is a top plastic material with qualities like high resilience, good compression set, plus resistance to impacts, abrasions, high level of elasticity, elongation. It’s probably the best plastic material that we found in order to get a long life cycle. Also meets FDA (Food and Drug Administration) requeriments for EEUU.
It’s flexible…
And puncture resistant.


Prototype.

We are fortunate to live in a part of the world where, for something comparable with magic, when you need water you simply have to open a tap and voila! It's there. That puts a great responsibility upon us. Spending only the water we need is something we have to raise awareness about. We will all agree on, that wasting water is a bad habit we must change. One day, while telling our children one of those, almost daily, reflections about the importance of water you don't get tired of repeating them. "Spend only what's necessary", "do not open the tap full blast", "use a glass to rinse your mouth after brushing your teeth "," water is life ", One of our kids asked something along the lines of: "Why do we throw that water then? " Oops! The question seemed to make sense, right? We had to do something. Create something different to remember every day, the newfound commitment, but at the same time fun to use and user friendly. We were thrilled by the idea so we shared it with family and friends who were even more enthusiastic than we were. It seemed everyone was aware of the same problem.


California drought.



We got involve almost without realizing it, and scarce resources, in a short production of bags. We have marketed it in Spain through our website and peoples' reaction has been amazing. However, we believe there are things to improve in the manufacturing process in order to make it more competitive and professional. In this first stages we have done some things on a "craftsmanship level". It's time to professionalize production if we want to reach everyone. If we don't think big we run into the risk of leaving this project on just a good idea.







Our goal is not just selling a bag that saves water. We want to change a behavior. We want to create a huge water-saving community, a social movement built upon common sense. With people who value important things. For that we will create an app, which will let you know how much water you save each day and how much water we saved all together. It will also offer simple, practical advice on how to do it and it is likely to become sad if you don't save water ☺. Everyone saving water, will be part of a water-savers community. We would like to manufacture a significant number of units and professionalize processes, keep researching and look for the best partners. For that we need the support of each one of you. Help us save water! 


Water is a scarce resource. As modern society and as privileged inhabitants of a place called Earth, we believe we have a responsibility. To be aware and appreciate something we are fortunate to enjoy every day. People who purchase this item, share our video or simply tell a friends will contribute to change the world. They will get people thinking about something very important. Many of you may not acquire #WaterDrop, maybe you are already using a bucket, or taking a cold water shower from minute one, or maybe you simply think you do not influence the outcome... but you will. You will think about it and that is already a very important step.






We like the bag’s simplicity. Kids love it, it is an easy to carry and user friendly water can. Everyone congratulates us for how simple it is. But a simple product does not involve a simple and low cost manufacturing process. We have come a long way! We have made mistakes and we have found solutions. We learned a lot. So far, all our energies and financial resources have been allocated to manufacturing one model. The process does not end there, we need a push to study alternative materials, thicknesses and finishes to produce 2 aluminum molds adapted to the new production demands. Another part of your contribution will be devoted to develop an app. to create a water- savers community to gives meaning to the whole project and that will unite all water-savers in the world. For this project we counted with lots of partners -now already friends- who believed in us and our project and gave us, in addition to their love, lots of work hours.
Araceli, our graphic designer and illustrator, zigzagshop.es
María Beltrán, Amparo Tordera, Encar Ferrando, Max Israel, Eugenia Williezko, Marfil, Sali Pallares, Marta Piquer, Juanma Dapcich, Martín Dapcich, Valentí Acconcia, Cath Board, Jesús Riaño, Luis Iranzo, Nefer Lopéz, Esteban Salvemini...








We are a team of 3 people, hovering our 40 and therefore, some of us already have children. We are, consequently, at a vital moment in which you realize there are things in the world more important than oneself and that the future is something that undoubtedly will come. In the best way possible and applying all the common sense you are able to, you try to educate your children to value the things they can enjoy every day and we certainly all agree, are a gift. A great gift. The gift of water.

We like saying thank you. We feel good when we say it. Apologizing when we're wrong and smiling whenever we can, it's something we love doing. If you read the whole presentation and got this far, thanks for your time. If you also want to take care of our water resources, thank you again. If you will not help but you are going to take a shower with those first litters of cold water, many thanks to you. It will make us very happy if you follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or Pinterest.


Risks and Challenges

We would like you to have our product at your house on March 22nd the latest, do not forget to book the day! It is Worlds Water Day! We are aware of challenges ahead, it is a bumpy road. We are committed and have a goal. We want to save billions of liters of water every day and we want to count with you, your family and friends. We will have to test product iterations, materials, thicknesses, textures, finishes. All will work perfectly. Once the best material and thickness are chosen, we'll get to make the molds. When everything is perfect, we will manufacture. Our suppliers are aware of the compromise we make with Kickstarter bakers. Nobody will fail. Once the bags are manufactured we will only have to screen print the chosen design and deliver them. We are very excited, we are impatient. If you have any questions or suggestions we will be happy to discuss it with you.





























Breve reseña Los colaboradores financian ideas con las que se sienten apasionados y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:   Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.  Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.  Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.   Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?    Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes Presenta  más detalles:  explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.   Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!  Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.     El impacto Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:   explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.  Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).  Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.     Riesgos y desafíos  Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.  Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos. Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:   pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.  Recuérdale que use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.    Y eso es todo.

story:
WHO WE ARE

Hello, we are Ashritha and Jack. We are eighth graders at Prairie Crossing Charter School (PCCS) and we are working on our Culminating Project (CP). CP is a two year project that encompasses service learning as well as community service and has a positive impact on the environment.  For our project, we chose to install a bioswale and rain garden at our school to restore wetland habitats, provide clean and safe water for plants and animals, and solve an ongoing erosion problem at our school. Your donations will not only help us complete our project but also create a positive impact on the environment, helping us restore our beloved earth one step at a time. 

What is a Culminating Project?

A Culminating Project or CP is a two year project at PCCS that is started in seventh grade and continued into eighth grade. However, it is in no way like any other school project. CP encourages student to interact with the environment and take notice of their surroundings. CP's main focus is for students to find a local issue they believe need resolving and work towards resolving that issue. PCCS is a very unique school because it has an environmental focus. From kindergarten, students work on service learning projects and continue until they graduate. PCCS's mission is to transform children through academic discovery and interaction with unique natural,ecological, and community resources. CP is a way for students to help better the environment while advancing their own knowledge of the world. 

What is a bioswale and rain garden?

A bioswale is a natural storm water filtration system. It functions like a colander, trapping the dirt and debris at the top and letting the safe water run through. A bioswale uses vegetation and soil to filter water and gets rid of all contaminants providing a safe environment not only for plants and animal but also for us; humans. Bioswales differ in size, slope, velocity etc. Our bioswale will be an average size, around five feet long and wide and a maximum of 2 ft deep. It will be attached to a rain garden(s). 
A rain garden is very similar to a bioswale. It often looks like a very beautiful garden but possess certain features a regular garden does not. A rain garden is usually near a source of water runoff and serves its purpose by slowing down the momentum of storm water runoff. It also gives the storm water more time to insinuate into the ground. This stops or slows down erosion from occurring and provides a  safer environment for native plants and animals. 

How will this project make a positive impact on the environment?

At our school, there has been an ongoing erosion problem that seems to get worse every year. All the turf and vegetation on the landscape die, creating a problem for the organisms that use the landscape as their habit.  Erosion is the process by which the surface of the Earth is disrupted or worn away by water, glaciers, winds, and waves. The downward sloping of the landscape at our school caused water runoff to clot in one area and create a large problem that led to erosion and finally, the death of the organisms surrounding it. Our project will fix this problem by leveling out the land and providing a proper filtration system that will allow the water to flow through the soil providing plants and animals with a healthy environment. Not only will this erosion problem be fixed but also the habitats which were destroyed will be mended. This will help the environment by providing a cleaner community that organisms will be able to thrive in and restoring part of the food chain that is disturbed due to habitat loss.

What we need 

We need approximately $1000. One of the reasons for the erosion problem is the soil. It is very clay-like and hard; not good for plants at all. We need to level out the ground completely and put in new soil as well as sand, because it will help the clean water flow smoothly and reach the roots of plants. We want to make our project as sustainable as possible, meaning we want to impact the society, economy, and environment. To effect the society, we need to not only educate them on our project and solve this problem but make it aesthetically appealing. To do this we need plants! This will be a native rain garden and bioswale, so we will be buying native plants. We want to make our rain garden and bioswale as beautiful as possible so we want to include all kinds of plants of all kinds of colors and different blooming seasons so it will be as beautiful as it can be. We could also use the money to by necessary tools to install this bioswale (i.e. perforated pipes, shovels, small rocks to help filter water). If we end up having any extra money, depending on how much we have, we will either make more rain gardens and bioswales in different places to educate communities or improve the first one we make as much as possible.
If we do not reach our goal, we will take the money we have earned and make a bioswale and rain garden to the best of pour ability. We are both very passionate about this project and will definitely follow through with it!

Perks

We, of course would recognize you, our contributors for making this project possible! We will send you a personal heartfelt thank you letter with pictures of our beautiful bioswale and rain garden once its in full bloom and functioning. We will have a large sign explaining what our project is outside and on that sign will be the names of our contributors. 

Why should you fund us?

We are just two eighth graders with a love for the environment who want to make a difference in our community. We want to show people that you don't have to be an adult to cause a change, we would like to represent the future generation and show them what they can do now and not later. We want to show people that however small a project may be, it's one step closer to conserving and protecting our earth. We would like to make this bioswale and rain garden, not only for us but for everyone so that people can enjoy nature and take inspiration from our project. Your funding could make this change happen. 

Risks and Challenges

A possible risk in our project is the location change. We have permission from our school to install our bioswale and rain garden but we have not called JULIE (an Illinois association that we must contact before digging). JULIE will have to make sure nothing dangerous is located underground and if it turns out there is anything, we will change locations. Another challenge may be the weather, it is very unpredictable and so, we may have to postpone the planting of our plants and if that happens, we will plant in the early spring; whatever happens, we guarantee we will have planted plants in our bioswale and rain garden before July. 

Other ways you can help

We understand that not everyone can donate to our project but if you really like this project and would like to help, make some noise! Share this project with your friends and family. Use the indiegogo share tools to inform others. We would love this project to be a success and would greatly appreciate if you could help.

story:
BACKGROUND

We are trying to help prevent the major global catastrophes that would destroy human civilization. Yes, you heard that right. That’s really what we’re doing. And we’re pretty good at it too, if we may say so. We just need some funds to complete a new important project. 

Right now we’re working on threats from emerging technologies like bioengineering, nanotechnology, geoengineering, and artificial intelligence. These technologies could bring awesome benefits to humanity, or they could bring great harm because of unintended consequences or even intentional misuse. For example, geoengineering could mitigate climate change and thus diminish extreme weather events like the devastating Hurricane Sandy; however the very same geoengineering technologies could have unforeseen and dangerous effects on the climate. Understanding how international laws can control such risk-tradeoffs is essential if we are to safely tackle mankind’s greatest challenges.

Because these technologies pose global risks, they require global solutions. It’s not enough for one country to regulate the technologies. A technological disaster in just one country could threaten us all. So if humanity is going to keep these technologies in check, we need international treaties. The problem is, the existing international treaties cover at most only a small portion of these threats.

That’s where we come in. With your kind support, we will research and write a paper on international treaties to prevent catastrophes from emerging technologies. We’ll submit the paper for publication in a law journal and also post it online. With enough funding (see stretch goals below) we’ll write more papers and create additional resources on the topic.

 

WHO WE ARE

We are Seth Baum and Grant Wilson, both of a new think tank called the Global Catastrophic Risk Institute. Seth is the GCRI Executive Director. He has a PhD in Geography and a lot of experience leading research on emerging technologies and global catastrophic risk. Grant is a GCRI Professional Associate. He has a J.D. from Lewis & Clark Law School, where he specialized in international environmental law. 

We have experience publishing research on these topics. Grant recently completed a paper, Minimizing global catastrophic and existential risks from emerging technologies through international law, accepted for publication at the Virginia Environmental Law Journal, a pretty prestigious journal for these things. Seth previously published How long until human-level AI? Results from an expert assessment in Technological Forecasting & Social Change and now has a geoengineering paper under peer review.

The Global Catastrophic Risk Institute is a non-profit think tank that is all about – you guessed it – global catastrophic risks. GCRI has 501c3 non-profit status via its parent organization, Blue Marble Space. GCRI is a nonpartisan group of professionals that works to reduce global catastrophic risks through innovative research, education, and professional networking. Our administrative costs are extremely low, so your donations go directly towards global catastrophic risk research. 

 

OUR RESEARCH PROJECT

We’re going to come up with new ideas for how international treaties can prevent global catastrophes from emerging technologies. In formal terms, our study will assess what obligations a treaty could impose upon countries to reduce global catastrophic risk from emerging technologies. So for example, if you want to release a potentially dangerous bioengineered organism into the environment, then you will have to comply with the terms of the treaty to do so – assuming your country implemented the treaty, of course.

Along the way we’ll also consider how to balance complex factors such as cost-benefit analysis, society’s moral values, and risk tradeoffs with other global catastrophic risks. We will also address potential difficulties related to whether countries have the political will to agree an emerging technologies treaty, as well as how to enforce such a treaty and monitor compliance. These are important issues that can make a real difference both in international treaties and in the catastrophes themselves.

Our research will be a resource to help the international community protect everyone from emerging technology disasters. The research will serve as a tool to educate academics, policymakers, and the public. This sort of research is very important to help shape the global debate and reduce the chances of a global catastrophe occurring. And with President Obama just reelected, the time is now to come up with innovative ideas for his administration to implement to reduce global catastrophic risks before emerging technologies get out of hand.

Our primary goal is to write a paper to be published in an international law journal. This will reach the community of scholars who study international treaties. We will also post the paper online so that it is freely available to everyone. We plan on this paper being the first of many, so we have a strong incentive to deliver something that will make a huge impact. See our stretch goals below to see how this Indiegogo campaign can result in multiple papers. 

 

WHY WE'RE ON INDIEGOGO

We’re excited to work with the Indiegogo community on this project. We believe it’s important to everyone to get involved in global threats, not just the usual academics and government officials. We want to connect with people who are interested in helping humanity confront its major threats. Our own work will continue beyond this emerging technologies project. We’re eager to help build an ongoing community of people who will stay active, too.

We’d love to hear from you with your own ideas, interests, and questions you may have. Send us a message at sethbaum[at]gcrinstitute.org or grantwilson[at]gcrinstitute.org.

 

FLEXIBLE FUNDING

This campaign has flexible funding, meaning that we will still get funded even if we receive less than $8,000. If we receive less, then we will put the funds towards our ongoing research on international treaties for emerging technologies. We will also write some sort of paper, but it might be a shorter type of paper (like for a newspaper or magazine).

 

STRETCH GOALS

$8,000: We write one paper, for submission to a law journal. This paper will reach legal scholars and in turn influence legal discussions about an international treaty.

$13,000: We write a second paper, for submission to a risk analysis journal. This paper will extend the first paper to reach the community of risk analysts. Risk analysts are people who can really understand the risks that emerging technologies pose and are often in a position to advise governments on the risks.

$15,000: We will also write a “citizen’s toolkit” for global catastrophic risks from emerging technologies. The toolkit will provide U.S. citizens with resources at the national and international levels for preventing global catastrophic risks. For example, the toolkit would include practical tips on what government resources are available to protect them from catastrophes. The toolkit would also give citizens practical tips to advocate for legal reform in areas related to global catastrophic risks. 

$20,000: We will create a three-part online lecture series on global catastrophic risks from emerging technologies. A series of experts will explore global catastrophic risks, especially from emerging technologies, followed by a Q&A.

We want to connect with people who are interested in helping humanity confront its major threats. Our own work will continue beyond this emerging technologies project. We’re eager to help build an ongoing community of people who will stay active, too.
We’d love to hear from you with your own ideas, interests, and questions you may have. Send us a message at sethbaum[at]gcrinstitute.org or grantwilson[at]gcrinstitute.org.
 
FLEXIBLE FUNDING
This campaign has flexible funding, meaning that we will still get funded even if we receive less than $8,000. If we receive less, then we will put the funds towards our ongoing research on international treaties for emerging technologies. We will also write some sort of paper, but it might be a shorter type of paper (like for a newspaper or magazine).
 
STRETCH GOALS
$8,000: We write one paper, for submission to a law journal. This paper will reach legal scholars and in turn influence legal discussions about an international treaty.
$13,000: We write a second paper, for submission to a risk analysis journal. This paper will extend the first paper to reach the community of risk analysts. Risk analysts are people who can really understand the risks that emerging technologies pose and are often in a position to advise governments on the risks.
$15,000: We will also write a “citizen’s toolkit” for global catastrophic risks from emerging technologies. The toolkit will provide U.S. citizens with resources at the national and international levels for preventing global catastrophic risks. For example, the toolkit would include practical tips on what government resources are available to protect them from catastrophes. The toolkit would also give citizens practical tips to advocate for legal reform in areas related to global catastrophic risks. 
$20,000: We will create a three-part online lecture series on global catastrophic risks from emerging technologies. A series of experts will explore global catastrophic risks, especially from emerging technologies, followed by a Q&A.

story:
Ondersteun het Laka-bezwaar tegen nog twintig jaar Borssele!

Minister Kamp van Economische Zaken heeft onlangs EPZ vergunning gegeven om de kerncentrale Borssele twintig jaar langer open te houden. Oorspronkelijk was gepland dat Borssele (1973) in 2003 en ùiterlijk 2013 zou sluiten. Met de nieuwe vergunning kan de kerncentrale tot 2033 in bedrijf blijven.

Wij vinden het langer open houden van kerncentrale Borssele onverantwoord, onverstandig en oneerlijk. Daarom gaan we de verleende vergunning aanvechten bij de Raad van State. En u kunt ons hierbij helpen!

Een vergunning aanvechten bij de Raad van State kost aan wettelijke leges €318. Dit lijkt niet veel geld, maar voor Laka, een kleine organisatie zonder veel inkomsten is dit het wel. We hebben nog geen advocaat, maar het lijkt ons niet onvoorstelbaar dat een advocaat ons pro bono wil bijstaan.

Naast de financiële steun zoekt Laka vooral morele steun. In Nederland anno 2013 lijkt het langer openhouden van een verouderde kerncentrale een hamerstuk. Dit terwijl er nog steeds géén oplossing is voor het kernafval, we ondertussen donders goed weten dat het wèl mis kan gaan met “Westerse kerncentrales”, en in Duitsland, nota bene het moederland van kerncentrale Borssele, alle centrales van het Borssele-type na uiterlijk 34 jaar worden gesloten.

Laka is een kleine organisatie, maar we weten zeker dat met ons, heel veel mensen dit eigenlijk ongehoord vinden. Net als Laka hebben 637 mensen een kritische zienswijze ingediend tegen de voorgenomen vergunning, vaak met een versie van het door Laka gemaakte standaardbezwaarschrift. Maar al onze argumenten zijn door minister Kamp terzijde geschoven. Nu rest ons juridisch slechts de gang tot de Raad van State.

Wij vragen u nu twee dingen:

Ondersteun onze procedure financieel:

  • We hebben in ieder geval €318 nodig voor de leges. Dit is een relatief weinig dus ook een bijdrage van €5 is welkom! Als we onverhoopt meer dan de leges ophalen gaat dit naar juridische bijstand, onkosten voor de vrijwilligers die de procedure voeren en als er iets rest (...) naar Laka.
    (Nb. voor Indiegogo is €500 het minimum, daarom staat er bij dit project €500)

  • Daarnaast, en dit is voor ons eigenlijk belangrijker, deel of tweet dit crowdfunding-project met uw bekenden!
    Het is voorstelbaar dat 637 mensen niet allemaal zelf een procedure bij de Raad van State aanspannen, maar uw steun aan Laka in deze procedure komt wat ons betreft op hetzelfde neer. Hoe meer mensen ons ondersteunen in deze procedure hoe meer aandacht we kunnen vragen over deze idiote vergunningsverlenging.

Realistisch gezien is de kans dat de Raad van State de vergunning vernietigd niet heel erg groot. Het langer openhouden van kerncentrale Borssele is een experiment; er is geen enkele ervaring met het zo lang openhouden van vergelijkbare centrales. Wij bij Laka willen niet het risico lopen dat we later aan onze kinderen moeten bekennen dat we nu niet alles hebben geprobeerd om dit dwaze besluit te voorkomen. U toch ook niet?

De deadline voor het indienen van een bezwaar bij de Raad van State is 1 mei 2013.
Als u Laka ondersteunt of eerder een zienswijze heeft ingediend, houden wij u via email op de hoogte over het verloop van de procedure.
Als u zelf een procedure wilt aanspannen en u niet te ver van Borssele woont (anders bent u juridisch namelijk geen belanghebbende), neem dan contact met ons op.
Als u inhoudelijk mee wilt werken aan de procedure, en u bijvoorbeeld enige bestuursrechtelijke ervaring heeft, kunt u uiteraard ook met ons contact opnemen.

Greenpeace en GroenLinks Zeeland gaan ook procederen bij de Raad van State. U kunt hen natuurlijk ook steunen.

Bijdragen zijn ook offline welkom giro 5780452 ten name van LAKA Amsterdam (IBAN: NL75 INGB 0005 7804 52) ovv. Raad van State.
Zie http://www.laka.org/donateur.html

Stichting Laka
Documentatie en onderzoekscentrum kernenergie
Ketelhuisplein 43
1094 RD Amsterdam
020-6168294
www.laka.org
info@laka.org

story:
DISTURBING FACTS ABOUT AJAX

·       The Interior Medical Health Officer who initially reviewed the Ajax mining proposal viewed it to be unsafe and believed it should not proceed further in the application process:

“ The proposed Ajax Kamloops open pit mine is ill conceived and poorly situated, and therefore unsafe, and would represent…a serious public health hazard for the city and peoples of Kamloops.  …the EAO should therefore be ordered to stop the review process for the proposal and remove it from further consideration”.    Despite this warning, the Ajax proposal proceeded through the preliminary assessment process.  Citizens will now have to battle the mining company and its vast resources at the stage of formal application to try to stop Ajax.  

·       The mine would be located as close as 2 km. from an elementary school and in close proximity to existing residences and a seniors’ care facility.

·       The City is downwind and downstream of the proposed mine.  Prevailing winds would take toxic emissions into the valley where people live and where it will sometimes be trapped for days in inversions.

·       The proposed wet tailings storage of toxic wastes would be located in the watershed of Peterson Creek.  This creek flows through the heart of the city and into the Thompson River , route of a world famous salmon run.   Any waste from a breach or failure of the tailings dam   (580 ft. high at one point) would potentially affect both people and the Adams River salmon run.

·        The mine footprint would exceed 25 square kilometers, much of it endangered grasslands.  Plans are afoot to extend the mining operation to the northeast, bringing  mining activity even closer into the City and increasing the footprint and the volume of toxic wastes produced.

·       The area of the City closest to the proposed mine has unstable soil and slides have occurred in the past.  Building the tailings facility on glacial till was reported to be a major cause of the Mt. Polley tailings dam failure.  Glacial till is also present in the proposed Ajax mine footprint in Kamloops, increasing the risk of slides and tailings dam breaches.

·       Ajax mine operations would take approximately 12.2 billion litres of water annually from Kamloops Lake and our semi arid environment.  Volumes could increase to a capacity 14.6 billion litre drawdown annually. 

 

WHO IS GOLIATH?

The parent company proposing the Ajax mine is among the largest mining companies in the world and is 32% owned by the Polish government.    It has assets of billions of dollars.  The past history of this international mining giant includes:

·       A reported rating by “Greenbiz” as one of the very worst carbon polluters in Europe.

 

 

 

Development without concern for the cost is dangerous, especially when the potential cost is our health and damage to key elements of the environment.   We have to take a stand.  We hope you can stand with us through your donation.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Ajax has not been approved YET.  A formal application is expected very soon for assessment.  We must be ready to scrutinize the application within very limited timeframes.

We urgently need to hire independent experts who can critique the many thousands of pages of the mining application to determine deficiencies and identify the key areas of risk to people’s health and safety.    Where citizen concerns may go unheard, the input of credible experts has a greater chance of influencing the assessment process.   We need $25,000 to:

·       Hire unbiased experts to provide reports on various parts of the Ajax application

(Including the following areas: health, air quality, water quality, geotechnical issues, socio economic issues, community planning, legal and financial issues). Early discussions with experts willing to help us suggest fees and expenses ranging from $3000-$5000 per consultant.

·       Rent and set up a storefront operation to distribute information to the general public regarding the application

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you cannot contribute but still want to help us, please share our campaign.  Get the word out!  You can share directly from this page with Indiegogo share tools.  Please tell everyone you know about what is happening in Kamloops.  Share with local media, share with your friends and family. 

 

For more information please check

www.facebook.com/stopajaxmine

www.stopajaxmine.ca

www.KPHE.ca

www.kamloopsmomsforcleanair.com

Youtube “Is this the Future of Kamloops?”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wmyt50U3nSo

This site received a donation from the subject of the planned review - KGHM Ajax. It is a conflict of interest for us to accept funds directly from the proponent to be scrutinized by independent reviewers. Thus, we cannot accept the $5000 donation. We are working with Indiegogo to arrange for a refund to be made to KGHM as soon as possible. We encourage everyone interested in a fair, independent review of the application to continue donating to our target of 25,000 unbiased dollars.

story:
The Amazon River is the biggest and longest undammed river in the world, has an average discharge greater than the next 13 longest rivers combined, and the greatest number of species. Peru’s government has plans to construct more than 20 hydroelectric dams on the 1,056-mile pristine free-flowing Marañón River, dubbed the Grand Canyon of the Amazon. This invaluable resource begins in the Peruvian Andes and is the upper source of the Amazon River. The energy will be exported to power mines owned by corrupt trans-national corporations (google “petrobas scandal dams” for info). Even if the purpose of the dams wasn’t singular and the dams actually provided benefits to Peruvian people (which they don’t!), the Rio Maranon dams, combined with other dams being constructed on Amazon River tributaries, is predicted to lead to Amazon ecosystem collapse.

This summer I am volunteering for Paddling With Purpose and the Peruvian NGO Conservamos por Naturaleza (we conserve nature) in an effort to prevent the Upper Amazon from being dammed. Please support this effort through donations on this site.  Funds raised will directly go towards the campaign costs to save the Upper Amazon. I sincerely believe in this effort and I hope you can see the value in this project and lend support. Thanks so much! 

Who is PwP? We are volunteer scientists, engineers, photographers, film producers, river rafting guides, whitewater kayakers, and are all bonafide lovers of nature, people, animals and pure happiness.  We have come together in a grassroots effort to inform, educate, broadly publicize, and incite a nation to protect their future and livelihoods. We are tired of knowing, watching, and not acting while the world sickens around us!! We care about our children, and we care about creating a better tomorrow.  Our long-term outlook: Nothing is more important for a healthy economy and people than living rivers that provide free reproducing ecosystem services and thriving happy communities. Sure, energy is necessary, but there are smarter alternatives to dams in 2015.

We are creating solutions instead of enabling problems.

What is PwP doing and What Does Your Support Enable?

·  Film documentation, screenings, and a media blitz showing the resources and indigenous communities along the Grand Canyon of the Amazon that will be lost (resources) or displaced (people) if the dams are constructed

·  Dissemination of scientific information to Peruvian volunteers so they can collect data and monitor their resources

·  Training Peruvians in whitewater safety, rafting and kayaking so they can initiate sustainable eco-tourism businesses…this means one day you can visit and go rafting or have a guide service to make your trip easier!

·  A massive effort to create media publicity with the end goal of (A) educating the public about dam impacts, (B) inciting a nation to defend its fishing industry (often top 3 in the world), sustainable floodplain agriculture industry, way of living, a sustainable economic future, and (C) to educate about sustainable energy alternatives

·  The potential to stop dam reservoirs from being created, the creation of which would dramatically increase release of methane gases and global warming. This affects you, your taxes, and "your backyard"!


The Issue:

The Upper Amazon River is under threat of being dammed and needs your help to prevent its senseless destruction. Please help us in our efforts to stop the dams. We believe that the mainstem source of the Amazon (Rio Marañon), the communities and ecosystems it supports are too important to lose.

Paddling with Purpose and the Peruvian NGO Conservamos por Naturaleza  have joined forces in creating a series of conservation projects at local, national and international levels to show why the source of the Amazon is more valuable in it’s free flowing state than stagnating behind a series of mega-dams.

Basically, one hydro dam is planned after another for the entire length of the river in the Andes, leaving little or no free-flowing river. This will disrupt the largest hydrological source of the Amazon, drastically alter normal silt deposition into the  Amazon river basin, destroy habitat and migration patterns for fish and other aquatic life, displace thousands of residents along the river, submerge ancient pre-Incan ruins, and destroy a national treasure on par with the Grand Canyon in the USA!

The Río Marañon is the hydrological source of the Amazon and therefore deserves the title of Upper Amazon. It is also perhaps one of the most beautiful river canyons in the world, reminiscent of the Grand Canyon in the USA. Although currently free-flowing, in 2010 then-president Alan García signed a pact with Brazil to provide thousands of MW of hydropower for export, declaring the damming of the Marañon "in the national interest". So various studies were undertaken (and are still being done) to forward plans for 15-20 hydroelectric dams on the river (read more about the planned dams in this PLOS1 article)..

The impending environmental destruction of the Upper Amazon river was only recently brought into light. During a 2012 exploratory rafting expedition it was discovered that there is fierce opposition to the dams by the residents along the river. The local Peruvians informed the rafters that underhanded tactics are being implemented by the damming companies (and the government) to get approval of the communities and push through the hydro projects. Foreign companies, including Odebrecht intend to start construction as early as next year. Some of these dam building have been discovered to be corrupt while working on nearby Brazilian dams (see recent arrests).

The Conservation Effort:

Paddling with Purpose and Conservamos Por Naturaleza are working together to raise awareness about the threats to this amazing river. Along with a group of Peruvians who are engineers, environmental and social lawyers, biologists, marketing professionals, graphic designers, and film makers, we will be filming a documentary about the Rio Marañon and launching a huge media campaign in Peru. 

Like many dams in the developing world, very few people know about the issues at hand. Our goal is simple -- to raise awareness about what is going on. The Peruvian non profit organization Conservamos por Naturaleza is launching a campaign to bring the issue to the public eye within Peru. As part of this campaign, Paddling With Purpose is running 3 projects: Advocacy & Media, a Training Expedition and the Remando Juntos Expedition. We are part of a group taking a handful of environmentally-minded young Peruvians on a raft trip down the Rio Marañon and filming their journey, aiming to produce a documentary that Conservamos por Naturaleza can use to engage the Peruvian public in this issue.

We have multiple campaigns going for conservation, please go to the Paddling With Purpose site for details about the projects, the budget and strategy, and the team.     

Here Are Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate, share my campaign on facebook or like and share the facebook pages of Paddling with Purpose and Conservamos por Naturaleza. Thank you for your help and your support!

Write a Letter:

Write and send your own letter to President Humala and various ministers in the government: for list of addresses, see below.

Write and send your own letter to Odebrecht voicing your opposition to their projects. For address, see below.

LETTER TO PRESIDENT HUMALA (example of what you can write)

Dear President Ollanta Humala,

I would like to call your attention to the dams planned for Río Marañon, which are NOT in Peru's best interest to construct. Río Marañon is still free-flowing and is one of few beautiful Grand Canyons of the world. Like the Grand Canyon of the Colorado River the United States, the Grand Canyon of Río Marañon deserves to be protected and enjoyed by the Peruvian people rather than destroyed by foreign companies seeking to make profits by exporting the energy to Brazil. The river's residents including the Aguaruna also depend on the river for their livelihoods and traditional ways of life. Please halt all plans to dam Río Marañon. Peru need not be an energy exporter to other nations and there are other sustainable ways to meet the energy needs of Peru.

Consider what will happen if the plans for the hydroelectric dams are actually implemented on Río Marañon.

(1) Catastrophic environmental impacts. Currently, the Marañon provides a huge amount of silt to the jungle areas and the Amazon River. Dams will disrupt this normal flow pattern and lead to beach erosion and altered habitat for multitudinous species. Fish migration up and down the river will be blocked by the dams, altering the normal ecological balance. Similar dams in the Pacific Northwest wreaked havoc on salmon populations, reducing runs of the fish from millions to a few thousand per year!

(2) Devastating social impacts. Thousands of people living along the river will be displaced by the reservoirs created behind the dams, leading to resentment of you and the Peruvian government for allowing such crass actions by foreign investment companies over the rights of Peruvian citizens.

(3) Negative historical/cultural impacts. Archeological sites that have yet to be excavated and studied of the Inca and Chachapoya cultures are dotted along the river where reservoirs are due to extend. The drowning of these cultural artifacts is uncalled for, especially before proper assessment of the sites is completed by archeologists. Furthermore, are you to allow a complete destruction of the cultural heritage signified by Ciro Alegria's best-selling novel "La Serpiente de Oro", which took place along the banks of Río Marañon in its Grand Canyon? This is part of Peru's pride and heritage. Will nobody be able to visit the villages and relate to the characters and landscapes in the book anymore?

(4) Recreational treasure loss. The Grand Canyon of the United States was in a similar state to the Grand Canyon of the Marañon before several dams were constructed at its end and just upstream. Few had experienced the majesty of the Colorado River in the Grand Canyon before the dams were put in, but now, it is the most sought-after river trip experience in the world, with 22,000 people floating through the canyon each year and prompting wait lists of over 20 years to obtain permits to experience it.

I have also paddled all the major rivers in North America. I can say definitively that Río Marañon is by far the most precious of all these rivers: it is beautiful, unpolluted, raftable, holds monumental stature as the hydrological source of the Amazon, and is an extreme joy to experience.

Please don't let greedy foreign corporations destroy this natural treasure in Peru. Instead, protect Río Marañon for future generations to appreciate and enjoy, as President Teddy Roosevelt did for the Grand Canyon of Arizona. I assure you, if you do, you will be admired and respected for generations to come!!

Sincerely,

your name here

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LIST OF PEOPLE  YOU CAN SEND LETTERS TO ALERT THEM ABOUT THE IMPACTS OF BUILDING A DAM ON THE RIO MARAÑON

Presidente de la República

Ollanta Humala - Presidente
Palacio de Gobierno, Plaza de Armas, Lima 1
Facebook: Ollanta Humala

Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros
René Cornejo Díaz  - Presidente
Jr. Carabaya Cdra. 1 S/N, Lima 1
rcornejo@pcm.gob.pe

story_txt:
The Amazon River is the biggest and longest undammed river in
the world,
has an average discharge greater than the next 13 longest rivers combined, and
the greatest number of species. Peru’s
government has plans to construct more
than 20 hydroelectric dams on the 1,056-mile pristine free-flowing Marañón
River, dubbed the Grand Canyon of the Amazon. This invaluable resource begins
in the Peruvian Andes and is the upper source of the Amazon River. The energy will be exported to power mines owned
by corrupt trans-national corporations (google “petrobas scandal dams” for info).
Even if the purpose of the dams wasn’t singular and the dams actually provided
benefits to Peruvian people (which they don’t!), the Rio Maranon dams, combined
with other dams being constructed on Amazon River tributaries, is predicted to
lead to Amazon ecosystem collapse.

This
summer I am volunteering for Paddling With Purpose and the Peruvian NGO Conservamos por Naturaleza (we conserve nature) in an effort to prevent the
Upper Amazon from being dammed. Please support this effort through donations on
this site.  Funds raised will directly go towards the campaign costs to save the Upper Amazon. I sincerely believe in this effort and I hope you can see the value in this project and lend support.
Thanks so much! 
Who is PwP?
We are volunteer scientists, engineers,
photographers, film producers, river rafting guides, whitewater kayakers, and
are all bonafide lovers of nature, people, animals and pure happiness.  We have come together in a grassroots effort
to inform, educate, broadly publicize, and incite a nation to protect their
future and livelihoods. We are tired of knowing, watching, and not
acting while the world sickens around us!! We care about our children, and we
care about creating a better tomorrow. 
Our long-term outlook: Nothing is
more important for a healthy economy and people than living rivers that provide
free reproducing ecosystem services and thriving happy communities. Sure, energy
is necessary, but there are smarter alternatives to dams in 2015. 
We are creating solutions
instead of enabling problems.
What
is PwP doing and What Does Your Support Enable?
· 
Film
documentation, screenings, and a media blitz showing the resources and indigenous
communities along the Grand Canyon of the Amazon that will be lost (resources)
or displaced (people) if the dams are constructed
· 
Dissemination
of scientific information to Peruvian volunteers so they can collect data and
monitor their resources
· 
Training
Peruvians in whitewater safety, rafting and kayaking so they can initiate
sustainable eco-tourism businesses…this means one day you can visit and go
rafting or have a guide service to make your trip easier!
· 
A
massive effort to create media publicity with the end goal of (A) educating the
public about dam impacts, (B) inciting a nation to defend its fishing industry (often
top 3 in the world), sustainable floodplain agriculture industry, way of living,
a sustainable economic future, and (C) to educate about sustainable energy
alternatives 
· 
The
potential to stop dam reservoirs from being created, the creation of which
would dramatically increase release of methane gases and global warming. This
affects you, your taxes, and "your backyard"!
The Issue:The
Upper Amazon River is under threat of being dammed and needs your help to
prevent its senseless destruction. Please help us in our efforts to stop the
dams. We believe that the mainstem source
of the Amazon (Rio Marañon), the communities and ecosystems it supports are too
important to lose. 
Paddling with Purpose and the Peruvian NGO Conservamos por Naturaleza  have joined forces in creating a series of conservation
projects at local, national and international levels to show why the source of
the Amazon is more valuable in it’s free flowing state than stagnating behind a
series of mega-dams. 
Basically,
one hydro dam is planned after another for the entire length of the river in
the Andes, leaving little or no free-flowing river. This will disrupt the largest
hydrological source of the Amazon, drastically alter normal silt deposition
into the  Amazon river basin, destroy habitat and migration patterns
for fish and other aquatic life, displace thousands of residents along the
river, submerge ancient pre-Incan ruins, and destroy a national treasure on par
with the Grand Canyon in the USA!
The
Río Marañon is the hydrological source of the Amazon and therefore deserves the
title of Upper Amazon. It is also perhaps one of the most beautiful river canyons in the
world, reminiscent of the Grand Canyon in the USA. Although currently free-flowing, in 2010
then-president Alan García signed a pact with Brazil to provide thousands of MW
of hydropower for export, declaring the damming of the Marañon "in the
national interest". So various studies were undertaken (and are still
being done) to forward plans for 15-20 hydroelectric dams on the river (read
more about the planned dams in this PLOS1
article)..
The
impending environmental destruction of the Upper Amazon river was only recently
brought into light. During a 2012 exploratory rafting expedition it was
discovered that there is fierce
opposition to the dams by the residents along the river. The local
Peruvians informed the rafters that underhanded tactics are being implemented
by the damming companies (and the government) to get approval of the
communities and push through the hydro projects. Foreign companies, including Odebrecht intend to start construction as
early as next year. Some of these dam building have been discovered to be corrupt while working on nearby Brazilian dams (see recent arrests).The Conservation Effort:Paddling
with Purpose and Conservamos Por Naturaleza are working together to
raise awareness about the threats to this amazing river. Along with a group of
Peruvians who are engineers, environmental and social lawyers, biologists,
marketing professionals, graphic designers, and film makers, we will be filming
a documentary about the Rio Marañon and launching a huge media campaign in
Peru.  
Like
many dams in the developing world, very few people know about the issues at
hand. Our goal is simple -- to raise awareness about what is going on. The
Peruvian non profit organization Conservamos
por Naturaleza is launching a campaign to bring the issue to the
public eye within Peru. As part of this campaign, Paddling With Purpose is running 3 projects: Advocacy & Media, a Training Expedition and the Remando Juntos Expedition.
We are part of a group taking a handful of environmentally-minded young
Peruvians on a raft trip down the Rio Marañon and filming their
journey, aiming to produce a documentary that Conservamos por Naturaleza can
use to engage the Peruvian public in this issue. We have multiple campaigns going for conservation, please go to the Paddling With Purpose site for details about the projects, the budget and strategy, and the team.     Here Are Other Ways You Can Help:
If
you can't donate, share my campaign on facebook or like and share the facebook
pages of Paddling
with Purpose and Conservamos por
Naturaleza. Thank you for your help and your support!Write a Letter:Write and send your own letter to President Humala and various 
ministers in the government: for list of 
addresses, see below. Write and send your own letter to Odebrecht voicing your opposition to their projects. For address, see below. 
					LETTER TO PRESIDENT HUMALA (example of what you can write)Dear President Ollanta Humala, 
					I would like to call your attention to the 
dams planned for Río Marañon, which are NOT in Peru's best interest to 
construct. Río Marañon is still free-flowing and is one of few beautiful
 Grand Canyons of the world. Like the Grand Canyon of the Colorado River
 the United States, the Grand Canyon of Río Marañon deserves to be 
protected and enjoyed by the Peruvian people rather than destroyed by 
foreign companies seeking to make profits by exporting the energy to 
Brazil. The river's residents including the Aguaruna also depend on the 
river for their livelihoods and traditional ways of life. Please halt 
all plans to dam Río Marañon. Peru need not be an energy exporter to 
other nations and there are other sustainable ways to meet the energy 
needs of Peru.

							Consider what will happen if the plans for the hydroelectric dams are actually implemented on Río Marañon.

(1) Catastrophic environmental impacts.
 Currently, the Marañon provides a huge amount of silt to the jungle 
areas and the Amazon River. Dams will disrupt this normal flow pattern 
and lead to beach erosion and altered habitat for multitudinous species.
 Fish migration up and down the river will be blocked by the dams, 
altering the normal ecological balance. Similar dams in the Pacific 
Northwest wreaked havoc on salmon populations, reducing runs of the fish
 from millions to a few thousand per year!

(2) Devastating social impacts.
 Thousands of people living along the river will be displaced by the 
reservoirs created behind the dams, leading to resentment of you and the
 Peruvian government for allowing such crass actions by foreign 
investment companies over the rights of Peruvian citizens.

(3) Negative historical/cultural impacts.
 Archeological sites that have yet to be excavated and studied of the 
Inca and Chachapoya cultures are dotted along the river where reservoirs
 are due to extend. The drowning of these cultural artifacts is uncalled
 for, especially before proper assessment of the sites is completed by 
archeologists. Furthermore, are you to allow a complete destruction of 
the cultural heritage signified by Ciro Alegria's best-selling novel "La Serpiente de Oro",
 which took place along the banks of Río Marañon in its Grand Canyon? 
This is part of Peru's pride and heritage. Will nobody be able to visit 
the villages and relate to the characters and landscapes in the book 
anymore?

(4) Recreational treasure loss. The
 Grand Canyon of the United States was in a similar state to the Grand 
Canyon of the Marañon before several dams were constructed at its end 
and just upstream. Few had experienced the majesty of the Colorado River
 in the Grand Canyon before the dams were put in, but now, it is the 
most sought-after river trip experience in the world, with 22,000 people
 floating through the canyon each year and prompting wait lists of over 
20 years to obtain permits to experience it.

							I have also paddled all the major 
rivers in North America. I can say definitively 
that Río Marañon is by far the most precious of all these rivers: it is 
beautiful, unpolluted, raftable, holds monumental stature as the 
hydrological source of the Amazon, and is an extreme joy to experience.

							Please don't let greedy foreign corporations destroy this natural
 treasure in Peru. Instead, protect Río Marañon for future generations 
to appreciate and enjoy, as President Teddy Roosevelt did for the Grand 
Canyon of Arizona. I assure you, if you do, you will be admired and 
respected for generations to come!! 
Sincerely,
your name here
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
About the Creator and the Vision

Hello, I'm James Novak and the Founder/ Visionary of Hemp Solutions USA.
I started this organization in 2011, with the primary purpose of rebuilding Community & restoring the Environment. In my many travels over the years, I have come to learn that the hemp plant is one of the most important plants to exist in our environment. Aside from its super food status, it also creates multiple fuels, clean energy from biomass, superior clothing, fiber, medicine, and biodegradable plastics. Hemp is also being grown at the Chernobyl (RU) & Hanford Sites (USA) for bio-remediation, which is a process of restoring the soil by removing toxins, radiation, and heavy metals.  I have devoted my life to bringing about positive change in the world. I need your help to move forward with an amazing vision we all can share and benefit from on this planet we call home.

My vision is to use the Net Profit from sales of a legal Hemp Foods Product Line to directly support Community Outreach, Education, and Environmental Restoration.

When I mention "Net Profit" I mean 100% of the Profit after the bills/taxes to run the business are paid.  I am NOT here for monetary gain - I am here to create positive change in the World and to protect FUTURE GENERATIONS - that's it :)

Sometimes the only way to create change in the World is to LEAD BY EXAMPLE!

Hemp Seed is fully legal in the United States in all 50 States and contains 0% THC.  Hemp seed can be purchased at most health food stores and even Costco.

Hemp seed contains all 21 Amino Acids, high amounts of Globulin Edestin rich Protein, Iron and Magnesium, plus a very healthy ratio of Omega EFA's 3, 6, 9!

Its time to come together under a mission of saving the Planet & its People!
Future generations are relying on our decisions for their survival and health.

Who is Hemp Solutions USA and what do we stand for?

Our slogan: "Sustainable Solutions with a Positive Impact on ALL"
Our Mission: To save the Planet & the People by promoting Sustainable Solutions!
How we are going to do that: We are here to create a Unique Hemp Product Line
capable of generating profit that can be directed towards Community Outreach & Environmental Restoration Projects.  Educational programs will also be a major goal of the Organization. We aim to promote Sustainability & Permaculture  through these Educational Programs.

The United States is currently the largest importer of Hemp Products in the World and annual sales of Hemp Products are estimated at OVER $500 MILLION/YEAR!

Sales of these products will rise dramatically over the next 5 years as Hemp Farming returns to the United States and more products become readily available.

We aim to be one of the main Organizations using money from sales to give directly back. You can track our projects through the website and see the impact it has on the Planet.

Every penny you contribute goes to making a positive change in the World!


Our #1 Goal from Fundraising

The main goal of this fundraiser is to raise enough money to start our very own health food product line.  We have been working hard the last few years to make this vision a reality, but we need the remaining $10,000 to complete our goal and to successfully launch the product line.  Our product line will include several different healthy food products and be packaged in Earth-friendly Biodegradable Packaging.

We already have our accounts and vendor relationships established.  Our funding will go directly towards the start up of our product line, regardless of the success of this fundraising campaign. All money goes towards making a positive impact! 

Initial Start-up Costs to launch the Product Line have included:

1) Building location and permits necessary to run a Food Processing business.

2) Raw Materials Cost (Legal Hemp Seed from Canada) to repackage under our own legal product name/label.  Hemp seed is fully legal to import and to sell in all 50 States. It contains ZERO THC and has been heat sterilized so that it cannot grow.

3) Packaging Costs - the purchasing of Biodegradable Packaging for all of our products.  We are using Biodegradable Packaging with all products we sell.

We have selected a packaging supplier, and raw materials supplier.  The product line is poised to launch immediately upon the success of the remaining funding.

Unfortunately funding is not easy in this day and age, so we are here to ask for your support in making this dream become a reality so that the lives of many can benefit.

PLEASE HELP TO MAKE A POSITIVE CHANGE IN THE WORLD AROUND US!     

                           

The impact that your money will have:

Track projects through the website and see the positive impact your money is having on Communities and the Environment across the United States.  There you will be able to see Pictures, Videos, and Testimonials of how the money from sales has helped across the Nation!  We plan to roll this model out to other cities around the United States and to have a network spanning the whole Country.  The projects we roll out will have a positive impact on not only the USA, but the entire World!
Projects include, but are not limited to:
  • Food & Clothing Drives
  • Building of Urban Gardens and Community Geodomes
  • Installation of Renewable Energy to Communities in need
  • Building of Eco-friendly homes for Families in need
  • Permaculture Workshops & Educational Projects
  • Much more to come with your help and support - infinite possibilities!
Many more projects to come with the love and support from others like yourselves!

Risks & Challenges

We are only limited by funding, and we know that when our fundraising goal is met we will be successful in starting this product line and with getting our projects rolling out to communities in need across the Country.  We have confidence and have invested a great deal of time and money into making this vision a reality.

Supernova Success is at hand - with just $10,000 standing in our way!

Regardless of the success of this fundraiser campaign, the money will all go towards making this vision a reality so that future generations can be protected.

Upon success of the fundraiser - we will launch the product line within 30 days.
Within 90 days of the success of the fundraiser we will fulfill all Perks.

In the case that this fundraiser does not complete successfully:
We will use the money raised to sell products local to Michigan at Farmers Markets. Sales at Farmer's Markets will go towards making local projects possible until the funding is available to go Nationwide with our products.

We will be offering lifetime discounts to those who contribute $30 or more!    (see 'Perks' section for more details)


Other Ways You Can Help

In the coming weeks ahead, we will be modifying our website to include Project Information, and a Forum for discussion. We want to network Communities, share healing ideas, and help to restore the environment we all share in this great Nation!

An Organization and Vision that every American should be proud to support!

If you would like to help, please contact James at: james@hemp-solutions.org

story:
La Regione Sardegna è stata colpita in diverse parti da un violento nubifragio. Questa campagna è indirizzata a supportare le persone disastrate, sfollate e via dicendo. Il resto delle informazioni le trovate nel video qui sopra.


Grazie in anticipo.
story_txt: La Regione Sardegna è stata colpita in diverse parti da un violento nubifragio. Questa campagna è indirizzata a supportare le persone disastrate, sfollate e via dicendo. Il resto delle informazioni le trovate nel video qui sopra.Grazie in anticipo.

story:
River Cleanup

Ryder the dog and I will be cleaning up the Grand River floodplains between Kitchener and Cambridge this fall and spring. The dog loves garbage and the banks of the river contain an exciting mixture of:

  • Old tires
  • Various bottles and plastics
  • Bicycle frames

We will be going out each weekend weather permitting and collecting and properly disposing of as much garbage as we can.

What We Need & What You Get

We hope you like rivers and garbage as much as we do and that you'll help us with our cleanup project.  Rivers are wet and a lot of the garbage is only accessible by wading in the floodplains.  Thus, the cleanup will be more challenging than just a walk in the park.

Your funds will help us:

  • Gear up for wading through the floodplains to remove the garbage (waders, gloves, garbage bags)
  • Process and sort recyclables and dangerous waste (tools, bins)
  • Transport the waste to the regional facility
  • Pay any dumping fees
  • Buy dog treats to motivate Ryder to locate garbage
Best of all, if you contribute now, you can receive real garbage scavenged from the Grand River directly in your mailbox!

The campaign is ongoing and any amount of money will help us with the cleanup. Even a small contribution will help us purchase garbage bags, bins, rubber gloves, and tools for dismantling larger pieces of garbage.

The Impact

A lot of the garbage in the Grand River invariably ends up downstream.  Capturing plastic waste and re-directing viable recyclable materials keeps not just the Grand River clean, but also improves the health of the Great Lakes.

The dog and I have been picking up garbage on most of our walks through the woods, but some of the bigger problem areas can't be tackled without wading around, and yet these areas require cleanup the most:

Sustainable effort

Our goal for this campaign is to make the cleanup effort self-sustainable.  The contributions you provide will help us get the tools and resources needed.  Afterwards, we hope that by recycling booze bottles we'll have sufficient funds to cover ongoing regional waste drop-off fees and transportation costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we'll be more than happy to have you come along and help us on weekends with some of the cleanup.  Let us know by email and we'll be happy to have you come with us on this adventure.

story:
Hi all, 

Many of you have asked what you can do to help Daniela and Kipp during this difficult time. They have mentioned their hope to commemorate their loss by planting a Tree in High Park next spring, and so I thought it would be a nice gesture of our love and support to assist them in planting that tree.

The tree will be planted by the City of Toronto and will include a plaque with the wording of Dan and Kipp's choosing.

The cost of a City tree is $642, so I have set the goal at $674 to cover the tree and processing fees.

If you would like to contribute to this memorial please make a donation of any amount and be sure to include your name. Once we have reached our goal I will give the funds to Daniela and Kipp in a card that will include names of all those who have participated.

Wow, we have exceeded our goal! All additional funds will be donated in Auguste's name to an appropriate charity - more details to come - so please do not hesitate to contribute if you would still like to. 

Many thanks all.

(photos courtesy of Iain Fleming)
