story:
SEE GALLERY after reading front paper work

 

ADVANCED MOBILE INDUSTRIAL AIR QUILITY UNIT

(Proprietary Utility Patent Pending) Very Special Interior Components for collecting Air Pollution and CO2 inside Mobil Unit ---(Proprietary)

 

 

(Proprietary Utility Patent Pending)   

 

SHORT STORY:

 

Advanced Mobile Industrial Air Quality Unit--Special Internal Component's for collecting Air Pollution and CO2--(Proprietary Utility Patent Pending)

WHAT ADVANCED MOBILE INDUSTRIAL AIR QUILITY UNIT DOES:

EXTRACTS MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF AIR POLLUTION AND CO2 in a very impressive amount of time.

 

Global Solutions LLC would very much like to finish research and development and make our demonstration unit. We will then begin to promote worldwide that this advanced product exists. We have a manufacturing plan in place.(Proprietary--Utility Patent Pending) Extracting Air Pollution and CO2 at a very rapid rate. Placement of Mobile Units ---City  streets polluted with carbon-monoxide---City's where Pollution hang's, Capturing China's air pollution on the west coast of United States, Valley's where pollution hang's does not move. Many different applications exist. These units should be everywhere .This is a first/fast response unit. Each situation requires its own professional location survey. I have spent my own time and money over the last five years(countless hours to bring this to the next level) this is not new to me. The A Team will be brought back on to confirm my science and Proprietary process, these are paid scientific professionals.

((.A Recent press release  from the-- UN recently stated--(Act fast to curb Global warming or extract CO2 from the Air)---------Global Solutions LLC  will be running not walking.))

"Please Review Gallery" when you've completed full  Story

-----------------------------------------------------------------

 

What We Need & What You Get

(There's nothing we can't do)

Especially if we do it together. Its time to begin addressing the CO2 issue with action not meetings. Having owned and worked in business as well as inventing various solutions to many problems facing mankind, I intend on doing just that--TAKE ACTION  . I've also had in the past had business relationships with top Corporations in my past- Bath Iron Works, Colombia University(scientific advisory)

SEE GALLERY--------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

      ( Let's Talk Money)

While it will make a difference to the success of our project, with your support our goal is to raise a minimum $500,000 within a two month timeline.

We will need these funds to get this worthwhile project to the next level

First what you get is the great satisfaction that you helped take a bite out of Air Pollution and CO2---second our Perks are listed .Third our first perk is for everyone that views this site---Its Global Solutions Video on utube--I've got Issues with the Issues in our video gallery.

PLEASE REVIEW OUR GALLERY

 

 

  •  
  •  
  • .

The Impact

I am very passionate about this project as I am doing something rather then nothing. I have been working on greenhouse gas capturing for over eight years(first with Dr.Wade McGillis at Columbia University, with help on the science. I on my own began five years ago with phase one Advanced Mobile Industrial Air Quality unit, 

. ((One only need  read the headlines on any given day --( PRESS Release-Today-World bank targets air pollution in climate change battle))

The true value of this project is that future generations can look forward to less breathing problems, with the possibility in our life time of not ingesting so much pollution. I grew up with breathing problems .Our Air and Oceans need to breath again. 

  

PLEASE REVIEW OUR GALLERY

  • .
  • .

Risks & Challenges

  Should we fall short of our goal with contributions.-- What we are able to sustain will continue to push us forward with our R&D and eventual goal of Demo unit to begin manufacturing. I have crossed many path's to get here I will not stop until I have made a difference.(I owe it to my planet) What qualifies me is that I have run other company's with much success and I learned a long time ago---(If it was so easy everybody would be doing it)----Thank You so much for your participation. And Remember-- I won the Kodak Brownie camera in the forth grade magazine drive.

RUN DON"T WALK--Thank You again--you are appreciated

I have one thing left to say----PLEDGE<PLEDGE<PLEDGE--

PLEASE REVIEW/ OUR GALLERY

  • .

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Tell anyone you can tell--- about this worth while Project

PLEASE REVIEW/ our GALLERY

 

.

. ((One only need  read the headlines on any given day --( PRESS Release-Today-World bank targets air pollution in climate change battle))
The true value of this project is that future generations can look forward to less breathing problems, with the possibility in our life time of not ingesting so much pollution. I grew up with breathing problems .Our Air and Oceans need to breath again. 
  
PLEASE REVIEW OUR GALLERY 
.  
. 
  Risks & Challenges   Should we fall short of our goal with contributions.-- What we are able to sustain will continue to push us forward with our R&D and eventual goal of Demo unit to begin manufacturing. I have crossed many path's to get here I will not stop until I have made a difference.(I owe it to my planet) What qualifies me is that I have run other company's with much success and I learned a long time ago---(If it was so easy everybody would be doing it)----Thank You so much for your participation. And Remember-- I won the Kodak Brownie camera in the forth grade magazine drive.
RUN DON"T WALK--Thank You again--you are appreciated
I have one thing left to say----PLEDGE<PLEDGE<PLEDGE--
PLEASE REVIEW/ OUR GALLERY 
.  

  Other Ways You Can Help
Please Tell anyone you can tell--- about this worth while Project
PLEASE REVIEW/ our GALLERY

story:
The Disaster

Between May 14th-19th, floods and mudslides hit Bosnia and Serbia. It was reported that 40% of Bosnian land was flooded, impacting 25% of the country’s total population. What’s more, the mudslides and rain not only destroyed streets, homes, schools and hospitals, but they also dislodged and moved landmines from the civil war Bosnia suffered in the 90′s.

Today, the people of Bosnia find themselves shelterless in a dangerous terrain, riddled with weapons from conflicts past.


The Media Response

I am a Bosnian-American residing in New York and, at first, I knew very little about any of this. As relatives from home reached out, and as news from Europe poured in, I realized the significance of the disaster. And the more I heard, the more I assumed the international community was doing something to help. To my dismay, that is not the case. I found very little effort coming from the place I now call home – America.

A recent article in the New Yorker had this to say:

“This silence points to a sad reality: nonchalance toward the floods is only the latest example of Western hand-washing in a steady progression of abandonment and denigration of the Balkans that began in the early nineteen-nineties and continues to this day.” - TEA OBREHT

For those who know me, you know that nonchalance has never been in my character.


What We're Doing To Help

We've organized a group of filmmakers, photographers, engineers, writers, musicians and painters to travel to Bosnia and Serbia. This group has three goals:

1. To collect and distribute donations going toward the removal of dislodged landmines

2. To document the situation in the Balkans and bring it to America, in whatever medium possible

3. To use the media developed (a short film, a book of photographs, a painting, and a piece of music) to further raise money for those in the Balkans

The crew on the ground includes photographers Kareem Black and Wyatt Gallery, the filmmakers Maria Juranic and Araby Williams and me, Veda Partalo, serving as translator, driver, organizer and helping hand. The US crew includes musicians P.O.S. and Astronautalis, the painter Isaac Arvold, the Solar Engineer David Gibbs, event organizers Taya Mueller, Anya Khalamayzer and Emma Starzacher, creative directors Bryan Haker and John McKelvey, multimedia producers Alex Goldmark and Allegra Oxborough and a million more souls who have lent us a hand. 


How You Can Help

Donate money. 

The proceeds of our project will go to a very specific cause – landmine and explosive device removal in the Balkans by the NPA. The NPA is the only organization working on removing landmines aside from the Bosnian government, and is the only non-profit that passed our vetting process.  We will also use a portion of the funds to help us develop all materials and coordinate travel.  


    Why Landmines?

    As a war child, I know firsthand how debilitating the fear of constant danger is. It’s hard to work, to play, to think, to hope, to love if your life is always in danger. People of the Balkans have suffered plenty, and removing the threat of wars past is one less thing I’d like them to have to worry about.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and anyone else that can help.

story:
Growing to Harvest Industrial Hemp

Ever since Colorado, and now the Federal Government via the 2014 Farm Bill, enacted laws to allow the legal cultivation of Industrial Hemp, we have been working on a way to contribute our energies to getting the new Hemp Economy rolling. 

With your help, We Will Grow Industrial Hemp This Year!

  • Green Desert Sanctuary is a place and a mind-space about rejuvenation for the spirit that works in harmony with our planet. We seek to better understand the natural ways of life so that we can honor them in all our activities. And we are also a working farm, growing and sharing nutritious organic food so that everyone and anyone can access abundance in health while helping to heal our planet and home. We teach others how they can act as more responsible stewards of the precious gift of life in all its forms, and we encourage recognition that we are ALL ONE, united in a common destiny and a present  time of turbulence. We focus on utilizing appropriate technology and knowledge to forward these goals, while looking for "forgotten ways" that hold the secrets to a better, more restorative future for us all.
  • Industrial Hemp fits perfectly with this vision: It is has been reported as Carbon Negative, requires little if any pesticides or herbicides, needs only moderately fertile soil, and in fact improves the soil as it is growing. Fiber varieties produce massive amounts of a renewable/sustainable fiber that can be used for everything from bio-plastics to fiber based products like paper and textiles. Seed Varieties produce up to a ton of oil-rich seed per acre, and hemp seed is one of the most nutritious protein and vitamin/mineral rich superfoods on the planet. And all this benefit comes from a plant that is very eco-friendly to grow, harvest and process, and there is no waste product. Every portion of either seed or fiber varieties is usable. Even if the plant matter is just shredded into mulch, it makes a fabulous mulch that attracts over 100 times as many worms as other mulch products, and helps prevent spread of diseases when used for fruit orchards.
  • What we hope to do: We're going to install a large 2800 square foot unheated hoop house that will allow us to trial two varieties of hemp that should do well in Colorado. A seed variety from Finland will be the majority of the planting, and a fiber variety from northern Italy will complete the trials. We are planning to grow in the semi-protected space of the hoop house for 2 reasons: it will allow us to control several environmental variables, including wind, humidity, and temperature, and it will extend the growing season later into the fall to allow us the best chance for both varieties to reach full maturity. This initial trial will teach us volumes about the culture of both plants, and hopefully also greatly expand our amount of viable seed so that next year we will be able to do larger outdoor field trials. We are also looking to register with the state as a hemp processor for the fall, so that we can do more, legally, with the end product.
  • What success this year will mean to the future of industrial hemp cannot be overstated. It has been more than 50 years in this country since farmers have been able to grow hemp. During that time, and with the help of DEA policies, much has been lost, both in terms of knowledge and experience, as well as genetic material. Kentucky hemp was once world famous as an exemplary fiber strain, and is now suspected to be extinct. We need to start to rebuild this industry and this gene base for industrial hemp to have a chance in the US. It's potential for impacting everything about our lives is huge- from our food to everyday consumer products to the health of the soils and our planet. WE NEED TO ACTUALIZE THAT POTENTIAL! And this project is one step in that direction.

We are Ready to get started building a better, hemp powered future. Can you join us?!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the details:

  • We've already sourced both types of seed, the Finnish oil-seed strain and the Italian fiber strain, we just need to get that seed delivered. It's about 2 kilograms of seed from a couple different international sources, and costs about $200 to get it here.
  • We'll need that large hoop-house/poly-tunnel mentioned above. That's pretty easy, as it is commonplace technology and readily available, we just need to get it ordered and installed: $8000
  • We need to install a well and solar pump to keep everything adequately watered. Well depth in the area is less than 100 feet, and possibly much less (lots of local artesian springs) and our design is simple and relies mostly on gravity for water distribution once the water is pumped up and stored at the surface in a 1600 gallon cistern: $6700
  • And we'll need a couple specialized tools- a precision seed planter, and several pairs of harvesting shears, as we'll be doing this all by hand: $300

**The state may or may not decide to come and inspect our crop and test it for psychoactive compounds, which won't be an issue as the varieties we've selected are all listed for use in the EU, which means they already contain less than the 0.3%THC levels the sate of Colorado is looking for. However, if they do decide to come visit, we'll be responsible for covering that cost. Which means any extra money raised will be set aside for that possibility.***** 

  • In Exchange for your support, we've got lots of exciting perks for you:
  • If you're in Colorado, you can actually get some viable hemp seed, provided all goes well, for your own garden hemp project. (the law prevents this distribution of seed across state borders, sorry)
  • No matter where you are, we'll be able to send you some processed hemp goodies, including that excellent mulch.
  • We've also got a lot of exciting hemp themed thank you gifts, from the handy bumper sticker and t-shirts to tote bags, all available because someone in a faraway land grew some hemp, but you're helping to change that.
  • No matter what happens with this fund-raiser, we're committed to the project. This is Plan B or C already (we've been thinking about this for a while after all) but we've also worked out up to plan G or H. If we don't reach the goal, we'll simply prioritize or down-scale --> Maybe a smaller hoop house ...... Maybe we'll haul water... Either way, we're going to plant and grow some hemp this year.

The Impact

We're really excited about this opportunity to include you in our project. Your help, either by donation or by spreading our campaign, will really help to make a world of difference. 

"The issue is simple: farmers need hemp, the soil needs hemp, forests need hemp, and humanity needs the plant that the good Lord gave us for our own survival—hemp. The benefits are too many to name, but if hemp was a crop that could be monopolized by industrial Ag corporations it would already be legal. "

—Willie Nelson, songwriter, president of Farm Aid

  • Hemp has nearly unlimited potential, and this project is one of many working to actualize that potential.
  • We are doing practical, hands-on research into discovering how best to grow, and ultimately to process industrial hemp here in Colorado, in the high desert bio-region of the San Luis Valley. This will help others as the hemp economy expands over the next several years to include the rest of the US.
  • One of the defining features of industrial hemp is its relation to the local and regional economy of where it is grown. Because processed hemp, especially the fiber varieties, are so bulky yet lightweight, it is not practical to transport as a raw material. This means that growing hemp also grows local economies. As Willie Nelson points out, this is a crop that cannot be monopolized by Big Ag corporations, so that means it will help to fuel a future filled with the kind of small businesses that power local economies.
Together we can do this, and you can help by Supporting This Program Today.

Other Ways You Can Help

All Contributions are valuable, but even if you can't give monetarily, you can still help us do this vital and important work this year.

  • Please tell everyone you know about the many benefits of Hemp mentioned above. It may turn out that someone who hasn't ever heard of Hemp before learns something new and somehow contributes to bettering the future for all of us.
  • Please let others know of our campaign. We both need and can use mountains of support to make this project successful.
  • Like us on Facebook, Tweet this to your peeps, Email everyone you think might be interested. 

Let's Meet this funding goal together, so we can all work together to make the Hemp Future a reality!

story:
Sonnenkraftwerke überall am Globus, das ist unser Motto.
Solar power plants all around the globe: 

This is our motto.


Der Energieverbrauch steigt jährlich um 2-3% trotz LED-Lampen oder anderen Energiesparprodukten. 

Energy consumption increases annually by 2-3%, despite of LED lamps or other products designed to save energy. 

Seit nun einigen Jahren beschäftigen wir uns mit der Errichtung und Wartung von PV-Anlagen und als Fan von "Crowdfunding" dachte ich: "Warum nicht eine Kampagne für eine unserer Sonnenkraftwerke erstellen?"

For several years now we devote ourselves to the construction and maintenance of PV-Facilities and being a fan of "Crowdfunding" I thought: "Why don't we create a campaign for one of our solar power plants?"

Wer sind wir? 

Wir, die ECO Capital MEPE, mit Sitz in Thessaloniki, sind eine Tochter der österreichischen PV-Betreibergesellschaft. Ich, Peter Aldrian, bin Geschäftsführer und leite die Projekte. Wir betreiben bereits einige Anlagen in Österreich und Griechenland und als jemand, der die Idee des "Crowdfunding" näher kennenlernen durfte, dachte ich, dies wäre eine tolle Kampagne für die CF Community.

Who are we?

We, the ECO Capital MEPE, situated in Thessaloniki, are an affiliated company of the Austrian PV- operating company. My name is Peter Aldrian and I am CEO and leader of all projects. We already operate several facilities in Austria and Greece and as a person who learned to know the idea of "Crowdfunding" I thought of the fact that this would be a great campaign for the CF Community. 

Unsere Homepage / Our Homepage


Zum Projekt:

Wir haben schon einen Großteil der Anlage vorfinanziert aber uns fehlt immer noch das Kapital für einen endgültigen Anschluss ans Netz.

The Project:

We have already pre-financed most of the facility but we still lack the funds for a final connection to the grid.


Zur Anlage selbst:

The Facility itself:

  • Größe: 150 KWp - Freianlage / Size of facility: 150 KWp - Outdoor enclosure
  • Energieproduktion jährlich: 240 Megawatt / Energy production annually: 240 Megawatt
  • Lage: ATTICA, Vorort von Athen / Location: ATTICA , suburb of Athen
  • Technik: Module 245 Watt ET-Solar, Wechselrichter Powerone 27,6 K / Technics: Modules 245 Watt ET-Solar, Inverter Powerone 27,6 K
  • Abnahme garantiert durch Energiebehörde, DEHDE, für 19 Jahre, zu 24 cent netto. / Purchase is guaranteed by the energy authority, DEDHE for 19 years, at a rate of 24 cent net.
  • Dadurch CO²-Einsparung von rund 150 Tonnen jährlich! / Thus CO² saving of approximately 150 tons annually!
  • Herstellergarantie: 10 Jahre Produktgarantie, 25 Jahre 80 % Leistungsgarantie
                                  der Module, 5 Jahre Garantie auf die Wechselrichter / Manufacturer's warranty: 10 years of product warranty, 80 % performance warranty of modules for 25 years, 5 year-warranty concerning inverters.          

Why Greece?

1. Greece has a top solar radiation. 1.500-1.650 KWh per KWp.

2. High and guaranteed feed-in tariffs up to 27 years.

3. Cheap purchase-costs regarding existing projects or facilities.

4. Greece is in the middle of an economic recovery and even plans to decrease taxes for GMBH (LTD) from 26% down to 15%!

Warum Griechenland?

1. Griechenland hat eine Top Sonneneinstrahlung. 
    1.500- 1.650 KWh pro KWp.

2. Hohe, garantierte Einspeisetarife, bis zu 27 Jahre

3. Günstige Ankaufspreise von bestehenden Projekten oder Anlagen

4. Griechenland ist wieder im Aufschwung und hat sogar vor, die Steuer 
    für GMBH (LTD) von 26 % auf bis zu 15 % ! zu verringern!


  • Why you should participate? 
  • Warum solltet ihr euch daran beteiligen?
  1. You help in decreasing CO² output / Ihr helft ein wenig den CO² Ausstoß zu verringern
  2. We generate clean eco-energy for about 50 households in Athen / Wir erzeugen reinen Ökostrom für ca. 50 Haushalte in Athen
  3. Therefore you get an interesting energy-income return for the next 15 years / Ihr bekommt dafür eine interessante Stromrendite für die nächsten 15 Jahre
  4. Workplaces are being created as a result of production, maintenance and operation of facilities / Es werden Arbeitsplätze geschaffen bei der Produktion, Errichtung und Betreibung der Anlage(n)
  5. You receive panels from us that you can give or sell back to us at all times* / Ihr bekommt von uns Paneele, die ihr jederzeit wieder an uns zurückgeben könnt, oder weiterverkaufen könnt*


* This is a Sale-Lease-Back-deal. The panel remains your property. Every investor receives confirmation and internal access to our administrative page later on. / Dies ist eine Sale-Lease-Back Vereinbarung.
 Paneel bleibt dein Eigentum. Jeder Investor 
 bekommt dann später Bestätigung und internen
 Zugang auf unserer Verwaltungsseite.

  www.mc99.com 

More details under 

Genaueres unter 

 FAQ

If you have questions just send me a mail.

Bei Fragen einfach mir ein Mail senden.

 Let`s Milk the Sun!

 Peter Aldrian

 

PS.

Promise:


If my campaign are sucessfully or 2000 Sunambassador spended Money i build 1 Power Plants on a Roof of an SOS Children`s Village ! As a donor, you can give me suggestions, which SOS Children`s Village !


Sollte meine Kampagne erfolgreich sein, werde ich zusätzlich 1 PV Anlage
auf  ein SOS Kinderdorf montieren. Als Spender kannst du mir dazu Vorschläge unterbreiten.

We already operate several facilities in Austria and Greece and as a person who learned to know the idea of "Crowdfunding" I thought of the fact that this would be a great campaign for the CF Community.  Unsere Homepage / Our HomepageZum Projekt: Wir haben schon einen Großteil der Anlage vorfinanziert aber uns fehlt immer noch das Kapital für einen endgültigen Anschluss ans Netz.The Project:We have already pre-financed most of the facility but we still lack the funds for a final connection to the grid. Zur Anlage selbst:The Facility itself: 
Größe: 150 KWp - Freianlage / Size of facility: 150 KWp - Outdoor enclosure

Energieproduktion jährlich: 240 Megawatt / Energy production annually: 240 Megawatt
Lage: ATTICA, Vorort von Athen / Location: ATTICA , suburb of Athen
Technik: Module 245 Watt ET-Solar, Wechselrichter Powerone 27,6 K / Technics: Modules 245 Watt ET-Solar, Inverter Powerone 27,6 K
Abnahme garantiert durch Energiebehörde, DEHDE, für 19 Jahre, zu 24 cent netto. / Purchase is guaranteed by the energy authority, DEDHE for 19 years, at a rate of 24 cent net.

Dadurch CO²-Einsparung von rund 150 Tonnen jährlich! / Thus CO² saving of approximately 150 tons annually! 


Herstellergarantie: 10 Jahre Produktgarantie, 25 Jahre 80 % Leistungsgarantie                              der Module, 5 Jahre Garantie auf die Wechselrichter / Manufacturer's warranty: 10 years of product warranty, 80 % performance warranty of modules for 25 years, 5 year-warranty concerning inverters.           

Why Greece?1. Greece has a top solar radiation. 1.500-1.650 KWh per KWp.2. High and guaranteed feed-in tariffs up to 27 years. 3. Cheap purchase-costs regarding existing projects or facilities. 4. Greece is in the middle of an economic recovery and even plans to decrease taxes for GMBH (LTD) from 26% down to 15%!Warum Griechenland?1. Griechenland hat eine Top Sonneneinstrahlung.     1.500- 1.650 KWh pro KWp.2. Hohe, garantierte Einspeisetarife, bis zu 27 Jahre3. Günstige Ankaufspreise von bestehenden Projekten oder Anlagen4. Griechenland ist wieder im Aufschwung und hat sogar vor, die Steuer     für GMBH (LTD) von 26 % auf bis zu 15 % ! zu verringern!
Why you should participate? 
Warum solltet ihr euch daran beteiligen?

You help in decreasing CO² output / Ihr helft ein wenig den CO² Ausstoß zu verringern
We generate clean eco-energy for about 50 households in Athen / Wir erzeugen reinen Ökostrom für ca. 50 Haushalte in Athen
Therefore you get an interesting energy-income return for the next 15 years / Ihr bekommt dafür eine interessante Stromrendite für die nächsten 15 Jahre
Workplaces are being created as a result of production, maintenance and operation of facilities / Es werden Arbeitsplätze geschaffen bei der Produktion, Errichtung und Betreibung der Anlage(n)
You receive panels from us that you can give or sell back to us at all times* / Ihr bekommt von uns Paneele, die ihr jederzeit wieder an uns zurückgeben könnt, oder weiterverkaufen könnt*


* This is a Sale-Lease-Back-deal. The panel remains your property. Every investor receives confirmation and internal access to our administrative page later on. / Dies ist eine Sale-Lease-Back Vereinbarung. Paneel bleibt dein Eigentum. Jeder Investor  bekommt dann später Bestätigung und internen Zugang auf unserer Verwaltungsseite.
  www.mc99.com 
More details under  
Genaueres unter 
 FAQ
If you have questions just send me a mail. 
Bei Fragen einfach mir ein Mail senden.
 Let`s Milk the Sun!
 Peter Aldrian
 
PS.
Promise:


If my campaign are sucessfully or 2000 Sunambassador spended Money i build 1 Power Plants on a Roof of an SOS Children`s Village ! As a donor, you can give me suggestions, which SOS Children`s Village !

Sollte meine Kampagne erfolgreich sein, werde ich zusätzlich 1 PV Anlageauf  ein SOS Kinderdorf montieren. Als Spender kannst du mir dazu Vorschläge unterbreiten.

story:
Background...

What if instead of your mutual fund buying stock in Exxon-Mobil, it could earn a return financing a project to clean up a local water supply?

What if there was a way to get private investors – everyone from you and me to Apple and the Gates Foundation – interested in financing crucial programs, even if they don't generate any revenue?

Meet the Social Impact Bond, an innovative mechanism that gives investors the incentive to finance conservation and social programs by creating a return on the money used to pay for them.

Britain, Massachusetts, and New York City are currently moving forward their own Social Impact Bonds, but they’re all for social programs: homelessness and prison recidivism.

My project is to implement the first-ever Social Impact Bond for a conservation program.

The California Dept. of Parks & Recreation had its budget slashed and, as a result, threatened to close 70 state parks. I want to use Social Impact Bonds to encourage investors to supplement the financing of California's State Parks.

How does a Social Impact Bond work? The trick is to find a program that, if enacted now, saves money in the future. And it's much cheaper to keep up with park maintenance now – like conducting controlled burns and preventing the dumping of waste – than it is to extinguish an out-of-control wildfire or clean up a polluted stream.

What I Need...

To make this happen, the first step is to determine the economic value of the ecosystem services (like water quality maintenance and fire suppression) coming from the parks. To have authority, this study needs to be done by experts who have told me that it will take approximately 100 hours and cost about $10,000. This is the purpose of this Indiegogo campaign.

The annual budget for this entire project is $96,000. I expect the bulk of this funding to come from grants, but grants take months and months to process and California's State Parks don’t have a lot of time.

Any money raised beyond the $10K goal will allow me to get started right away on the other aspects of the campaign -- like building a coalition of support and moving forward legislation in Sacramento. And just as importantly, it will help me make a much stronger case when applying for grant money, as the project will seem much more viable once it has achieved some successes.

About Me...

What makes me qualified to do this work? I recently earned an MBA from Presidio Graduate School in San Francisco and before that worked in Washington, DC where I spearheaded a campaign that achieved passage of a federal law. In this work, I built a diverse coalition of national nonprofits, industry associations, and private firms to advocate for a law to prevent the import and sale of illegally-sourced wood products in the U.S. The law's passage received international attention from the forest products industry and, according to the UK’s Chatham House, has led to a substantial reduction in illegal logging in forest-rich developing nations around the world.

This project would be very similar to that work, where I have a track record of success.

The Impact...

Social Impact Bonds are a way to permanently supplement the Park Department's budget and address the problems created by California's budget crisis.

But more importantly, if this pilot project is successful, it can be replicated in countless ways to relieve taxpayers in California and elsewhere from financing other conservation programs that address things like clean water, carbon sequestration, and endangered species.

Whether you're able to contribute to this project or not, please use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about it via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.

Thank you for considering a donation to such pioneering and important work, check out my organization's website for more informaiton, and scan the perks to the right to see what you get for contributing.

Dave


Also, a BIG thank you to Chad Reese, who directed and edited this campaign's video.

story:
Over the past few years I have started to watch the world in a different way

             I have started to see the way we affect each other and the importance of generosity, the simple shift of Me to We consciousness and how it touches both the gifted and the giver. I have been dreaming of going to Guatemala since I knew what it was and that my ancestors came from there. I am a quarter indigenous Mayan; my mother was born in Guatemala City in 1949. Because of this I feel a great personal connection with the efforts of CFCI to protect the forests in Guatemala, improve the water quality, and help local communities have better housing and job opportunities. 

I was raised by my mother Heidi in Tampa FL, and longed for an understanding of my roots with all its ancient magic. By visiting Guatemala for the first time this February I hope to deepen my understanding of who I am, what It really means to be a part of this world family, and be a part of something greater than me. I am very motivated and excited about this Journey!  Please join me in this cause with your donation this month!

* Any amount of donation or sponsorship is tax-deductible.

My Goal is to raise $1,800 by FEBRUARY 4th 2015

Cost break-down:

$1,300 Direct costs (food, travel, guides, occasional hotel, drivers, boats, etc)

$200 Land use fee that is paid to the communities as incentive to protect forest

$200 to CFCI for conservation efforts, admin, trail maintenance, and base camp

$100 for Field service (food, travel, home stays, etc.)

Total:

$1800

will get me on the ground in Guatemala for three weeks of ecological and social justice efforts, and a good bit of fun too!

What will I be doing?

Cloud Forest Trek:

  1. Support cloud forest protection, preservation, restoration

  2. Research on the water, plants and animals.

  3. Support eco-tourism in surrounding communities

  4. Educate communities about more sustainable ways of living

  5. Implementing Permaculture applications in remote villages to improve water quality and socio-economic well-being

Field service work:

  1. Installing household grey-water systems

  2. Collecting data for a community grey-water system

  3. Trail maintenance and survey work

  4. House rehabilitation


If I don't reach my goal all proceeds will go to CFCI.

Thank you Thank you!!
Quetzal Jordan
and CFCI

story:
The Mission

The NaturCast Mission

NaturCast wants to be the global goto platform for Environmental Journalism & Nature Content.We will create and share powerful stories about nature and man’s complicated relationship withthe environment informing and engaging the public on today’s crucial issues.

More than just a platform for content, we want to provide viewers with effective opportunities to transform their knowledge into action, seamlessly connecting them with the relevant causes,organizations, policy initiatives and field operatives making the decisions that will determine our future.

In an age where our environment is under unprecedented threat and digital media poses the possibility of unprecedented information sharing and mobilizing, NaturCast enables ecoactivism through informative entertainment & reporting.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $7000.00 to help fund our content, which engages with people around the world. Fundamentally to drive awareness towards these environmental issues. 

The Impact

For Consumers

There is a gap in the digital and traditional media landscape for insightful, reliable and engagingenvironmental journalism and content.

Inthe digital space, few specialized Content Creators and Platforms create high qualityand trustworthy environmental content.It is still inconvenient and challenging for users to easily find innovative, insightful and integritous reporting and content on the day’s environmental issues.

Moreover, the opportunity to clearly transform that new awareness and motivation intoaction is difficult.NaturCast will create multiple types and formats of primarily digital content (video, articles,audio, photoessays& live events) which inform and engage consumers on the breaking stories and vital issues affecting the environment.

As the internet has ushered in the era of participatory media, NaturCast will then also provide consumers with clear paths to action and activism on a particular issue such as donating to a particular project, volunteering for an organization or adding their voices to a policy movement or reform.

Risks & Challenges

The following have been identified as potential risks going forward:

∙ Changes in both international and domestic consumer preferences.

∙ Increased data and internet costs.

∙ Access to NaturCast content, although seen to be diminishing going forward.

∙ Economic sentiment decreasing on a global and domestic scale.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like our Facebook, Instagram, Youtube and Twitter pages. 

Help share the good word about the environment and it's struggles.

story:
Marine science has always been a passion of mine, since the first time I visited an aquarium at 11 months. One of my first words was "anemone", so I guess you could say my path has been set from an early age! Not only do I adore learning about every aspect of the ocean, but one of my biggest passions is aquarium keeping. I've kept a 20-gallon tank full of tetras, catfish, gouramis, rasboras, bettas, and many other fish since I was nine years old, and I've recently added a new betta tank and upgraded to a 30-gallon! This three-week long opportunity to do fieldwork in Portugal and monitor bottlenose dolphin populations, learn about marine conservation, aquatic biodiversity, and coastal sustainability is a dream come true for me. Not only does this program include the aforementioned scientific studies, but there are also opportunities to snorkel, surf, stargaze, and learn traditional Portuguese cooking and dance, and of course, the Portuguese language.

Not only is marine science a true passion of mine, but I'm so excited by the idea of traveling to another country. This is truly a once in a lifetime opportunity for me to go abroad, meet new people, explore my interests, gain language skills, and build my confidence.   

The tuition for this program is $5000, and the airfare could be anything up to $1000. I am aware that is a very large amount of money to raise in a few months, but I'm incredibly determined to meet my goal. Any contribution you can make is extraordinarily appreciated, even $5. If many people give a few dollars, it'll all add up. 

I'm currently in the process of applying for a scholarship but I won't know the results until a few months from now. Since I have no idea of the amount of aid I'll receive, I'm shooting to raise as much money as possible starting now. In addition to this crowdfunding, I'm planning to contact restaurants for a fundraising night and request sponsorships from businesses, as well as hold my own fundraisers and earn as much money as I can from babysitting and pet care jobs to get the $6000 that I need. 

I'm not going to have access to wi-fi for most of this trip, but when I get back I'll send every contributor a link to a detailed description of my experience and lots of pictures!

Below is a link to information this program. Feel free to contact me with any questions about the program or my fundraising plan. 

Thank you so much for your consideration and support on this journey. This opportunity means so much to me, and again, all contributions are incredibly appreciated. 

https://www.ciee.org/go-abroad/high-school-stud...

story:
We want to put a billboard in downtown Oakland that educates people on the large amount of water used to produce beef.

California is in the middle of a massive drought.  A lot of us are doing our part by taking shorter showers, not watering our lawns and even flushing less.  But the sad fact is that 80% of the water being used in California is for agriculture.  Some plants use more water than others but when it comes to beef, the amount of water used is astounding.  To make a single pound of beef you have to use 1,700 gallons of water!  That's enough water to fill up 4 hot tubs.

We would like to run a billboard in Dub Nation aka Oakland that educates people on beefs large water footprint.  The billboard will be at Broadway and Grand and cost $3,478 to run for 4 weeks. 

Thanks for your help!

story:
We are artists, designers and parents with a passion for the environment. We create with a mindfulness of how eco-friendly our works are. Raheem encapsulates observations of environments within his photographs as Kayla captures the feeling of the environment within her drawings.

We are asking for your support to go on a 2-part bike tour that will educate our viewers and backers about sustainable practices. First, we will bike from Pittsburgh, PA to Washington D.C. for the Climate March, then from D.C. to North Carolina for a Cob Building Course. From there we will fly back to Ohio, where we will celebrate our daughter's birthday. For the second part of our tour, we will bike to Columbus for an Advanced Permaculture Course and up to Wisconsin to receive our Permaculture Design Certification.

At the end of this journey we plan to release a book of writings, photographs, and drawings. These products will exude the essence of the environments we visit as well as the sustainable practices we learn about. Along the way we will film interviews and tutorials as part of our travel vlog. This content will be helpful and transformative for those who desire to live more sustainably.

 

 

We have created 4 Tiers of Investment. These tiers were created with flexible funding in mind. If we only receive $410, we will only travel on the first leg of our journey from Pittsburgh to DC. The next tier will be reached when the funding level reaches $3650 and this will allow us to take the cob building courses in North Carolina. This continues with the third and fourth tier until we become fully funded at which point extra funds would go towards the expansion of our work and business.

 

 

What is the Climate March?

On the 100th Day of the Trump Administration, we will be in the streets of Washington D.C. to show the world and our leaders that we will resist attacks on our people, our communities and our planet. To learn more visit the People's Climate Website.

 

What is Permaculture? 

Permaculture is a system of agricultural and social design principles centered on simulating or directly utilizing the patterns and features observed in natural ecosystems. To learn more visit Midwest Permaculture's Website.

 

What is Cob Building?

Cob, is a natural building material made from subsoil, water, some kind of fibrous organic material (typically straw), and sometimes lime. The contents of subsoil naturally vary, and if it does not contain the right mixture it can be modified with sand or clay. Cob is fireproof, resistant to seismic activity, and inexpensive. To learn more visit Mud Dauber School of Natural Building's Website.

 

Your contribution will go directly to expanding our learning and furthering our journey to create a new form of green and harmonious living. We are seeking the wisdom of others to inform our work and to build a new collection in our post-graduate career. Our work's aim is to share knowledge and wisdom with its viewers through aesthetics and writings. 
We have a history of creating and showing our work. In the past we have completed murals, installations, photographic series, performance art, books, drawings, paintings, and sculptures. We are experienced cyclists with Raheem having direct experience working and managing a bike shop. We have spent the past two years gathering the equipment necessary to produce the works you will receive.

Our biggest challenge will be biking with our daughter Lily, but we have many tricks up our sleeve! Toddlers require frequent stops so we will bring a kick bike for her when she just can't stand being in her trailer. We will also bring puzzles, snacks, and when all else fails, a kindle. This trip is an opportunity to share the beauty of nature with our daughter and to instill in her a deep reverence for the Earth. The routes we are taking stop by bike shops, campgrounds, parks, and run parallel to an Amtrak train line. If a bike should experience a mechanical problem we are capable and equipped to handle most issues ourselves.

We appreciate you taking the time to hear our pitch. If you make a contribution or if you can't but believe in our message and our work, please share this with your friends and family. If you would like to keep in touch with us, follow and like us on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr.

 

HOUSEOFUQDAH.COM

 

 

Thank You,

We are asking for your support to go on a 2-part bike tour that will educate our viewers and backers about sustainable practices. First, we will bike from Pittsburgh, PA to Washington D.C. for the Climate March, then from D.C. to North Carolina for a Cob Building Course. From there we will fly back to Ohio, where we will celebrate our daughter's birthday. For the second part of our tour, we will bike to Columbus for an Advanced Permaculture Course and up to Wisconsin to receive our Permaculture Design Certification.
At the end of this journey we plan to release a book of writings, photographs, and drawings. These products will exude the essence of the environments we visit as well as the sustainable practices we learn about. Along the way we will film interviews and tutorials as part of our travel vlog. This content will be helpful and transformative for those who desire to live more sustainably.

 

 
We have created 4 Tiers of Investment. These tiers were created with flexible funding in mind. If we only receive $410, we will only travel on the first leg of our journey from Pittsburgh to DC. The next tier will be reached when the funding level reaches $3650 and this will allow us to take the cob building courses in North Carolina. This continues with the third and fourth tier until we become fully funded at which point extra funds would go towards the expansion of our work and business.
 

 
What is the Climate March?
On the 100th Day of the Trump Administration, we will be in the streets of Washington D.C. to show the world and our leaders that we will resist attacks on our people, our communities and our planet. To learn more visit the People's Climate Website.
 
What is Permaculture? 
Permaculture is a system of agricultural and social design principles centered on simulating or directly utilizing the patterns and features observed in natural ecosystems. To learn more visit Midwest Permaculture's Website.
 
What is Cob Building?
Cob, is a natural building material made from subsoil, water, some kind of fibrous organic material (typically straw), and sometimes lime. The contents of subsoil naturally vary, and if it does not contain the right mixture it can be modified with sand or clay. Cob is fireproof, resistant to seismic activity, and inexpensive. To learn more visit Mud Dauber School of Natural Building's Website.
 
Your contribution will go directly to expanding our learning and furthering our journey to create a new form of green and harmonious living. We are seeking the wisdom of others to inform our work and to build a new collection in our post-graduate career. Our work's aim is to share knowledge and wisdom with its viewers through aesthetics and writings. We have a history of creating and showing our work. In the past we have completed murals, installations, photographic series, performance art, books, drawings, paintings, and sculptures. We are experienced cyclists with Raheem having direct experience working and managing a bike shop. We have spent the past two years gathering the equipment necessary to produce the works you will receive.Our biggest challenge will be biking with our daughter Lily, but we have many tricks up our sleeve! Toddlers require frequent stops so we will bring a kick bike for her when she just can't stand being in her trailer. We will also bring puzzles, snacks, and when all else fails, a kindle. This trip is an opportunity to share the beauty of nature with our daughter and to instill in her a deep reverence for the Earth. The routes we are taking stop by bike shops, campgrounds, parks, and run parallel to an Amtrak train line. If a bike should experience a mechanical problem we are capable and equipped to handle most issues ourselves.We appreciate you taking the time to hear our pitch. If you make a contribution or if you can't but believe in our message and our work, please share this with your friends and family. If you would like to keep in touch with us, follow and like us on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr. HOUSEOFUQDAH.COM  Thank You,

story:
Here's what's going to happen....

 

 

 

Dear Friends & Supporters of Dreams,  

I'm asking you to support this project to show that people really do care about sustainable consumerism, parks, and living in a world of beauty and to help me raise at least half if not all of the $30K needed to create the first Environmentally and Community Conscious (TM) Umbrella.

What is so right now is a couple of things

A) millions of disposable umbrellas end up in American landfills each year (most of them are likely because of people who live in NYC)

B)  public city parks across the country and around the world are at threat because of increasing budget cuts and governments who lack foresight.  My big dream is to build public city parks with playgrounds for adults and teenagers, because everybody should enjoy such play.

and

C) millions of people aren’t enjoingy rainy day because they’re carrying depressingly black umbrellas that give no pleasure.  Life's short, why have any gloomy days?  There's no such thing as bad weather, just bad clothing.  

In order to solve these three problems, through my company Amé Amé, which today is a raingear & candy specialty boutique I plan to  create the first Environmentally & Community Conscious  (TM) umbrella.

Regarding how the money will be spent - Every dollar of the $30K earned will be used specifically for the cost of producing the umbrellas.  (Umbrella manufacturers require large minimum orders for a single design and artwork.) 

Some of the perks I am offering, are part of the 110% Heart collection I designed for Amé Amé to inspire people to live their lives with 110% Heart and to really dream, believe, and take action.    

For me the dream is to make beautiful, high quality umbrellas and to build amazing parks.    What's your dream?

Thank you for supporting this project!

Teresa

 

If you're still not convinced you want to support this project or you want to hear more of the story , then please read on...but first a look at some perks

 

Our sweetest perk is $30 of Candy Store Credit, that you can use to fill special candy jars and containers we sell at the store for easy gift buying.  Or just enjoy the candy yourself.  A lot of people don't realize it, but we're a  full on candy store with 100 different premium varieties at any given time.

 

 

 

Or for $200 get yourself $200 worth of gift certificates plus our M11 bag that's perfect for carrying 2 bottles of wine (or the Mac Air 11 inch laptop).  

If you know you will be investing into a Barbour jacket, or some good rain boots, and doing some of holiday shopping for nice gifts this year, then go for the $500 perk, for which you get $600 of gift certificates!  We have all sorts of things.  Ame Ame specializes in umbrellas, other rain wear, and candy but we have lots of other terrific gift items.

 

 

 

The M11 Bag Will Soon Be Coming in our "Sail Through Life Following Your Dreams"  design but instead of a black bag, it will be natural canvas.  

It's for the men and the women who don't like hearts.   It will make for a fun tote to carry wine to your summer BBQ's and parties. Plus you'll be more environmental because you'll be able to stop taking bags at the wine and liquor store.  

 

 

Now for more of the story and my passion....

 

 

 

 

 

How can you not find it sad to see so many umbrellas in the garbage?

Each year millions of umbrellas made of steel or aluminum and petroleum based products go to the landfill (most of which are handmade with sweat shop labor).

  

These umbrellas are bought and used for only a few times before they break because people chose to buy cheap umbrellas for the sake of convenience or because they were fooled into believing they were getting an umbrella of quality or because they simply didn’t know quality umbrellas actually exist.    

And when people carry umbrellas with no style or self-expression and umbrellas that flip inside out with any little breath of wind it makes me sad because I know based on customer feedback they are missing out on an opportunity to enjoy the rain.   

Thus for years I’ve been on a mission to make beautiful umbrellas that reduce our environmental impact and make people love the rain as well as their umbrellas. 

 

  

 

But umbrellas are expensive to make and they have very large minimum order quantities.  Hence up until now I’ve not been able to produce my own umbrellas. 

Now, though, after 10 years of studying what makes a good umbrella and being just 3 months away from the deadline to manufacture umbrellas for next Fall, I’m determined to sell 2000  110% Heart bags  to raise the $30K I need to create my very first order of umbrellas as the first step to having a full line of Amé Amé” umbrellas.

Amé Amé is the name of the East Village New York City store I've had for 14 months.  It translates literally to “rain candy” in Japanese and I think that  on a rainy if you're not at the park dancing in the rain, being at the movies with a good bag of a candy is one of the best alternatives. 

 

 

It’s been such a pleasure having customers love the new experience of a quality, beautiful umbrella as well as Amé Amé's mission to be Environmentally and Community Conscious™.

But without the ability to sell my own umbrellas I’m not walking as much of the walk I could be walking to make the world a better place, and instead talking a lot to sell the umbrellas of other brands.

Furthermore I want to create umbrellas in collaboration with artists so that I can help spread greater appreciation of art and the artists creating such beauty.  I appreciate the work of Monet and Van Gough, but I think it would be better if an umbrella had the art work of somebody alive today. 

 

 

So I hope that you can find a way to support this project. 

Think about the different people who would appreciate a 110% Heart Tote bag this year for a birthday or holiday gift. 

Think about the people in your lives who actually need to be reminded that if they just live their life with 110% Heart the most important part of their dreams will come true.

It took 110% Heart for me to open a raingear and candy business.  Can you believe how many people first thought the idea of selling umbrellas let alone the combo of raingear and candy was crazy?

Well guess what, Amé Amé and I make lots of people happy when they come to shop or browse, and even happier when they realize how wonderful a good umbrella is. 

I hope the challenge I’ve taken on can inspire others, and that’s the final benefit of supporting this campaign. 

When I finally have my self-designed products being carried around (like the 110% Heart merchandise and our future ECC umbrella), I hope to finally inspire others with Amé Amé’s motto

 

Just what is a life of 110% Heart? 

Living a life of 110% Heart means that you are passionate, determined to make a difference in the world, and appreciative of all that you have.

Thank you for supporting this project with any contribution you can afford for the sake of ensuring there are parks and natural resources for tomorrow’s generation.   

Thank you for supporting this project if you like the notion of living life with 110% Heart.

And since you’ve read this far, thank you for helping to spread word of it through facebook postings, tweets, and email blasts and continuing to stay tune as to what we do between March 3rd and the summer Solstice to make a difference in the world in 110 Days with 110% Heart.

Rain or Shine,
Always Smiles,

Teresa S.

 

About the bags desinged and other perks

 

 

These bags you're buying are high quality and made in New Hampshire..

I custom designed their shape to be ergonomic and sensible.  

Carrying them you'll stand taller and avoid aches and pains that other bags often cause.  

Each bag, both the M11 and M18 have zipper close tops and inside big pockets that can fit wallet, keys, phone, AND a mini emergency umbrella.  The pocket also has zip closure so that things stay more secure.

The M11 was designed for the Mac Air 11" but people are loving how it perfectly fits two bottles of wine

Their retail price is $45.  For the indiegogo they go for $55 to include cost of shipping and indiegogo fees.  

  

Screen Print A - for the M18 Bag

 

 

I chose to make a "NYC, the City of 110% Heart"  bag because I see NYC as a city that symbolizes living life with 110% Heart.  I don't think there's any city with more transplant people determined to make their dreams come true.  And I admire NYC and New Yorkers for that fact.  

 If you don't live in NYC I bet you know somebody who dreams of moving to NYC to make dreams come true.  So please consider giving them this bag.

 

Screen Print B (without quote) for the M11

story:
Sharing Innovation for a Planet in Need

When we first started working on the island of Pemba, off the Tanzanian coast, things were different. The entire eastern half of the island was deforested and most of the island's food was imported. Now Pemba is a model of sustainability. Since 2008, one million trees have been planted for fruit, timber and conservation. The soils have been mended and over 100 acres of food producing crops have been sown between rows of planted trees. Drinking water is harvested from the rain and electricity is generated from the sun. Pembans have innovated the way they grow food and how they cook the food they grow.

Pembans have changed their island.

Now it's time we work together to change the world. By sharing Pemba's work with the world we can inspire the scale of environmental change that our planet needs. Through indiegogo, we're trying to raise $8,000 in order to build a Rural Innovation Campus that will allow us to share our work with community leaders from around the world. Based on our past success in Pemba, the European Union wants to continue to support community-led innovation and is prepared to match every dollar we raise with $9. If we raise $8,000, we end up with $80,000.

The Opportunity

We need your help. We've been given the opportunity to build a campus that will allow us to expand our work, but 10% of the funds must be raised through donations. If we don't raise our end of the bargain, we don't get the funds.

Please share our vision. We're flipping the traditional development model upside down by placing rural communities in a role of leadership and expertise. We believe that people around the world can work together to find innovative solutions to some of humanity's toughest challenges. We believe that people can work together to make our world a better place; they just need the chance.

Rural Innovation Campus Concept Design



The Impact

Imagine if the solution to climate change came for the people that need it the most?

Once the Rural Innovation Campus is completed, community leaders from around the world will be able to travel to Pemba, see CFI-style change for themselves and then return home to adapt Pemban innovation to meet their own community needs.

Your funds will go to:

  • Build workshop spaces
  • Provide bursaries for 2,000 Pembans
  • Create demonstration gardens and forests
  • Demonstrate solar energy
  • Establish a model apiary
  • Employ local experts to deliver training
  • Pilot new innovations both on site and within communities
  • Share innovations with the world

Community Forests International is a registered Canadian Charity (registration number is 841459423RR0001). All Canadian donors will receive a charitable receipt for their donation.

Our Vision

We at CFI have always valued our friends, members and supporters for their ideas and their compassion. Please share this campaign with your friends and family. We need your support.

Support

You can also support us by making a charitable donation by mailing a cheque to Community Forests International, 10 School Lane, Sackville, New Brunswick, E4L 3J9.

Thanks for all you've done to make real and tangible change.

story:
Together we can Restore the Shore.

As part of the effort to help rebuild Seaside Heights, New Jersey - the heart of the Jersey Shore, which was devastated by Hurricane Sandy - some of entertainment's biggest stars were part of MTV's "Restore the Shore,". 

The cast of MTV's "Jersey Shore" - as well as stars from other top MTV shows including "Awkward," "Teen Wolf," "Teen Mom," "The Challenge," and "The Real World" - were live in MTV's Times Square studio, calling donors to thank them for giving. Stars contributing messages of support who will be featured on-air include One Direction, Mac Miller, Pharrell, Kim Kardashian, Ne-Yo, Bruno Mars, fun., the Jonas Brothers, All Time Low, Sean Kingston and many more. 

"Restore the Shore" also featured live performances from Gym Class Heroes (with special guest Oh Land) performing the comeback anthem "The Fighter," as well as "American Idol" Season 11 winner Phillip Phillips performing his stirring hit "Home."

Do your part now. Donate $25 or more and receive an exclusive MTV "Restore the Shore" song bundle, which includes 30 songs from the past six seasons of "Jersey Shore."

All funds raised will go to Architecture for Humanity, an internationally recognized non-profit that led rebuilding efforts in New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina and in Haiti after the 2010 earthquake, which is now setting out to help rebuild the famed boardwalk, local businesses and homes in Seaside Heights ravaged by the storm.

story:
Purpose

I Christopher Brown am an environmentalist interested in starting the recycling

center  because it,s the only way to stop over filling the landfills. Since the landfills

are overfilled,  we are taking the  future land from the children and our childern,s

children.  

 As a child, I lived near Dump site.  Since , I lived so close to this dump site, I

became aware of the health dangers and  the psychological  damage that can be

done by living near a dump. Since the landfills are getting bigger and more

are being added by the day, the health dangers increase.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $30,000 to help us open this recycling center.  This will specifically

help us with the purchase of a 26' truck to pick up tires to bring them to the center

and a tire processor to break them down into industry viable raw materials.  In

addition, we plan to create and maintain a web site detailing the principals,

techniques and necessities of modern recycling so that individuals can understand

the impact that the content of or the cleaner and healthier America which will lead to

a better world.

  This is only the first step in a series of developments towards this end in your help

will enable us to bring this endeavor into the solution in a quicker time cycle.

The Impact

As we are continually involved in environmental research we are committed to

developing modern prototypes for effective recycling centers that would do a more

efficient job of making this a trash free country.  For those who help us achieve this

goal by way of their donations, we are offering the following perks which are listed

one the other side.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can,t Afford to Give?

That,s ok! we know that not everyone may not be able to Donate to the cause. If

you can,t make a financial donation at this time. Here are a few ways to get involved

* Head over to our sites

* Like US on facebook and tell friends, family and business owner about our campaign.

*Follow US on Twitter

*Suggest that everyone RECYCLE than sending there waste to the LANDFILL.

the impact that the content of or the cleaner and healthier America which will lead to
a better world.
  This is only the first step in a series of developments towards this end in your help
will enable us to bring this endeavor into the solution in a quicker time cycle.


The Impact
As we are continually involved in environmental research we are committed to
developing modern prototypes for effective recycling centers that would do a more
efficient job of making this a trash free country.  For those who help us achieve this
goal by way of their donations, we are offering the following perks which are listed
one the other side.


Other Ways You Can Help
Can,t Afford to Give?
That,s ok! we know that not everyone may not be able to Donate to the cause. If
you can,t make a financial donation at this time. Here are a few ways to get involved
* Head over to our sites
* Like US on facebook and tell friends, family and business owner about our campaign.
*Follow US on Twitter
*Suggest that everyone RECYCLE than sending there waste to the LANDFILL.

story:
Short Summary

According to a recent survey, the Midwest drought, genetically modified organisms and the lean finely textured beef "pink slime" misnomer take the cake for top trends affecting consumers' food purchasing behavior in 2012.

The survey, commissioned by Hunter Public Relations and conducted by Direct Research, Inc., found that 81% of Americans felt coverage of food products were of equal or greater importance than other news stories this year, HPR says.

watch this excellent video to update the viewer on the GMO FREE Movement GENETIC ROULETTE http://youtu.be/wnlTYFKBg18

GMO FREE HAWAII is a statewide grassroots organiztion that is connecting and reawakening a global consciousness through social media of the corporate greed of transnational companies that are destroying the flora and fauna of cultures that existed for millenia:

  • The health dangers of genetically engineered (GE) foods are masterfully presented in this summary of our media campaign
  • Americans get sick more often than Europeans or people from any other industrialized nation, and scientific evidence suggests a significant factor may be the genetic engineering of our food supply
  • Despite claims by government regulators and the food industry that GE foods are safe, scientific studies continue to show the opposite; GE foods have been linked with allergies, reproductive problems and infertility, birth defects, bizarre mutations, cancer, and now an unidentified mystery organism causing an epidemic of livestock deaths, “Sudden Death Syndrome”
  • GE foods trigger immune attack because they appear to your body as foreign invaders rather than food; this immune response can lead to chronic inflammation, which in turn raises your risk for multiple additional health problems
  • The two main types of GE foods are herbicide-tolerant crops and pesticide-producing crops; both are imprecise processes that are riddled with unexpected consequences, such as hundreds to thousands of genetic mutations that have unknown effects on human health

If you are a member of a COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION have your community association sign on to the statements about a GMO FREE HAWAII ( http://www.facebook.com/HawaiianKiko12 ) that you agree with.

If you are a LEGISLATOR or agricultural decision maker, introduce or support legislation for 5-10 year moratorium on open air releases of GMO crops until longterm, peer reviewed animal, human health, environmental and agricultural studies can be done to ensure Hawaii's protection.  We can help organize testimony from the outer islands.

If you are a FARMER, refuse to grow GMO crops.  Educate other farmers about the problems of GMO farming.  Test your papaya trees and chop down your unwanted GMO trees.  Let your extension agent and legislators know the reasons why you don't want GMO pollen and seed in your growing environment.  Liability for contamination of your crops, loss of markets, high costs of testing, or loss of seed variety lines and ability to save clean seed are among the reasons.  Contact GMO FREE HAWAII for strategies for your industry group to follow to prevent commercial release of a GMO version of your crop such as the coffee and taro industries have done.

If you are a CONSUMER, shop and eat GMO free.  Use the consumer choice guide to help you choose GMO free foods.  When you buy papayas in the market in Hawaii, dispose of the seeds so they can't grow into GMO trees.  Demand labeling of GMO products from your market, manufacturers and governments, so that you can make an informed decision.

If you are a PARENT, feed your family GMO free.  These foods have not received adequate safety testing either by the manufacturer or the government regulatory agencies.  Japan Minister of Health is waiting 10 years and watching U.S. childen to see what the true effects of GMO foods will be.  Schools that feed their children whole foods and have removed GMO foods from the lunch and snack menus have noticed positive change in student behavior.  Contact your child's school and ask for these positive changes.  Check websites to stay abreast of new research on the health issues surrounding GMO foods.

If you are a CITIZEN, speak out.  Write letters to the editor ..this is an easy and direct way that you as an individual can have a big impact on the public discourse that affects policy.  Contact your legislators and let them know that this technology has entered the food chain and the ecosystem without sufficient testing and without your permission.  Ask for a moratorium until it has been adequately tested.  Give volunteer hours or financial support to GMO FREE HAWAII.  Educate yourself and your neighbors about this topic, which is often left out of mainstream news media.

If you are a GARDENER, use GMO free seeds.  Ask your county officials if any GMO crops are being grown or tested in your area with crops (especially corn) that could contaminate your family's garden corn crop.  Test the papaya trees in your yard and chop down GMO contaminated trees.  Save GMO free seed by bagging a flower of a hermaphrodite tree that you have tested and found GMO free.  The seeds of that fruit will be GMO free trees, but may get GMO air contamination in their fruits.  Let your Cooperative Extension office, Master Gardener program, and County and State lawmakers know that you want to garden in a GMO Free Hawaii.

If you are a DOCTOR or healer, educate your patients about the health concerns related to GMO foods and living near GMO crops.  When diagnosing, consider effects of a change from GMO free to GMO ingredients in your patient's diet.  Demand that your local public health department track possible allergic and other responses to ingestion or aerosoliztion of these deadly genes.  These foods have never gone through the normal regulatory channels of animal testing, human testing and post market surveys.

What We Need to Fight the Global Elite ...                               

Initial Funding ( $150,000 )  will be used to achieve certain levels of hardware and acccessories

  • 2012 Toyota Tundra 4X4 crew cab to reach over 60,000 acres of GMO farmland located on former plantation sugar & pineapple fields
  • Digital Cameras ( 2 CANON SLR EOS 7D bodies ) to document GMO activities w/various lenses wide angle, normal, zoom, telephoto
  • Digital Video Cameras ( 2 CANON XH-A1S Professional Camcorder )
  • Post Production Computers & Software to edit multimedia formats for DVD replication and duplication to educate the masses thru social media strategies
  • Parallel Marketing Projects that will be funded:
     media kits consisting of DVD's and printed literature
  • Sponsoring events to educate the public of the GMO movement

The Impact

Last year, GMO labeling passed every single county for Hawaii State Association of Counties except OAHU.  Resolution 12-138 urges University of Hawaii to study the link between neonicotinoid pesticides, gemetically modified organisms and the disappearance of the bees.  Recent studies in France led to a ban of GMO company SYNGENTA's Cruiser pesticide after confirming they contributed to the collapse of the bee colonies.  We need bees to pollinate our food and Hawaii is a leading exporter of Queen Bees worldwide.  The bees are dying, they are disappearing and we need to know why. Resolution 12-138 still has not been assigned a hearing and it was introduced in June 5, 2012.

We will never give up fighting GMO's.  We deserve the right to know what we are eating and whether or not it has been genetically modified.  We deserve to have natural food.  Hawaii and the world must stand up to fight the corporate greed of the multinational food conglomerates...


  • http://www.organicauthority.com/blog/organic/hawaiian-families-sue-duponts-pioneer-over-gmo-crop-dust/ Families on the “Garden Isle” of Kauai are suing the Dupont-owned Pioneer seed company for failure to investigate the danger posed by open air testing of genetically modified crops.
  • GMO Ticking Time Bomb Gary Null Pt 1 http://youtu.be/rAL_AMdMXqY
  • GMO Ticking Time Bomb Gary Null Pt 2 http://youtu.be/sx4Dud0othY
  • GMO Ticking Time Bomb Gary Null Pt 3 http://youtu.be/Ppumc3iavzI
  • GMO Ticking Time Bomb Gary Null Pt 4 http://youtu.be/yakLhePNT2s
  • GMO Ticking Time Bomb Gary Null Pt 5 http://youtu.be/i0JsCr6RZdA
  • http://farmfutures.com/story.aspx/survey-finds-drought-gmo-stories-drove-consumer-behavior-12-17/71800
  • click on link to watch PBS Hawaii INSIGHTS: GMO's         http://youtu.be/DgW1xK9wBSY
  • Pinky Presents: Islands at Risk, GMO's in Hawaii             http://youtu.be/zQDOdnRBLqc
  • The World According to MONSANTO http://youtu.be/N6_DbVdVo-K
  • David versus MONSANTO( The Globalist Slow Kill BioWeapons Division ) http://youtu.be/vwfzYDKd8jk
  • The Truth About Your Food with FOOD,Inc film maker Robert Kenner http://youtu.be/2Oq24hITFTY
  • click on link to watch Jeffrey M Smith: The GMO Threat  http://youtu.be/oPvkZv5MfRw
  • click on link to watch How GMO foods alter organ function and pose a very real health threat to humans http://youtu.be/3N9cDI8YtjA
  • click on link to watch SWEET MISERY Pt 1 A Poisoned World the FDA ASPARTAME CONSPIRACY http://youtu.be/vpbZpgDP2pg
  • click on link to watch SWEET MISERY Pt 2 http://youtu.be/AoriOuvU2Kw
  • click on link to watch A Silent Forest The Growing Threat, Genetically Engineered Trees http://youtu.be/w437uQf_A7c
  • SUGAR:The Bitter Truth  http://youtu.be/dBnniua6-oM
  • FOOD - The Ultimate Secret Exposed http://youtu.be/WMwXlikoFrM
  • SUPERSIZE ME McDonalds Fast Food Documentary http://youtu.be/H-eRXuuH9Al
  • Fast Food World: The Global Food Chain http://youtu.be/AM_PSqjIF0o
  • VANDANA SHIVA on GM Food & MONSANTO  http://youtu.be/Oju86YIOOLI                                                         
  • The New Food Wars: GLOBALIZATION, GMO's, & BIOFUELS http://youtu.be/Iq6jpkDNxtI
  • Food Farming and Genetics with Michael Pollan http://youtu.be/VXiYbbri8YU

Other Ways You Can Help

http://www.politicususa.com/corporate-america-takes-notice-facebook-protesters-rise-gmos.html

In this new era of food convenience, one needs to stop and wonder; what exactly is a GMO? This is a question that deep pocket corporations are consistently trying to avoid. Genetically modified food has taken over the shelves in grocery stores. But that’s only a bit of the issue. The issue is these corporations are standing to secrecy on what is in the product they sell.

Claiming that not labeling ingredients of products is for the greater good of the consumer and we shouldn’t worry. It’s a bit hard to believe any corporation cares more about the safety of the consumer. The General Mills Facebook page has recently demonstrated the lengths they’ll go to keep those ingredients to themselves.

After the discovery of an over $1 million donation to the “No on 37″ prop in California, the GMO Inside Campaign has encouraged Facebook users to visit the Cheerios page and speak their thoughts.

We need the global community to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign...for more real-time data...please goto http://www.facebook.com/HawaiianKiko12 to access GMO FREE HAWAII public page... this will give the global masses a real time assesment of the current situation of the corrupt multinational corporate greed of these GMO companies..

Please goto the Indiegogo share tools page to learn to be more effective...

For direct and current updates we kindly request you to follow and share these social media accounts...thank you

http://www.twitter.com/HawaiianKiko12

http://www.twitter.com/GMO_FREE_HAWAII
