story:
Hello! =D

I'm Daryl and I have a bit of a favour to ask which would help me to help others...But first I'm going to explain a little bit about my intentions, journey and dream!


In a nutshell on the 8th of July I'm going to cycle over 1000miles from England to Portugal promoting sustainability along the way. I will do this firstly via the symbolic act of cycling to Portugal, but I will also have CD's (seeds ;-) with inspiring talks by key players in the fight for sustainable futures that I have recorded from recent events and interviews to give to people along the way.

(I MADE IT IN 21 DAYS!!! Please scroll down to the bottom for pictures)


If you don't ask...you don't get!

I have set up this appeal with the ambition to raise money to pay the fee's for a work placement opportunity I have been given with the Shipibo healers in the amazon rainforest in Peru. There I will get to live life in the jungle, Learn about sustainability jungle style, gain a deeper insight into different issues that we face in the world from the healers and the people directly affected. In particular, helping to free people from addictions and other human conditions. I will try to merge the deeper understanding that I hope to bring back, with the nature of work I have been doing over the years so far to help me get closer to my dream of a community-led Life school.

Money donated doesn't just help me get closer to my dream but goes straight to the healing center for development of facilities and programs. The money is also used to fund external projects fighting the problems that pressure the rainforest each day.

If you would like to know more about my journey, my motivations and my ultimate vision then please read on! =]

WARNING! It's a bit of an essay...but all relevant to express my vision ;)

Fragments of my journey so far...

I'm from Yorkshire originally...A town called Doncaster. Those of you who know about Doncaster will know that it's not the nicest place in the world and my experience of it up until the age of 16 was quite challenging at times. I was a "sweaty" according to the majority of people. A "sweaty" was a name used to disrespect people who were into alternative culture...I had a 9inch Mohawk, a studded jacket and a skateboard and because of this I was chased and even beaten for being different. I couldn't understand why these people could act in such a way just because of a difference in appearance and music tastes...It is safe to say that I did not like these people at all!

By the way I'm not looking for sympathy here...It will all make sense as you read on! ;-)

I did really bad in my school exams...It didn't make sense to me to try and pack my head full of information (That it seemed likely I would never use!) to recall on one day of my life to pass an exam...

Luckily that summer I went on an adventure week away and the leader of the trip saw potential in me and he encouraged me to enroll on a college course in outdoor education...So I did and it was the best decision I ever made!
I loved this path so much that I followed the college course with a degree in outdoor education which I enjoyed in the beautiful land of Cornwall.
During my journey of outdoor education I began to realise just how powerful outdoor education can be when used as a tool for personal growth and for changing behaviour. I wrote my dissertation on "The use of outdoor education as a form of rehabilitation for behaviour" and it all became clear. Through the work on my dissertation and learning how to implement this in the outdoor classroom I learned a lot about the kids I disliked so much for beating down on me for being a "sweaty".

I learned that it's not entirely their fault for acting in this way. It goes much deeper and behaviour of this kind is usually a result of dysfunctional family life and abuse at home.

After I finished my studies I began working within outdoor education and had the privilege to work at a few centres that specialise in working with children from disadvantaged backgrounds, who had challenging behaviour of some kind. For example I would often work with children who had been kicked out of every school they had been to, passed through many different foster homes and this was due to their behaviour. The way the children act and view the world is usually a result of their upbringing, which in most cases is lacking in love, attention and provision from their parents...if they have parents at all. In a lot of cases the parents couldn't provide for them because they had their own problems to deal with like addiction, financial struggles, Psychological issues (in-some cases they would resort to prostitution, gambling, drug dealing etc to fund their existence) and struggle to have the time and commitment for the huge responsibility of parenthood. 

In a lot of cases children with challenging behaviour still live with their parents but unfortunately their parents tend not to be the greatest roll models. This could be because they may have fallen pregnant at an early age which then restricts opportunity for vital growth and the learning of life lessons. This can often result in parents bringing up children without skills and understandings to pass on to the children...The expression "Kids having kids" comes to mind in a lot of cases.

As you can probably see this can become a vicious cycle and there needs to be some form of interception. I believe that the best way to do this is through education and I'm talking about life education. It's clear in today's society that we are quickly forgetting how to look after ourselves, each other and also the beautiful planet that we inhabit.

Eventually I would like fulfill my dream of setting up a life school.

I'd like to see myself and as many inspiring individuals as possible to collectively come together to set up a life skills center to share knowledge and wisdom in all aspects of living and creating, in a way that is most harmonious with the planet.

But before that I want to learn as much as I possibly can!

New found energy...
Over the last 6 years I have had to deal with my own series of mistakes and problems which led to self-destructive behaviour and addictions. I always provided for myself and had a job etc but underneath the smile I had issues that I had a problem facing. I have been very fortunate to have led a very active and inquisitive lifestyle that paved way for vital life lessons. These lessons provided the perfect insight that I needed to really question the nature and the reality of my issues. This gave me a new perspective which allowed me to make the necessary changes to myself to kick the additions and bad habits without help and as of July I will have gone half a year free from my Bane! :D

So basically...

I want to use my new found energy that I suppressed for so long by being as active as I can in ironing out the creases of today's world and by taking the opportunity I have been given to go to the amazon to work alongside the Shipibo healers to gain deeper insight. I want to understand the problems we face today (addiction, self-worth, depression, attachments, depletion of natural resources, sustainability etc...) from the perspective of the humbly wise and knowledgeable shamans and the individuals who seek healing.

I'm hoping that pursuing this journey will provide me with a deeper understanding of the human condition and sustainability that I can combine with my understanding and use of outdoor education so far. It will help with future work with people of all walks of life but particularly the human condition and the interception of the vicious cycle.

I don't claim to have all the answers...nor do I think I'm going to change the world with the journey ahead. However I feel that I have a responsibility to do everything possible with my energy and understandings to learn as much as I possibly can to help the beautiful planet and it's beautiful inhabitants in ANY way I can!

If you have made it this far...

Thank you for giving me the chance to share my vision and my journey that inspired me to embark on this adventure. If you share my vision and can contribute in any way I would be so so grateful!

You maybe thinking "Well that looks like an expensive bit of equipment you have there...why didn't you just use the money spent on that to pay for the fee's?!"

Almost all of the equipment that will enable me to complete this journey has been kindly donated to me by amazing people who share my vision...and the bike was a bit of a "God send"...No way would I have been able to afford this bike new...Not even the 2nd hand ones I saw on ebay. Somehow on my tiresome search for the bike, I found "the one I thought I'd never have" lurking in the deep depths of a cycling forum for a fraction of the price!!!

More and more I get the feeling that the universe delivers just whats necessary, when necessary.

Most people may cancel the trip at this point if they had a bank balance anything like mine right now but everything has been happening so perfectly....I'm prepared to take the risk!

I will also have reward packs for donations over £5 which are:

A choice of:

  • Dawning Dartington: Recordings of birds waking up that I recorded at Dartington gardens, Devon. (Tranquil listening/For use in music production).
  • Digital Desolation: Sounds of an empty factory...A sample pack that would sound great used within techno and other deep electronic music production.
  • Seeds of sustainability: Recordings of key speakers and authors on sustainable futures. Featuring Polly Higgins (A legal expert on the law of Ecocide and author of award-winning Eradicating Ecocide and Earth is our Business.),  Julian Pratt (Author of Stewardship Economy: Private Property without Private Ownership), Tim Williams (inspirational speaker and environmental activist) and others!

These will be downloadable by donators via the internet.

Where the money goes...
The money raised will go straight to paying only the placement fees so that I can pursue my self-initiated journey of education.

How I will put this experience to use:

  • I will combine the new knowledge and understanding along with my personal experience to work in rehabilitation projects to help people overcome their addiction.
  • Gaining experience in this field will compliment my current skill set and will allow me to help not just young people with challenging behavior but also to work with adults with addictions which is often a key factor within dysfunctional families.
  • I will hopefully be able to find the time to compile all that I learn and document into some kind of journal so that anybody interested can also benefit and learn from my educational journey.
  • I will be able to incorporate all knowledge and skills regarding permaculture, sustainability, diet, natural health care, mental health care and more into potential syllabus at the center for life skills which intend to make a reality of the future.


How the healing centre will use the money...

The money then gets spent on developing the healing center and the programs they provide. It also provides funding for external community projects that help fight the problems that the rainforest and the inhabitants face.

Read more about how they spend the money here:http://templeofthewayoflight.org/temple-info/do...

Over 75% of the Peruvian Amazon has been licensed to oil companies for exploration as well as other extractive industries who are escalating deforestation to dangerous levels. Transnational corporations are sucking the resources out of the Amazon with no foresight as to the dire consequences. These and other destructive practices based on profit-driven development models are dangerously threatening the world’s greatest rainforest."

I'm not holding any expectations of the amount of funds I may raise through this appeal...after all, everything is happening perfectly as it should be!

I MADE IT!!!

Words alone can not express how incredible the journey has been...
It has been one of/if not the most incredibly challenging, magical, exciting, educational, spiritual and fullfilling experiences of my life so far!

I have met the most amazing people and have seen such a deeper side of people and each country along the way.

People are amazing...WE are amazing! and we have SO much potential!

I was doing between 100-150k most days and even managed 342k in the last 2 days which almost killed me!

AND I even made it over the Pyrenees mountains! (see pics below!) Something I didn't think I would manage due to problems with my knee in France.

I am still in Portugal on my journey at the moment but I will write about my experiences in depth when I return to the UK....Some really crazy and beautiful things happened!!!

I will carry on with my journey doing more of the same and will probably finish in Santander in Spain around the 10th september where I will get a ferry back to Plymouth.

Unfortunately it's been incredibly hard to give this project the kind of promotion it needs to have a chance of reaching the goal so I will have to work very hard when I get back to the uk to raise the remaining fees...However after the journey I have had and the people I have reached,.,.I feel like I achieved my goal =)

If you can help by donating or even by helping me to promote this project I would be very grateful!

Some pictures of the journey:


Great sence of achievement stood right there!

I met so many incredible people along the way! These lovely folk I met in a tiny town in the hills of Brittany...I originally planned to pass straight through the town  but I had a strange feeling inside telling me to go and explore! I heard an English accent across the market square so I took advantage of the easy conversation as I may go days without. When I explained what I was doing Harvey asked me my name and when I told him his face dropped! It turns out he had read about my mission on facebook the week before and they insisted that I stay with them the night and have a room in their hotel! This is just one example of the crazy ways I met beautiful generous people who shared my vision!

A school group that I spoke with and hopefully inspired along the way in France.

Youth workers of a group that I spoke with along the way.

Fisher folk who took me in for the night on the way to Nante in France.

Planting seeds in Josselin, France.

Wild camping with guests, Southwest France.


The view from the top of the Pyrenees mountain (Spannish side).

In the clouds near the top of the Pyrenees.

Planting more seeds in Spain.

Beautiful advice!
story_txt:
Hello! =D

I'm Daryl and I have a bit of a favour to ask which would help me to help
 others...But first I'm going to explain a little bit about my 
intentions, journey and dream!

In a nutshell on the 8th of July I'm going to cycle over 1000miles from England to Portugal promoting sustainability along the way. I will do this firstly via the symbolic act of cycling to Portugal, but I will also have CD's (seeds ;-) with inspiring talks by key players in the fight for sustainable futures that I have recorded from recent events and interviews to give to people along the way.
(I MADE IT IN 21 DAYS!!! Please scroll down to the bottom for pictures)
If you don't ask...you don't get!I have set up this appeal with the ambition to raise money to pay the fee's for a work placement opportunity I have been given with the Shipibo healers in the amazon rainforest in Peru. There I will get to live life in the jungle, Learn about sustainability jungle style, gain a deeper insight into different issues that we face in the world from the healers and the people directly affected. In particular, helping to free people from addictions and other human conditions. I will try to merge the deeper understanding that I hope to bring back, with the nature of work I have been doing over the years so far to help me get closer to my dream of a community-led Life school.Money donated doesn't just help me get closer to my dream but goes straight to the healing center for development of facilities and programs. The money is also used to fund external projects fighting the problems that pressure the 
rainforest each day.If you would like to know more about my journey, my motivations and my ultimate vision then please read on! =]
WARNING! It's a bit of an essay...but all relevant to express my vision ;)Fragments of my journey so far...
I'm from Yorkshire originally...A town called Doncaster. Those of you who know about Doncaster will know that it's not the nicest place in the world and my experience of it up until the age of 16 was quite challenging at times. I was a "sweaty" according to the majority of people. A "sweaty" was a name used to disrespect people who were into alternative culture...I had a 9inch Mohawk, a studded jacket and a skateboard and because of this I was chased and even beaten for being different. I couldn't understand why these people could act in such a way just because of a difference in appearance and music tastes...It is safe to say that I did not like these people at all!By the way I'm not looking for sympathy here...It will all make sense as you read on! ;-)I did really bad in my school exams...It didn't make sense to me to try and pack my head full of information (That it seemed likely I
would never use!) to recall on one day of my life to pass an exam...Luckily that summer I went on an adventure week away and the leader of the trip saw potential in me and he encouraged me to enroll on a college course in outdoor education...So I did and it was the best decision I ever made!I loved this path so much that I followed the college course with a degree in outdoor education which I enjoyed in the beautiful land of Cornwall. During my journey of outdoor education I began to realise just how powerful outdoor education can be when used as a tool for personal growth and for changing behaviour. I wrote my dissertation on "The use of outdoor education as a form of rehabilitation for behaviour" and it all became clear. Through the work on my dissertation and learning how to implement this in the outdoor classroom I learned a lot about the kids I disliked so much for beating down on me for being a "sweaty".I learned that it's not entirely their fault for acting in this way. It goes much deeper and behaviour of this kind is usually a result of dysfunctional family life and abuse at home. After I finished my studies I began working within outdoor education and had the privilege to work at a few centres that specialise in working with children from disadvantaged backgrounds, who had challenging behaviour of some kind. For example I would often work with children who had been kicked out of every school they had been to, passed through many different foster homes and this was due to their behaviour. The way the children act and view the world is usually a result of their upbringing, which in most cases is lacking in love, attention and provision from their parents...if they have parents at all. In a lot of cases the parents couldn't provide for them because they had their own problems to deal with like addiction, financial struggles, Psychological issues (in-some cases they would resort to prostitution, gambling, drug dealing etc to fund their existence) and struggle to have the time and commitment for the huge responsibility of parenthood. 
In a lot of cases children with challenging behaviour still live with their parents but unfortunately their parents tend not to be the greatest roll models. This could be because they may have fallen pregnant at an early age which then restricts opportunity for vital growth and the learning of life lessons. This can often result in parents bringing up children without skills and understandings to pass on to the children...The expression "Kids having kids" comes to mind in a lot of cases.As you can probably see this can become a vicious cycle and there needs to be some form of interception. I believe that the best way to do this is through education and I'm talking about life education. It's clear in today's society that we are quickly forgetting how to look after ourselves, each other and also the beautiful planet that we inhabit.Eventually I would like fulfill my dream of setting up a life school. 
I'd like to see myself and as many inspiring individuals as possible to collectively come together to set up a life skills center to share knowledge and wisdom in all aspects of living and creating, in a way that is most harmonious with the planet.But before that I want to learn as much as I possibly can!New found energy...Over the last 6 years I have had to deal with my own series of mistakes and problems which led to self-destructive behaviour and addictions. I always provided for myself and had a job etc but underneath the smile I had issues that I had a problem facing. I have been very fortunate to have led a very active and inquisitive lifestyle that paved way for vital life lessons. These lessons provided the perfect insight that I needed to really question the nature and the reality of my issues. This gave me a new perspective which allowed me to make the necessary changes to myself to kick the additions and bad habits without help and as of July I will have gone half a year free from my Bane! :DSo basically...I want to use my new found energy that I suppressed for so long by being as active as I can in ironing out the creases of today's world and by taking the opportunity I have been given to go to the amazon to work alongside the Shipibo healers to gain deeper insight. I want to understand the problems we face today (addiction, self-worth, depression, attachments, depletion of natural resources, sustainability etc...) from the perspective of the humbly wise and knowledgeable shamans and the individuals who seek healing. I'm hoping that pursuing this journey will provide me with a deeper understanding of the human condition and sustainability that I can combine with my understanding and use of outdoor education so far. It will help with future work with people of all walks of life but particularly the human condition and the interception of the vicious cycle. I don't claim to have all the answers...nor do I think I'm going to change the world with the journey ahead. However I feel that I have a responsibility to do everything possible with my energy and understandings to learn as much as I possibly can to help the beautiful planet and it's beautiful inhabitants in ANY way I can! If you have made it this far...
 Thank you for giving me the chance to share my vision and my journey that inspired me to embark on this adventure. If you share my vision and can contribute in any way I would be so so grateful!You maybe thinking "Well that looks like an expensive bit of equipment you have there...why didn't you just use the money spent on that to pay for the fee's?!"Almost all of the equipment that will enable me to complete this journey has been kindly donated to me by amazing people who share my vision...and the bike was a bit of a "God send"...No way would I have been able to afford this bike new...Not even the 2nd hand ones I saw on ebay. Somehow on my tiresome search for the bike, I found "the one I thought I'd never have" lurking in the deep depths of a cycling forum for a fraction of the price!!! More and more I get the feeling that the universe delivers just whats necessary, when necessary.Most people may cancel the trip at this point if they had a bank balance anything like mine right now but everything has been happening so perfectly....I'm prepared to take the risk!I will also have reward packs for donations over £5 which are:A choice of:


Dawning Dartington: Recordings of birds waking up that I recorded at Dartington gardens, Devon. (Tranquil listening/For use in music production).

Digital Desolation: Sounds of an empty factory...A sample pack that would sound great used within techno and other deep electronic music production.


Seeds of sustainability: Recordings of key speakers and authors on sustainable futures. Featuring Polly Higgins (A legal expert on the law of Ecocide and author of award-winning Eradicating Ecocide and Earth is our Business.),  Julian Pratt (Author of Stewardship Economy: Private Property without Private Ownership), Tim Williams (inspirational speaker and environmental activist) and others!


These will be downloadable by donators via the internet.Where the money goes...The money raised will go straight to paying only the placement fees so that I can pursue my self-initiated journey of education. How I will put this experience to use:

I will combine the new knowledge and understanding along with my personal experience to work in rehabilitation projects to help people overcome their addiction. 

Gaining experience in this field will compliment my current skill set and will allow me to help not just young people with challenging behavior but also to work with adults with addictions which is often a key factor within dysfunctional families.

I will hopefully be able to find the time to compile all that I learn and document into some kind of journal so that anybody interested can also benefit and learn from my educational journey.
I will be able to incorporate all knowledge and skills regarding permaculture, sustainability, diet, natural health care, mental health care and more into potential syllabus at the center for life skills which intend to make a reality of the future.


How the healing centre will use the money...The money then gets spent on developing the healing center and the programs they provide. It also provides funding for external community projects that help fight the problems that the rainforest and the inhabitants face.Read more about how they spend the money here:http://templeofthewayoflight.org/temple-info/do...

...weigelrn.blogspot.com
"There is an immense crisis here that most people across the planet are 
not aware off nor are they aware of the consequences to humanity if the 
destruction is allowed to continue. Over 75% of the Peruvian Amazon has 
been licensed to oil companies for exploration as well as other 
extractive industries who are escalating deforestation to dangerous 
levels. Transnational corporations are sucking the resources out of the 
Amazon with no foresight as to the dire consequences. These and other 
destructive practices based on profit-driven development models are 
dangerously threatening the world’s greatest rainforest."
(Quote: http://templeofthewayoflight.org/temple-info/do...)

I'm not holding any expectations of the amount of funds I may raise through this appeal...after all, everything is happening perfectly as it should be! If I don't reach total amount needed...Be assured I will work hard upon my return from the bicycle journey to earn all the money I need to make this happen!Hugs, Daryl =]<3Credit for the awesome art work goes to my super talented cousin Melissa Quinnwww.facebook.com/MelissaQuinnarthttps://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/MelissaKathleenQuinn Conceptual design by myself.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Djahane Salehabadi and I graduated with a PhD in Development Sociology (and a minor in Science and Technology Studies) from Cornell University in May 2014. The connection between the environment, technology and development forms the basis of my teaching and research interests. Within this larger context, my  research carefully examines the global afterlives of digital technologies such as cell phones, computers and MP3 players . In other words, I look at what happens to your digital devices once you throw them away.

I am asking for your support to publish my findings. I have presented my work at various conferences in Europe and North America over the past few years.  A number of colleagues and mentors have repeatedly encouraged me to publish my findings in academic journals. Unfortunately, I applied to a couple of post-doc grants but I did not get them (ironically because I do not have enough publications). This is why I am turning to you. I am looking for sponsors who will either gift a couple of hours of working time or lend me the money until I can get a job and pay you back. I have drafts of six articles in various stages of completion.

The story that emerged out of the two years of ethnographic and archival research I conducted is fascinatingly complex. It also makes important theoretical and methodological contributions to the fields of environmental sociology and science and technology studies. My research is not just academic, however. In a time when countries across the globe are struggling to manage their discarded technologies, my study  offers important clues to the challenges associated with developing efficient and responsible e-waste management systems.

I really want to share my ideas and data with a wider audience. Moreover, I just taught a class for masters students in the Environmental Governance Program at the University of Freiburg, and I realized that being a professor would be my dream job. Without more publications I don't stand a chance for an academic job or research grant.

I find it extremely awkward to ask for money, especially since I am aware that pretty much everyone has a legitimate reason to ask for funding. However, I am motivated to get my articles out, so I am swallowing my pride and asking for help.  I hope that nobody feels in any way obliged to contribute, though.


Thanks for your consideration!

Djahane

What I Need & What You Get

I estimate that I need about 150 hours  to get my papers ready for submission.  At the moment, we are living in Germany because Martin (my husband) was awarded a research grant by the European Union. Martin makes enough as a postdoc for the next 18 months to support our family. However, we can just cover our day-to-day living expenses. We cannot afford to hire a babysitter. Without more childcare, however, I don't have time to write. I will spend the money I will raise through this campaign will be spent on childcare and, to a lesser extend, on follow up research to complete my papers.

The Impact

My research examines the politics and practices of contemporary management of waste from electrical and electronic equipment (e-waste or WEEE) originating in Germany. Contrary to predictions that the digital revolution would lead to less resource-intensive and thus more environmentally sustainable societies, it is becoming increasingly apparent that high-tech lifestyles are not as clean and green as many would like to believe. In fact, global consumption of digital technologies such as personal computers, cell phones and iPods is exacting significant environmental and health costs. Through ethnographic and archival research this project reconstructs how social actors, ranging from policymakers to multi-national recycling firms to informal recyclers, transform discarded technologies once they are placed on the curb in Germany. Drawing on this empirical work this analysis shows how the environmental and social impact of a technological artifact extends over its entire lifecycle.

Germany’s reputation as a model when it comes to waste management and environmentalism more generally, coupled with its status as Europe’s largest e-waste producer and exporter, make it a particularly powerful site to understand the tensions and contradictions between national attempts to address the problem of e-waste and the existence of globalized licit and illicit e-waste networks that unequally distribute the pollution and wealth associated with the recycling and reuse of discarded technologies across the globe.

Located at the intersection of Science and Technology Studies and Development Sociology, this project integrates, builds on and extends scholarship in these two complementary fields to address the issue of e-waste in Germany. Such an integration is necessary to analyze how the afterlife of electrical and electronic equipment is shaped by and reinforces uneven global political, economic and ecological relationships in a postcolonial context. Equally important, this work engages with recent debates in the social sciences on the boundaries between technology, society and ecology, the co-production of the social and the material, as well as the relationship between globalization and the environment, and reworks and extends key concepts in sociology and the social studies such as fetishization, the black box, technological systems and regimes of perceptibility. It also introduces new concepts including the notion of “unmaking” and “the green box.

”In a time when countries across the globe are struggling to manage their e-waste, this study of Germany offers important clues to the challenges associated with developing efficient and responsible e-waste management systems. Furthermore, this project provides a concrete ethnographic and archival study of the effects and limitations of national formulations of environmental policies in an uneven globalized economy.

The idea of systems is quite popular among social scientists and the general public . Too often, however, understandings of systems tend to overlook the afterlives of commodities, viewing them as irrelevant to a systems approach. My research posits that systems analysis must take into account complex networks of production and what I refer to as “transnational networks of unmaking” that involves humans, the environment and technologies across the globe, mediated through an international economy and national and international policies. The quantity of unwanted stuff is growing exponentially across the globe, and my research posits that by incorporating a more complete accounting of the life of products, and the extended markets and production processes involved, we can provide a more realistic and nuanced analysis of the social and environmental impacts of our consumption of digital technologies.


Risks & Challenges

Of course, it's not sure that the articles I submit will be published, and in this tight academic job market there are no guarantees that I would get a job even if all six of my proposed papers were accepted. Nevertheless, I need to give this a shot. I recently taught a class for masters students in the Environmental Governance Program at the University of Freiburg, and I realized that being a professor would, in many ways, be my dream job. And even if I don't get a job after all this work, publishing my findings feels like the last step in the dissertation process--like I'd fully complete my 10 -year endeavor.  I think that once my work and ideas are out there, I could more easily move on if a professor job is not in the cards for me. Besides, I am convinced that what I have to share would make important contributions to the fields of environmental sociology, science and technology studies and discard studies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money there are other ways you can help.
You can:
-Spread the word about my project
-Read drafts of my papers and provide me with feedback
-Do copyediting
-Help with formatting
-Proof read

  Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't contribute money there are other ways you can help.You can:-Spread the word about my project-Read drafts of my papers and provide me with feedback-Do copyediting-Help with formatting-Proof read

story:
Short Summary

                    Hello Indiegogo!! We are SLIE or Sustainable Living and Interconnected Education, a Non-Profit organization, built around, green or sustainable living, education in the community and of course nature! We are a family of 4 who have decided the best way to spread the word about living green is to be a living example ourselves. We started SLIE as a means of outreach and connection to the community around us to interact with like minded individuals and share our knowledge and experience with one another. We have just re-located to Lehigh Acres, FL and are currently converting our thirsty lawn into a food producing, lush garden, with TONS of Non-GMO,pesticide free AND Organic plants to live off of. We will expand into aquaponics, rain water collection, and small farm animals to aid in food production in the future. LIKE us on Facebook to keep up on all our recent activities, and future workshops for when you are in the SW Florida area HERE.
                   At this point, we work with community members, and FGCU (Florida Gulf Coast University) students as volunteers, however the school has just recently changed their criteria for approved service learning organizations, requiring that they have their 501(c)3 Non-Profit tax status. Despite this drawback, we are determined to acquire the status we need, and continue our work with the students, and members of the community. This is our main goal of the campaign. The 501(c)3 status is essentially just a payment that must be made each year to offset the taxes 501(c)3 Non-Profit organizations are exempt from.  The second portion of the campaign is to create a sign for our property to show the world where we are and what we do! (This is an afterthought since the minimum campaign amount is $500, but the 501(c)3 status is only $400, and we decided this would be a great use of the extra funds we have left over.) We purchase almost all our plants, gardening tools and project materials ourselves, so we are a bit stretched for funds at this time, which is where YOU the Indiegogo crowd comes in!


What We Need & What You Get

                     As I said, our main goal for the campaign is to get the funds we need to become a 501(c)3 Non-Profit organization. We ARE currently a non-profit organization, essentially we just aren't tax free, (it costs more money). Having this tax status, will help us in our work of sustainable teachings and workshops, by working with other businesses to secure material donations, volunteer hours, and of course the tax free status when we purchase materials ourselves. Of the $500 we need, $400 will immediately go toward our 501(c)3 status. The remaining $100, should we meet our goal, will go toward the creation of a sign for our property, proclaiming for any who see it who we are and what we do. Anything made above and beyond our goal will go straight toward the creation of our sustainable property, mainly plants, soil, building materials for raised planters, drip irrigation, rain barrels, etc. We have MANY projects planned for the future, and this is one of the only things holding us back from jumping in head first.


                 The perks we offer aren't huge and flashy as some are on this site, after all, we are only a 2 person organization (3 if you count our 2 children as 1/2 a person each, they are 1 and 5 years old) but we hope you'll appreciate them, since we so appreciate your interest and assistance! Above all our goal as an education based organization is to share knowledge with any and all people who are willing to learn. We will put together a personalized, handwritten thank you note as one of our perks. Another will be heirloom seeds, to start your own food producing garden, and a third will be a small, but information packed guide filled with a Florida planting chart, and small things ANYONE can do toward the goal of living a healthy, sustainable life.


                       If by some chance we don't meet our goal of $500, the money will go into our savings, until we can make up the difference and get our 501(c)3 status, as it is currently the main goal of our organization.


The Impact

                    Your contribution to our campaign will be making a HUGE difference for us! We may be a small organization but we have big hearts and even bigger goals. We will help teach the younger generations the value of working WITH the planet not against it, to produce an environmentally aware and respecting future for the world.

                   

Risks & Challenges

                     Our biggest hurdles right now are cost. We support our Non-Profit on our own without external assistance, because self sufficiency is part of what we strive for. However we know that asking for help when we need it isn't a bad thing, and it gives other people the chance to be a part of something great for the world.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are interested in our organization and the work we do, but unable to contribute financially, we completely understand! If you'd still like to help out in some way, share this campaign with your friends, like and share our Facebook page, HERE to help us spread the word! We welcome any and all to contact us if they are in the area to see first hand the work we are doing and if they so wish to volunteer time and/or materials to upcoming projects as well. Thank you everyone SO MUCH in advance. See you in the garden!

story:
Thanks to everyone that has donated!  We hope to get a good start with the funds that have been raised.  To donate to AARC after this campaign's deadline, please contact Ian Kanda by email at jarico.spock@shaw.ca.

AARC's goal is to conserve Alberta's amphibians and reptiles.  It starts with this garter snake hibernaculum.

The Lake Eden Gartersnake Den is a place where people come to appreciate and learn about nature as they experience the spring snake emergence.  The snakes appear when the snow melts at the base of an unassuming pile of rocks.  They gather in the warmth of the sun to mate before they disperse for the summer.

A population count was done in 1999 when snakes were introduced from another den threatened from development.  Considerable anecdotal evidence suggests that the current population is only a fraction of what it once was. 

AARC needs to properly assess the current population to best protect it in the future.  While doing so, we would like to microchip a portion of the population to allow for further monitoring and study.

WE NEED MONEY FOR:

A drift fence - rebar, poly = $330

Humane snake traps - plywood, hardware cloth, hinges = $220

Microchips (100-500 funds dependent) = $237-1185

Microchip scanner $1000

Fuel Costs - estimate based on 2 visits/day x 3wks = $2100

All labour is done on a volunteer basis and we work hard to find the best prices on materials and equipment.  If we have any extra money it will go towards upgrading fencing, informational signage, and other conservation and fundraising initiatives.

Your donation will go a long way towards saving this population of snakes.

 

The Edmonton Reptile and Amphibian Society (ERAS) has a good write-up about this garter snake den.  http://www.edmontonreptiles.com/hibernaculum.html

The AARC formed in 2013 following a meeting hosted by the ERAS where a need for amphibian and reptile targeted conservation was identified.  We recently registered as a Not For Profit Society and are working towards gaining our charitable status.  With a small core of dedicated volunteers we are working hard to make a difference.  Please help us!  A financial donation is the most immediate means in which you can help.  We understand this is not possible for everyone, so please share this fundraiser on facebook and your email list.  Keep us in mind, and say hi if you see us at a reptile expo or in the field.

story:
Français            Română                       

WE FOUND LAND!!! - A piece of agricultural land located just outside of Cluj-Napoca, Romania.

Eco Ruralis has been given the rights to farm a beautiful parcel of land by one of our members for FREE. We began our land search 2 months ago and we finally found a suitable area to farm. Its close proximity to the city allows volunteers easy access to bicycle there or take local bus transportation. We now need your help to make our dream of making a large traditional heirloom seed garden a reality.

WHAT IS ECO RURALIS? - A non-profit NGO that supports traditional and organic peasant farming.

Our office is based in Cluj-Napoca, located in the Transylvania region of Romania. In 2009, a group of small family farmers came together from several regions of the country to form our organization. Participation in Eco Ruralis has grown to include 250 families and over 500 members altogether. Members and staff have formed strong bonds and what brings us together is our mutual passion for continuing small-scale sustainable agriculture with the use of heirloom seeds. Our organization truly believes that seed sovereignty provides food sovereignty.

OUR PROBLEM - Less use of traditional seeds produces less healthy, organic food.

Many rules and regulations have limited the use of traditional seeds. Large, often multinational corporations produce and promote lots of hybrid seeds and GMO's in general, and their control of the seed market limits the use of traditional seeds. The health and environmental impact caused by this has been documented very well. This affects food security and we are fighting back.

OUR SOLUTION - To plant, collect and distribute as many heirloom seeds as possible!

Many of our members save their seeds and send them to us after harvesting. At the end of each season, we build up a bigger inventory and distribute more and more. We will also give more people an opportunity to gain gardening experience and educate them on how they can save seeds. Farming is direct action - 90% of our garden will be used for seeds, 10% will be used for vegetables.

EXPERIENCE - We have multiplied traditional seeds at a university garden over the past 3 years.

A local professor of agro-biodiversity works with Eco Ruralis staff and volunteers as well as agronomy students to multiply and collect heirloom seeds at their university. This experience has been truly beneficial, providing us with useful skills for seed saving and cultivation. It made us realize what we could do with our own larger garden. That chapter of our story will begin soon :)

  • Plow and shred the land
  • Select and transport tools
  • Create a well
  • Prepare the land for sowing
  • Plant seeds and seedlings
  • Workshops on seed planting, garden maintenance
  • Tend the garden
  • Harvest seeds and vegetables
  • Workshops on seed-saving
  • Cataloguing the seeds into our database
  • Preparing the seeds for distribution

HOW THE FUNDING WILL BE USED

  • annual land tax
  • plowing and shredding the land
  • purchasing tools and materials for the garden
  • contracting someone to build a well (paying for the labor and materials)

***Note: If we don't raise all the funds, don't worry we will still plant the seeds and build the garden.

WE NEED YOU!!! - Remember, we will only be able to do a few of the things mentioned in our plan if we don't reach our goal, so please DONATE today! ANY AMOUNT is greatly appreciated!

In order to create a successful campaign, we need your support. We ask all of you to "LIKE" this campaign, share it on Facebook and Twitter ... and please write comments here! New ideas for what we can do in the garden are welcome too. Click on the links below for more information and photos.

Facebook              Eco Ruralis Website (English) (Română)              Flickr Photos

THE TEAM - Our team is funny, sweet, helpful and super passionate about subsistence farming. 

Eco Ruralis is the national coordinator of WWOOF Romania (World Wide Opportunities on Organic Farms). All of us have volunteered in gardens and on farms. Some of us even grew up on farms and helped with family gardens. We all love learning the rich knowledge that peasants and other farmers possess so that we can eat delicious, healthy food. Each day, we hope to utilize that know-how as best we can to better protect the proud social and cultural heritage of Romanian peasant agriculture.

story:
Klik hiernaast op de rechthoek, vul je gegevens in, doneer € 20 en ontvang op de eerste lentedag van 2015 dit meest complete, praktische en persoonlijke kruidenboek!

Of stort €20 op rekening NL72TRIO0197741584 t.n.v. Plantenliefde, vermeld je e-mailadres bij je overschrijving en ontvang het kruidenboek op de eerste lentedag van 2015.

>>>klik hier voor een preview van het kruidenboek

Het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid is uniek, omdat:

- alle informatie over ruim 40 planten erin staat (kenmerken, verzorging, kweekwijze, oogst, gebruik)

- er 100 eenvoudige recepten in staan

- het diverse registers en indexen bevat, zodat je de informatie gemakkelijk kunt terugvinden

- er informatie in staat over oogsten en drogen

- het een alfabetische woordenlijst bevat van alle gebruikte termen duidelijk uitgelegd, zodat je geen voorkennis nodig hebt

- het handig en licht is (16 x 21 cm.)

- het een ringband heeft en daardoor open blijft liggen op de gekozen bladzijde

- er een oogstkalender in staat

- er ruimte is voor je eigen ervaringen en recepten

- het prachtige illustraties bevat

Wie ben ik?

Ik ben Martine Verweij en ik heb een intens en diep contact met de natuur en dat gun ik jou ook zo!

Vanuit mijn liefde voor de natuur heb ik het bedrijf Plantenliefde opgericht. Met Plantenliefde wil ik de natuur dichterbij brengen, zodat we weer in harmonie leven met de natuur.

Ik heb natuurgeneeskunde en fytotherapie gestudeerd, waardoor ik weet hoe je met kruiden gezond blijft. Ook heb ik de opleiding tot herborist gevolgd, waardoor ik kennis en vaardigheden heb over het oogsten en verwerken van kruiden, zoals het maken van tincturen, siropen en crèmes.

Waarom dit project?

De natuur wil ik dichterbij brengen door kennis over het gebruik van planten, struiken en bomen toegankelijk te maken voor iedereen.

Met het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid dat ik heb geschreven en geïllustreerd, wil ik de kennis en vaardigheden over het gebruik van het plantenrijk voor iedereen toegankelijk maken. De informatie die erin staat, is voor iedereen toegankelijk, omdat je geen voorkennis nodig hebt.

Als je kennis hebt van de natuur, dan zie je meer en voel je je vertrouwd met de natuur. Als je weet welke planten je kunt eten, welke planten giftig zijn en welke planten geneeskrachtig zijn, dan kun je zonder angst en met vertrouwen contact maken met de natuur en ervaar je een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur.

Waarvoor heb ik je steun nodig?

Ik heb jou steun nodig om het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid te kunnen laten drukken en te verzenden.

In 2013 heb ik 100 exemplaren van dit kruidenboek laten drukken en verzonden, maar ik wil zo graag meer mensen bereiken met mijn kruidenboek. Zodat jij en ieder mens een intenser en dieper contact met de natuur kunt ervaren. En meer mensen de natuur respecteren en liefhebben.

Wat krijg je als je me steunt?

Als je me steunt heb ik een aantal fantastische beloningen voor je.

(Wil je me steunen, maar weet je niet precies hoe? Stuur me een e-mail martine@plantenliefde.nl en ik help je.)

Als je me steunt met € 5 of meer, dan krijg je een e-book met mijn ervaringen over het gebruik van planten bij:
- hoofdpijn
- ontstekingen
- slapeloosheid
- buikpijn
- menstruatiepijn
- huidproblemen
- hoest



Als je me steunt met € 100 of meer, dan ontvang je een gesigneerd exemplaar van het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid én je ontvangt een tekening uit het boek op canvas.

Alle tekeningen in het kruidenboek heb ik zelf met de hand getekend. De mooiste tekeningen heb ik uitgekozen om voor jou op canvas te laten drukken. Het formaat van de schilderijen is 30 x 30 cm. Je kunt kiezen uit: Walnoot, Jasmijn, Hop, Vlier, Meidoorn, Zwarte bes.

Doneer €250 of meer en ik neem je mee op een unieke kruidenwandeling.
Tijdens deze kruidenwandeling ervaar je direct een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur. Ik laat je de natuur van heel dichtbij voelen, proeven, ruiken en zien. Na deze unieke ervaring zijn je ogen geopend en ervaar je de ware schoonheid van de natuur met al je zintuigen. Je mag al je vriendinnen, vrienden en familieleden meenemen op deze unieke kruidenwandeling. Jij mag kiezen wanneer, waar (allen in Nederland en Vlaanderen) en met wie je deze ervaring wilt delen.
Ik kan tijdens de kruidenwandeling met mijn stem 15 tot 18 personen bereiken.

Steun mijn project

Steun mijn project, zodat meer mensen de natuur respecteren en liefhebben.

Kies je beloning uit de kolom hiernaast en ervaar een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur.
Als ik mijn doel bereik, dan doneer ik 10% van het uiteindelijke bedrag aan Natuurmonumenten.
Wil je me steunen en heb je geen PayPal? Stuur me dan een e-mail martine@plantenliefde.nl

Deel mijn project

Ik ben ook  blij als je mijn project deelt met iedereen in je netwerk. Deel het met je Facebookvrienden en tweet erover. Hoe meer mensen weten van mijn project, hoe eerder we mijn doel bereiken.

Bedankt

Ontzettend bedankt voor je steun. Samen brengen we de natuur dichterbij.

Plantenliefde, vermeld je e-mailadres bij je overschrijving en ontvang het kruidenboek op de eerste lentedag van 2015.>>>klik hier voor een preview van het kruidenboekHet kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid is uniek, omdat:- alle informatie over ruim 40 planten erin staat (kenmerken, verzorging, kweekwijze, oogst, gebruik)- er 100 eenvoudige recepten in staan- het diverse registers en indexen bevat, zodat je de informatie gemakkelijk kunt terugvinden- er informatie in staat over oogsten en drogen- het een alfabetische woordenlijst bevat van alle gebruikte termen duidelijk uitgelegd, zodat je geen voorkennis nodig hebt- het handig en licht is (16 x 21 cm.)- het een ringband heeft en daardoor open blijft liggen op de gekozen bladzijde- er een oogstkalender in staat- er ruimte is voor je eigen ervaringen en recepten- het prachtige illustraties bevatWie ben ik?Ik ben Martine Verweij en ik heb een intens en diep contact met de natuur en dat gun ik jou ook zo! 
Vanuit mijn liefde voor de natuur heb ik het bedrijf Plantenliefde opgericht. Met Plantenliefde wil ik de natuur dichterbij brengen, zodat we weer in harmonie leven met de natuur.Ik heb natuurgeneeskunde en fytotherapie gestudeerd, waardoor ik weet hoe je met kruiden gezond blijft. Ook heb ik de opleiding tot herborist gevolgd, waardoor ik kennis en vaardigheden heb over het oogsten en verwerken van kruiden, zoals het maken van tincturen, siropen en crèmes.Waarom dit project?De natuur wil ik dichterbij brengen door kennis over het gebruik van planten, struiken en bomen toegankelijk te maken voor iedereen.Met het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid dat ik heb geschreven en geïllustreerd, wil ik de kennis en vaardigheden over het gebruik van het plantenrijk voor iedereen toegankelijk maken. De informatie die erin staat, is voor iedereen toegankelijk, omdat je geen voorkennis nodig hebt.Als je kennis hebt van de natuur, dan zie je meer en voel je je vertrouwd met de natuur. Als je weet welke planten je kunt eten, welke planten giftig zijn en welke planten geneeskrachtig zijn, dan kun je zonder angst en met vertrouwen contact maken met de natuur en ervaar je een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur.Waarvoor heb ik je steun nodig?Ik heb jou steun nodig om het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid te kunnen laten drukken en te verzenden.In 2013 heb ik 100 exemplaren van dit kruidenboek laten drukken en verzonden, maar ik wil zo graag meer mensen bereiken met mijn kruidenboek. Zodat jij en ieder mens een intenser en dieper contact met de natuur kunt ervaren. En meer mensen de natuur respecteren en liefhebben.Wat krijg je als je me steunt?Als je me steunt heb ik een aantal fantastische beloningen voor je. 
(Wil je me steunen, maar weet je niet precies hoe? Stuur me een e-mail martine@plantenliefde.nl en ik help je.)Als je me steunt met € 5 of meer, dan krijg je een e-book met mijn ervaringen over het gebruik van planten bij:- hoofdpijn- ontstekingen- slapeloosheid- buikpijn- menstruatiepijn- huidproblemen- hoestAls je me steunt met € 100 of meer, dan ontvang je een gesigneerd exemplaar van het kruidenboek Planten & Gezondheid én je ontvangt een tekening uit het boek op canvas.Alle tekeningen in het kruidenboek heb ik zelf met de hand getekend. De mooiste tekeningen heb ik uitgekozen om voor jou op canvas te laten drukken. Het formaat van de schilderijen is 30 x 30 cm. Je kunt kiezen uit: Walnoot, Jasmijn, Hop, Vlier, Meidoorn, Zwarte bes.Doneer €250 of meer en ik neem je mee op een unieke kruidenwandeling.Tijdens deze kruidenwandeling ervaar je direct een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur. Ik laat je de natuur van heel dichtbij voelen, proeven, ruiken en zien. Na deze unieke ervaring zijn je ogen geopend en ervaar je de ware schoonheid van de natuur met al je zintuigen. Je mag al je vriendinnen, vrienden en familieleden meenemen op deze unieke kruidenwandeling. Jij mag kiezen wanneer, waar (allen in Nederland en Vlaanderen) en met wie je deze ervaring wilt delen.Ik kan tijdens de kruidenwandeling met mijn stem 15 tot 18 personen bereiken.Steun mijn projectSteun mijn project, zodat meer mensen de natuur respecteren en liefhebben. Kies je beloning uit de kolom hiernaast en ervaar een dieper en intenser contact met de natuur.Als ik mijn doel bereik, dan doneer ik 10% van het uiteindelijke bedrag aan Natuurmonumenten.Wil je me steunen en heb je geen PayPal? Stuur me dan een e-mail martine@plantenliefde.nlDeel mijn projectIk ben ook  blij als je mijn project deelt met iedereen in je netwerk. Deel het met je Facebookvrienden en tweet erover. Hoe meer mensen weten van mijn project, hoe eerder we mijn doel bereiken.BedanktOntzettend bedankt voor je steun. Samen brengen we de natuur dichterbij.

story:
"Compost Evolved" in a Nutshell

It may sound strange, but Bokashi composting has changed my life.

I graduated from Northern Arizona University with a B.S. degree in Political Science in 2010. There I realized the power of grassroots movements and sustainable agriculture. Farmers became my heroes. So shortly after graduating, I moved to Maui to become an organic farmer.

Magically, Bokashi composting came into my life and it has become my tool to ignite waste recycling.

I was once overwhelmed with the weight of the world’s problems. Bokashi allows me to reduce my waste in half effortlessly, and grow bigger plants, better, and faster, and heal our soil! I feel empowered and determined.

Bokashi composting has become critical for New Zealand’s success, and I want to see the Bokashi rEvolution be embraced by the U.S. 


"Compost Evolved: The Zero Food Waste Culture" is a 45 minute documentary about the food waste recycling movement in New Zealand. In 2002, New Zealand became the first country IN THE WORLD to adopt a national policy of Zero Waste.

We will explore our dynamic relation with waste, food, and consumption. I believe we are at a critical point in human civilization where we can radically change some of the world's biggest challenges. Every successful grassroots movement I studied started with just one or a few people. Our individual actions make a difference-and Bokashi can help. 

How would YOUR community thrive with an exciting, dynamic, and fun documentary showcasing pioneering zero waste techniques for restaurants, schools, community gardens, businesses, local government and urban planners?

 This documentary is about giving you the tools you need to become an Earth Super Hero and inspire your sustainable community.

*We will do a school version video and another catered to adults.


What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $7,000 to make this documentary radical.

The Breakdown:

  • $2,000 for editing (the same editors who filmed the Indiegogo video-they are amazing)
  • $2300 towards equipment, Zach's travel and expertise. (Who is Zach? Zach was my Backcountry Crew Leader from when we worked for the Southwest Conservation Corps trekking the wilderness, clearing trail, and soaking up the call of the wild together. This guy is hysterical, extremely intelligent, and helped first ignite my revolutionary spirit.  He will be filming while I interview.)
  • $1,500 for a rental car (we will be camping along the road trip!)
  • $800 for equipment backup items
  • $500 for YOUR awesome gifts and shipping
If we don't hit our desired goal, funds will go towards your gifts (of course), editing, and transportation.
You Get:
  • To make a movie!
  • Bumper or Bike Stickers
  • Bokashi and instructions on how to compost food scraps
  • Bokashi Compost Workshops
  • Super awesome "Compost Evolved" trucker hat
  • Your access to the film!

The Impact

Your support really matters. We are a bootstrap, lean-mean filming machine.
Your help will enable me reach more schools, universities, meet with legislators, businesses, gardens, and to other states. It is my mission to share sustainable solutions and continue to build on this grassroots movement. 

I won't give up knowing we have solutions at our grasp, and I hope you won't either. 
This film will be accessible for you so you can pioneer a compost evolution in your community! This documentary WILL be radical and game-changing.

Risks & Challenges

Our flights have been booked and the rental car will be very soon. We are going to make this film. However, there are some risks and challenges involved.

  • We are interviewing as many power players as possible (and working with their schedules)
  • We are working with local filming students in case we experience equipment failures or issues.
  • This is my first film, yet I am no stranger to the stage or camera. Zach and I work with synergy and will incorporate copious amounts of humor, creativity, beauty, and excitement. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE this campaign with your fellow Earth Lovers-check out the "share tools"
  • Get us connected! We want to get connected with filming networks, organizations that are Earth-minded, who do you know? Are any celebrities your pals?

Here's to composting like a MOTHER-EARTHER!

story:
ATTENTION: If you have arrived at this page after our campaign has ended but would still like to donate, please visit our website: www.projectdiscover.weebly.com

____________________________________________________

The Motivation

             We are anxious and sometimes overwhelmed about the future of our planet. Climate change and the many complications it brings will exacerbate suffering and inequality all over the world. We are dissatisfied and with the options before us because we are motivated to do the MOST good we possibly can, and nothing seems like enough. These issues are vast, complicated, and scary, and they affect all of us.

          However, we feel absolutely compelled to do something important. We are offering a year of our lives to learn as much as we can about how to prepare for the future. We want to help others, and share our experiences for the benefit of everyone. Therein lies our motivaton for this trip. To learn, to give, and to share, in the hopes of inspiring and empowering ourselves and others to be agents of positive change. 

           For years, we have learned about complicated and distressing global problems. We do not believe our modern way of life will sustain us through the tough times ahead. 

          However, we do believe a better future is possible. Our journey will allow us to connect with inspiring people and communities who are practicing innovative solutions and share their stories.

UPDATE 8/16: We've been published! Check it out: LoaTree blog post

Thanks LoaTree! 

UPDATE 8/17: It is important to us that our journey be as low impact as possible, which is why we set out to fund raise with the intention of purchasing a vehicle that we could both live in and power on biodiesel. It has become clear that a more economical option would be to borrow or rent a van or camper truck that would meet these needs. 

We are still searching for the perfect biodiesel vehicle! We have simply shifted our intention to renting said vehicle rather than outright purchasing. Let us know if you know of anything that would work for us!

____________________________________________________

 

  The Team

         

 MOLLY                                                               CASSIE

As recent graduates of the Environmental Studies program at UC Santa Barbara, we are very concerned about the state of our world and the future, and deeply motivated to create positive change.  

  Our Vision

From September to December, we will travel around the Northern half of the United States, exploring and volunteering in alternative living spaces, like co-ops, intentional communities, and community-building organizations. We believe these spaces will display resilience; the ability to remain strong, functional, and happy in the face of extreme hardship. If all goes well, we will do a second leg through the south in the spring. 

                                             Our potential route

On our website we will showcase communities and individuals thriving in alternative lifestyles. We will ask people about what sustainability, community, and resilience against climate change mean to them, and learn how to prepare for the future.

Our Methods

-- A journey of Learning, Giving, and Sharing

We will LEARN what a resilient community looks like by asking these questions and more:

  1. Does climate change concern you?
  2. What is special about your lifestyle and community?
  3. What does community resiliency mean to you?
  4. What inspired you to live this way?
  5. What can other people take away from the way you live?

We are still expanding this list. What sort of questions would you like answered?   

             Cornerstone Farm in Maine, one of the stops we will make along the way                                

We will GIVE

In every state we visit, we will volunteer and offer whatever we can. 

  • Working on farms and in co-ops
  • Helping out in shelters
  • Whatever else is needed on www.workaway.info
    • a wonderful resource to find places to help out around the country 

Additionally, we will be offering what we learn with our followers as we go. 

Please let us know if you have any other suggestions!

 ----------------------

We will SHARE what it takes to make a community resilient.

Our lessons will help others make changes in their lives and their communities to be better prepared for the future. 

How we will share:

  • Constantly feature the stories of incredible individuals and communities nationwide on our blog
  • Create a map highlighting sustainability players around the country
  • Develop a book or short documentary available online highlighting the stories we collect and our insights

No one can solve global problems alone, and our final product will be a resource to those hoping to create a brighter future. 

 

How you can help us make a difference

Our greatest need is for a vehicle!

 

Our dream van!

      A vehicle like this one would give us the most flexibility to fulfill our dreams. 

We hope to purchase a used diesel vehicle, like a Westfalia or camper truck, to run on biodiesel. This vehicle will be our home all over the country, so we are looking for something reliable. We will also need funds for fuel, food, and supplies. 

An estimated breakdown:

$7,000-$10,000 for the vehicle 

(based on available options on Craigslist)

$1,500-$2,000 for sustainable food

$2,000 for biodiesel

(Roughly 8,000 miles at about 17 MPG at an average of $4.10/gal)

= $10,500- $14,000  

You might ask, given this breakdown, why we set our fundraising limit at $8,000? We are certainly hoping to raise well over $10,000, but will recieve a higher percentage of the money we raise from Indiegogo if we meet our goal. Also, we are determined to make it work with whatever money we manage to fundraise.

Thankfully, biodiesel is available all over the country! It will take some careful planning and some extra fuel tanks to make sure we never get stranded, but we are up for the challenge.

        

                                  Biodiesel stations across the country 

The Perks  

    If you have arrived after our campaign ended, please visit www.projectdiscover.weebly.com if you wish to donate

            We have spent a lot of love and effort into making our perks exciting and fun for you all. Below are some images to help illustrate what we hope to share with you:

  

An example of a handmade Quillow (blanket/pillow hybrid). Many options available, pictures to come.

 

        An example of Cassie's custom painting

 

            

Molly teaching a group fitness class

                         

        

Cassie has experience planting trees!

 

Re-Cap:

We will:

  • Travel on a sustainable journey across the nation, with biodeisel power
  • Volunteer everywhere we go (at farms, co-ops, and shelters)
  • Conduct interviews on climate change, the future, and community resilience
  • Feature the stories of 100 individuals on our website as we go
  • Develop a comprehensive multimedia book or short documentary, available for free online, to share our knowledge and experiences

 

Keep in touch, and help spread the word!

We've created a Project Discover Facebook page, instagram, and twitter. Plus, we will be blogging and uploading photos to our website (www.projectdiscover.weebly.com).  Please stay in touch and follow us on any of the sites you use. We'd love to hear from you!

We would also LOVE to hear any creative ideas and general advice you have for fundraising or for our trip! Please leave us a message if you have any input.

FINALLY- PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN! We need help spreading the word about where we're going and what we're doing, so please tell any and everyone. If you need help describing the campaign or convincing someone to donate, just direct them to our website, FB page, twitter, instagram or here to this indiegogo.

                   

                  Thank you SO much and we look forward to hearing from you soon!
