story:
RENT-BILLBOARDS-RAISE-AWARENESS-PROJECT

We are currently fundraising to rent billboards across Canada starting in Ontario that will empower the Canadian public with many of the truthful and important facts about our environment and the government that the media can't or won't provide. It is our hope is that a well informed public will pressure the government, the media, and the international oil and gas industries to:

  1.  Re-establish Canada's respect and protections for our environment
  2.  Prioritize more sustainable-earth business practices
  3.  Protect and respect everyones right to clean water, clean air and healthy   families
  4.  Begin to rebuild the Nation to Nation relatioship between First Nations and Canadians.

 

"We have a planetary emergency"

NASA scientist James Hansen

"Science today tells us that we have a generation at most in which to carry out a radical transformation in our economic relations, and our relations with the earth, if we want to ...avoid a major tipping point or “point of no return,” after which vast changes in the earth’s climate will likely be beyond our ability to prevent and will be irreversible"

  • We've reached the higest atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide  in 800,000 years, many countries including Sweden, Iceland, France and Germany have been attempting to reverse this increase by setting energy targets for themselves. The aim is to be oil-free in the not-to-distant future by utilizing things like geo-thermal heat, wind, solar, hydro and wave power. There is no relevant work being done in Canada to suggest that an oil-free goal is even being considered.

 

  • Germany is one of the few industrial nations to actually reduce its greenhouse gas emissions between 1990 and 2005 - by some 18 percent. Between 1990 and 2011 Canada's greenhouse gas emissions increased by a staggering 267 percent.

 

  • A study by engineers at Stanford Univeristy reports,"The biggest obstacles in shifting to clean energy are social and political — what you need is the will to do it."

 

  • In 2008, Alberta Health indicated a 31 per cent increase of cancers in the community of Fort Chipewyan (downstream from tar sands) and reports by Elders and community leaders document much more extreme environmental and community health changes, yet still a comprehensive study of health and environmental impacts has not taken place

 

  • Environmental toxins including carcinogens, gene mutagens, and endocrine disruptors have been poorly tracked by governments, despite widespread knowledge since the 1970s by the Department of Indian Affairs and Department of the Environment of both their existence and potential health impacts

 

  • Federal scientists confirmed that carcinogens from tar sands operations are traveling and accumulating in watersheds north of operations.

 

  • Dr. David Schindler at the University of Alberta: "It is clear that muzzling under the Harper government is the most oppressive in the history of federal government science. Incredibly, some of the most eminent scientists in Canada have been forbidden to speak publicly on scientific matters where they are recognized as world experts."

 

  • Canada has been repeatedly condemned by the United Nations for its treatment of Indigenous peoples

 

  • In Ontario, the Aamjiwnaang First Nation near Sarnia has been described as a ‘sacrifice zone’ and is considered the most polluted place in North America by the World Health Organization. Currently, an estimated 225 000 barrels per day (bpd) of tar sands are being processed in Sarnia, and the Line 9 reversal pipeline project will increase dilbit oil flow by 300 000 bpd

 

  • Several First Nations have launched lawsuits against governments and industry related to tar sands, asserting that the projects are illegal because in destroying local ecology, the projects violate First Nation’s constitutionally protected Treaty Rights to health, cultural traditions, and land/water integrity

 

  • In September 2012 the Harper government made public its intentions to terminate the Inherent Treaty rights of First Nations, and in December passed Bill C-45, which makes major changes to environmental legislation, labor laws, and the Indian Act. A recent Greenpeace access to information request revealed that Harper took direction from Big Oil in crafting Bill C45

 

  • Communities have not been given a choice about tar sands development, rather they have had to adapt to unabated expansion. Alternate economic visions based on ecologically and culturally sustainable industries have never been seriously considered. Rather, for communities downstream of projects, inflated prices on basic necessities like food, water, and hydro are the legacies of tar sands development. For those who harvest from the land to subsidize high food costs, the bioaccumulation of toxins in food and medicines has created serious health concerns, and forced many to abandon cultural traditions.

 

  • The Harper government has sabotaged international climate negotiations at the United Nations, and is the only country in the world to walk away from the Kyoto accord. NASA scientist James Hansen has argued that further exploitation of the tar sands means game over for the climate, yet the Harper government is ignoring facts in favor of an ideological economic vision of Canada as an ‘energy superpower.’

 

  • The ‘jobs’ argument for tar sands creates a fictitious division between the economy and the environment, attempting to pit employment against health and environmental concerns

 

  • Doing the actual math, it is an approximate net ratio of 20:1 jobs lost vs. jobs gained in chemical valley over a 15 year period

 

 

Recommended online resources:

 

HIGHLIGHTS from http://earthfirstnews.wordpress.com/2013/01/24/ethical-enbridge/

 

www.davidsuzuki.org

www.greenpeace.org/canada/

www.desmog.ca/

www.idlenomore.ca

 

It costs approximately between $1400-$2000 to rent a large, horizontal billboard in Hamilton, Ontario for four weeks. We will start with the goal of one billboard and with your help we will achieve this, raise awareness and continue on raising funds for many more billboards, first in Ontario and then across Canada. If we raise more than our goal or if there is any money that does not cover more ad space, it will be donated to other Idle No More actions i.e. fundraisers, bus transportation for protesters, information distribution, etc.

Raising the consciousness of people to be more self-aware is part of our evolution.

"Where ignorance is our master, there is no possibility of real peace." ~ Dalai Lama

"Indifference, to me, is the epitome of evil." ~Elie Wiesel, Jewish-American writer, professor, political activist, Nobel Laureate, and Holocaust survivor.

Let's make it easy for people to not remain in the comfort of ignorance. The age of destruction, greed, indifference and inequality is coming to it's end. It's the end of that era and the beginning of a new one, a knowledgable one. Knowledge is true power.Truth is true freedom. Unity is true peace.

We are able to offer some some unique incentives to help encourage contributions to this campaign. T-Shirts and magnets featuring the beautiful artwork of artist Andy Everson for Idle No More. Also we have some one-of-a-kind wall and desk calendars featuring beautiful photos of Idle NO More protests world wide including New Zealand, Japan, Norway, Ecuador, Hawaii, Venice Beach, England, Australia, Germany, Italy and of a collage of Canadian cities with various empowering and inspiring quotes.

Even if you can't finacially contribute, please contribute by sharing this information with whoever you can, whenever you can.

*See gallery for photos of perks
story_txt:
RENT-BILLBOARDS-RAISE-AWARENESS-PROJECT
We are currently fundraising to rent billboards across Canada starting in Ontario that will empower the Canadian public with many of the truthful and important facts about our environment and the government that the media can't or won't provide. It is our hope is that a well informed public will pressure the government, the media, and the international oil and gas industries to:

 Re-establish Canada's respect and protections for our environment
 Prioritize more sustainable-earth business practices
 Protect and respect everyones right to clean water, clean air and healthy   families
 Begin to rebuild the Nation to Nation relatioship between First Nations and Canadians.
 
"We have a planetary emergency"
NASA scientist James Hansen
"Science today tells us that we have a generation at most in which to carry out a radical transformation in our economic relations, and our relations with the earth, if we want to ...avoid a major tipping point or “point of no return,” after which vast changes in the earth’s climate will likely be beyond our ability to prevent and will be irreversible"


We've reached the higest atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide  in 800,000 years, many countries including Sweden, Iceland, France and Germany have been attempting to reverse this increase by setting energy targets for themselves. The aim is to be oil-free in the not-to-distant future by utilizing things like geo-thermal heat, wind, solar, hydro and wave power. There is no relevant work being done in Canada to suggest that an oil-free goal is even being considered.

 

Germany is one of the few industrial nations to actually reduce its greenhouse gas emissions between 1990 and 2005 - by some 18 percent. Between 1990 and 2011 Canada's greenhouse gas emissions increased by a staggering 267 percent.
 

A study by engineers at Stanford Univeristy reports,"The biggest obstacles in shifting to clean energy are social and political — what you need is the will to do it."
 

In 2008, Alberta Health indicated a 31 per cent increase of cancers in the community of Fort Chipewyan (downstream from tar sands) and reports by Elders and community leaders document much more extreme environmental and community health changes, yet still a comprehensive study of health and environmental impacts has not taken place
 

Environmental toxins including carcinogens, gene mutagens, and endocrine disruptors have been poorly tracked by governments, despite widespread knowledge since the 1970s by the Department of Indian Affairs and Department of the Environment of both their existence and potential health impacts
 

Federal scientists confirmed that carcinogens from tar sands operations are traveling and accumulating in watersheds north of operations.
 

Dr. David Schindler at the University of Alberta: "It is clear that muzzling under the Harper government is the most oppressive in the history of federal government science. Incredibly, some of the most eminent scientists in Canada have been forbidden to speak publicly on scientific matters where they are recognized as world experts."
 

Canada has been repeatedly condemned by the United Nations for its treatment of Indigenous peoples
 

In Ontario, the Aamjiwnaang First Nation near Sarnia has been described as a ‘sacrifice zone’ and is considered the most polluted place in North America by the World Health Organization. Currently, an estimated 225 000 barrels per day (bpd) of tar sands are being processed in Sarnia, and the Line 9 reversal pipeline project will increase dilbit oil flow by 300 000 bpd
 

Several First Nations have launched lawsuits against governments and industry related to tar sands, asserting that the projects are illegal because in destroying local ecology, the projects violate First Nation’s constitutionally protected Treaty Rights to health, cultural traditions, and land/water integrity
 

In September 2012 the Harper government made public its intentions to terminate the Inherent Treaty rights of First Nations, and in December passed Bill C-45, which makes major changes to environmental legislation, labor laws, and the Indian Act. A recent Greenpeace access to information request revealed that Harper took direction from Big Oil in crafting Bill C45
 

Communities have not been given a choice about tar sands development, rather they have had to adapt to unabated expansion. Alternate economic visions based on ecologically and culturally sustainable industries have never been seriously considered. Rather, for communities downstream of projects, inflated prices on basic necessities like food, water, and hydro are the legacies of tar sands development. For those who harvest from the land to subsidize high food costs, the bioaccumulation of toxins in food and medicines has created serious health concerns, and forced many to abandon cultural traditions.
 

The Harper government has sabotaged international climate negotiations at the United Nations, and is the only country in the world to walk away from the Kyoto accord. NASA scientist James Hansen has argued that further exploitation of the tar sands means game over for the climate, yet the Harper government is ignoring facts in favor of an ideological economic vision of Canada as an ‘energy superpower.’
 

The ‘jobs’ argument for tar sands creates a fictitious division between the economy and the environment, attempting to pit employment against health and environmental concerns
 

Doing the actual math, it is an approximate net ratio of 20:1 jobs lost vs. jobs gained in chemical valley over a 15 year period
 
 
Recommended online resources:
 
HIGHLIGHTS from http://earthfirstnews.wordpress.com/2013/01/24/ethical-enbridge/
 
www.davidsuzuki.org
www.greenpeace.org/canada/
www.desmog.ca/
www.idlenomore.ca

story:
I am Henry Boschen, Webmaster for 

                    Concerned Chippewa Citizen   

                                 www.ccc-wis.com

I have been fighting Frac Sand Mining, Processing and Fracking for over 5 years now. 

My E-Mail address is juiceguy@juiceguy.com .

Go to the gallery tab above and click on the last picture. The picture is what is left of a green forest and a farm!    It is now a Silica Sand Mine, and an Ecological Disaster. Picture #2 shows destruction in progress. 

Here is Jerry Lausted explaining this: "The Hills are gone."

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FNQ6jCihsDk

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FNQ6jCihsDk

The Fracking Industry destroys the beauty of our land forever, (do not believe the fairy-tale stories about "reclamation. They have not a clue as to how to do it, or whether it is even possible.

http://host.madison.com/ct/news/local/environment/with-frac-sand-boom-in-full-swing-study-to-guide/article_15154c72-8e99-11e3-8b6b-0019bb2963f4.html ) Eyewash! 5 yr study program! They don't even intend to do it! Likely many of the mines will be exhausted by the time the study is complete and the company out of business.

The whole industry causes serious environmental problems and human suffering despite industry claims to the contrary; (see the web site www.ccc-wis.com). These large Mining Corporations have nearly unlimited funds, fancy lawyers, and slick promotional campaigns to promote the wonders of Fracking and the benefits of Frac Sand Mining to the local communities. They have legions of front men to acquire leases as cheaply as possible, and many landowners who sold, now regret their decisions or just moved away leaving their (former) friends and neighbors to deal with the problems of living next to a Sand Plant, Mine or Fracking operation.

I and other concerned citizens have tried to photographically document some of the excesses, spills, and other disasters that these sites are, but we have been hampered by lack of physical access. Your contribution will go toward purchasing a Professional, GPS stabilized, radio controlled multicopter with professional telemetery controlled video and still picture capability. (Video before gyro stabilization). http://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/02/technology/personaltech/review-the-phantom-2-vision-photo-drone-from-dji.html?_r=0

 I will use this vehicle to produce high quality photographs of the clear cutting, deep holes, wet-land destruction, waste water holding ponds, spills and pipeline breaks endemic to these industries. These photographs will be be posted on my web site and be available to anyone needing photographic proof of the disasters caused by Fracking, Frac Sand Mining, processing & transport of Silica Sand all over the midwest. 

The fund is slowly growing, and we are over 25% of our goal!

In the interim the Multicopter has been improved, the camera is now gyro stabilized,  and it can now follow a pre-programmed flight path using Waypoints! This can keep it away from sensitive areas, and allow time-lapse aerial photography so we can photograph the same scene days, weeks or months apart from exactly the same spot in the air. This will show the progression of the activity in question and would be perfect for showing wetlands at different times of the year, (which are not always wet) and any boundary movements.

 Here is a mountain video shot in Utah. There are more in the Gallery!

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWRw9ZeC2MY

Have these Aerial Vehicles proven useful to activists in the past?

In 2008, a multicopter pilot remotely flew his aircraft next to a large meat processing facility in North Dakota. From an altitude of several hundred feet, the pilot took photos of the surrounding area. The photos revealed a bright red river flowing from the meat processing facility. The river contained biological waste, a violation of EPA regulations. The meat processing facility was forced to discontinue its harmful practices.

Have MY activist efforts produced any results so far? 

 When our local sand plant  was applying for permits, they claimed they would install 10 (ten) air pollution monitors around the periphery of the plant. Once they had the permits though, they reneged on their promise, and it was only under great pressure that they finally installed a $40,000 dust collector type monitor (Upwind) of the plant.

 I was so mad that I designed and constructed a low cost ($500) Laser Pollution Monitoring System using a Dylos monitor (see web site) and placed them around the plant (downwind and upwind) much to the discomfort of the plant corporation officials and the DNR since my systems were way better, and produced real time data viewable on my web site. I bore the entire startup cost of the web site and monitors although several local citizens did purchase units for their locations. Our monitors raised local awareness of the pollution problems inherent in the plant's operation, and the sand company changed the plant's design to reduce the amount of silica dust it emits.

Hydraulic fracturing, "Fracking" is a big Ponzi scheme destined to collapse of its own weight as it is not economically justified. By funding this project, you will be helping to expose the problems and hasten Fracking's demise. If you know of anyone who is mad enough at their local Mining or Hydraulic Fracking operation to help financially or by publicizing this effort, please let them know and ask them to contribute in any amount. If you have a Fracking Story to tell, It does take a contribution first to get on the comment page, but that can be as little as One Dollar if that is all you can spare, and I urge you to tell your story!

We need pictures to expose the truth to governmental and other decision makers who seem not to be aware of the undesirable heavy industrial footprint being irrevocably created by the Gas/Oil/Mining Corporations.

story:
Dam Disaster

The Newlin Grist Mill is a nonprofit organization with a dam problem. 

The dam supplies water to power the historic mill. The water provides the mechanical energy to turn the wheel, which powers the gears to operate the mill.  

The diverted water also fills the fish and frog ponds. The dam was constructed over 300 years ago, and has become an integral part of the ecosystem.

On April 30th, 2014,  heavy rains washed away a 15-foot section of the dam. 

Without the dam, much of the site is not operational. 

We have taken precautions to maintain as much of the dam as possible as we gather the permits and funds to fully restore the dam.  To date, volunteers have helped fill and place nearly 20 tons of sand in 1,500 sandbags to make a temporary dam. 


Dam Needs & Dam Donations

The state of Pennsylvania issued an emergency repair permit that expires in six weeks. The dam project must be completed by then. 

The dam will cost $35,000 to reconstruct. 

The organization has $25,000 in an emergency fund that will be used towards the dam restoration. 

We need to raise at least $10,000 in dam donations. 

All dam donations will go directly to dam repairs. Your dam donation will help defray the cost of this unexpected dam emergency. 

Each dam donor level comes with unique perks, like music festival tickets, t-shirts, and an invitation to a private concert.  (Perks can be declined so your entire donation will go to the dam restoration.)


The Dam Impact

Over 40,000 people visit Newlin Grist Mill each year for unique experiences encountering both history and nature.  Historically, there were over 14,000 water powered mills by 1840 in America.  Today less than 500 are still operational and open to the public.  The Newlin Grist Mill has one of the earliest water systems that remains unchanged, making it a significant feature on the landscape.  When the dam washed away, an entire 300 year old ecosystem also washed away overnight.


Today, thousands of children visit on field trips. Generations have caught their first fish in our fishing ponds. Wedding photos are regularly taken by our waterfalls.  Summer camp campers often catch frogs in our frog pond. Hikers, dog walkers, and birders all use our trails. Without the dam....none of this is possible. 


Other Ways You Can Give a Dam

  • Use the share tools to spread the word. 
  • Encourage your network to donate.
  • Be a dam volunteer.
  • Follow the dam reconstruction process on the Dam Blog at www.newlingristmill.org
  • Attend the Rock the Mill Music Festival on June 14th, 2014. Proceeds from the fundraiser go towards preservation needs on the site. www.rockthemill.org

story:
What am I doing?

 
Many people take so many things for granted everyday, I have to admit that I did too. I did until i took a trip one year ago that changed my views on a lot of things. When you hear me say we take things for granted what do you think? Our cars, our homes, or even our cell phones? One thing that probably doesn't come to your mind is water, such an easily accesible thing to us yet we almost never realize that there are people all over the world who dont have the benefit of flipping a faucet and having water endlessly come out! Like i said before I didnt know I took this for granted until I took a trip that canged that. The trip was to Haiti. The purpose of this trip was to bring clean drinking water to the Haitians with an organization called Raincatchers. While I was there i got to spend time with the people there and see how they lived. Watching them have to walk miles and miles for something that we waste daily while we brush our teeth, water our grass, and wash our cars with this precious thing they call water. The purpose of this trip is to install a gutter filtration system; that catches and funnels rain water through a filter into a 50gallon barrel for them to drink thats right outside of their huts! Something so simple that means the world to these poeple.
 

What I Need

 
What I need is funding and prayers! Money is a huge factor in getting the supplies and getting over to Haiti.
 

What the money goes towards:

  • Plane ticket (to and from Haiti)

  • Supplies (to build the gutter systems)

  • Lodging (our group has to stay at a hotel for two nights one on the way up and one on the way down)

  • Food (we can't eat the native food or we'll get sick haha so we have to bring our own food)

If you would like further info on how you can get involved you can contact me on facebook at Facebook.com/kirbizzle or contact raincatchers at Raincatchers.org

Lodging (our group has to stay at a hotel for two nights one on the way up and one on the way down)


Food (we can't eat the native food or we'll get sick haha so we have to bring our own food)


If you would like further info on how you can get involved you can contact me on facebook at Facebook.com/kirbizzle or contact raincatchers at Raincatchers.org

story:
Who are the Sentinels?

We are a volunteer group of dedicated, local citizens working to protect our communities near the Shawnee National Forest in southern Illinois from the harms of frac sand mining, and hydraulic fracking, pipelines, strip mining and logging. 

We are an organized grassroots movement, working more than two years with the help and the loving-kindness of like-minded people, donating time, energy and resources to keep the fracking industry from taking a foothold in beautiful southern Illinois. 

So far, we've been successful, but we need your help to continue this fight. 

Your contributions will help us spread the word in rural communities that this industry will leave behind nothing but chaos, as it has in other states. We must protect our children and the land from the destructive practices of absentee corporations that pillage and plunder the countryside for profits off the backs of rural people. 

Our Local Issues:

  • Industrial hydraulic fracking
  • Pipelines through the heart of the Shawnee National Forest
  • Frac sand mining, logging and hilltop removal 
  • Strip mining sacred Shawnee burial grounds
  • Class 2 injection wells in an active seismic zone
  • Contamination of drinking water supplies
  • Boom and bust economies, broken dreams on broken land

Our federal, state and local governments are wreaking havoc on our constitutional right to a healthy environment. We intend to do what's necessary to stop fracking and it's industrial practices from ruining our homeland. We must prevail!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Supplies for banners and signs, printed handout materials 
  • Projector for educational seminars, video camera to document our actions
  • Rental space for nonviolent direct action citizen trainings
  • Gas money and van rental for lobby day at the capital 4 hours away
  • Funds will stay local and go toward the battle of maintaining a safe clean environment for this and future generations. 

Local artist and community members have donated time and energy to provide unique gifts specific to our region, through music, art and culture. 

The Impact

The natural beauty of the southernmost region of  Illinois, with its unique rock outcroppings, federal wetland, designated wilderness areas, and its several wineries and breweries, sustainable farming, bed and breakfast, hiking trails, artists and musicians, bring much needed business to the area.

Your contribution supports local residents working to keep southern Illinois from becoming the next industrialized fracking wasteland.

  • Full-scale industrial fracking has NOT started yet. We're doing something right and we want to keep it up.
  • Dedicated volunteers across the state are working many different avenues of resistance, from legislation to bird-dogging, to street theater and rallies. Persistence is paying off.
  • Activists from several local group are collaborating to amplify the voices of southern Illinois, and keep our beautiful Shawnee National Forest and surrounding communities safe from fracked water, air pollution, noisy trucks, smelly pipelines, ugly strip pits, raped forests, radiation, earthquakes and adverse health effects caused by corporate greed. Your help is needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on funds, help us meet our goal other ways:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our fundraiser. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this campaign!
  • Volunteer with your local fractivist group. 

Video credit to Will Reynolds.

story:
Birdsbesafe® Background

Birdsbesafe LLC is a small business in Vermont that makes and sells the Birdsbesafe cat collar cover, which protects birds from cats. We've been in business since 2009 with our own invention that uses bird biology to help protect birds.

How It Works: Songbirds are known to have extra rods and cones in their eyes, which make bright colors appear extra-bright, even in low light conditions like at dawn. Birds notice bright colors above all else in the environment. Cats wearing our bright colors are seen easily when stalking. Most birds just fly away to safety, avoiding even expert hunters.

Scientific Proof: Birdsbesafe cat collar covers have recently been proven scientifically effective at reducing the number of birds caught by cats wearing them in a scientific field study at St. Lawrence University.

Scope: Birdsbesafe collar covers are already worn by cats across the United States, Canada, in the UK, in Australia, and New Zealand. The bird-saving collars seem to perform well in all environments: from suburbs, to the desert, to ranches, farms, rural areas and in cities. We hold patents or the equivalent in 30 countries, including 28 in the EU. Birdsbesafe's reputation is quite positive, online and around the world.

Cat predation on birds is a known bird conservation problem, worldwide. More than half of pet cats, in the U.S., for instance, are let outdoors where they hunt for birds and other creatures. Cat owners have embraced our solution as safe and comfortable for the cat, while also being very effective at protecting birds. It's a pragmatic solution for cats that go outdoors.

Our Allies and Values

Our Mission Attracts Help: We've received expert marketing and business planning help that in order to envision the next level of success. We've enjoyed a great blog post by a well-known customer. (Thank you Elizabeth Gilbert!) Scientists have stepped up to study Birdsbesafe. And since the start, our loyal customers have helped Birdsbesafe succeed, by emailing photos, feedback, or posting testimonials on Facebook. Our bird-saving success is a shared success!

Our Green Values: In Vermont, we herald green business ethics. We have had our collar covers sewn in our region and have used organic cotton fabric as often as possible. We integrate our environmental and social values into our business. One day, we hope to partner with national and international bird conservation groups to promote Birdsbesafe for their benefit.

Thank you

We thank you for your help! The campaign is closed, but we remain very grateful. Crowd-funding is a way that you can support a small business, with a good product that is already making a difference in the lives of songbirds. Humbly, we thank you.

We hope that if you want to simply shop for our products, you will do that too, on Birdsbesafe.com.

Thank you! We like to think that the birds will sing a little sweeter for you!

More ways that you can help

  • Write an email to friends about our Indiegogo campaign. This is VERY helpful.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to easily spread the word.
  • You can join our Birdsbesafe Facebook page, Twitter, or Pinterest.
  • Share your enthusiasm with your neighbors, a local birdwatching group, nature center, or cat shelter. Do you know a reporter? A blogger? Ellen?
  • PIN, tweet or FB post your enthusiasm to your friends.
Thank You from the Birds in Your Region and Beyond!

story:
Summary

Our waterfront is the heart of Toronto. It's where we run, picnic, celebrate, work, sail, and live. As a city we've invested a ton of money, time, and passion into making it the waterfront we deserve. But now the planned Island Airport expansion threatens all of that. 

As a revitalized Queens Quay opens again on June 19/20 with big fanfare and a huge festival, NoJetsTO will stage a massive and creative protest on the lake on June 20th at 1PM near the foot of Rees Street. With people from across the city celebrating our waterfront together with politicians and the media, we will send a strong message that our waterfront is a place for people - not jets.

That's where you come in: with your help we will be able to make it a big protest that will draw eyeballs and public attention. The more you give, the more kayaks and boats we will put on the water. It's that simple.

What We Need & What You Get

It's all about scale. Your donation will help us:

  • Rent boats, canoes and kayaks and assemble a flotilla of #kayaktivists - and you could be in one of them!
  • Equip our entire flotilla with NoJetsTO flags and banners for the protest.
  • Get the word out on social media to make this protest as big and fun as it can be.
  • In return for your generous help, you can get NoJetsTO gear or join us on the water either in a kayak or sailboat.
  • There's more: if you pitch in more you can even dine with luminary and urban designer Ken Greenberg or get a collector's item photo print from Ed Burtynsky peer Jim Panou.
  • Any funds left over from the boat protest will fund our ongoing grassroots campaign.

The Impact

With your help, we will make our boat protest a big splash when Queens Quay opens again and all eyes will be on our waterfront:

  • A big and fun protest will impress folks at the opening festivities and those watching CP24 & Co. at home.
  • City Councillors will be reminded that our waterfront is for people, not jets.
  • We will get our message out there that this fight is about nothing less than the future of our waterfront.
  • We've staged a similar (but smaller) protest last year - drawing media attention and municipal hopefuls like Olivia Chow and Joe Cressy. So we know what we are doing - this protest will just be much bigger and more fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the position to contribute financially, there are other ways for you to support a jet-free waterfront.

  • Tweet and Facebook about this crowd funding campaign - use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Invite five friends directly (email, phone/text message, carrier pigeon).
  • Take a NoJetsTO sign and spruce up your lawn, balcony or window.
  • Sign up and volunteer for the event.

Who We Are

NoJetsTO is made up of concerned Toronto residents - people like you and me who care for our waterfront. We got started after the Island Airport expansion plans became public two years ago. Since then we have grown from a handful of residents to a city-wide group with 18,000 petition signatures for a jet-free waterfront. We are working hard to make sure City Councillors know what's at stake and reject the wrong-headed jet plans when the issue returns for a vote.

story:
In Production Now!

Please go to BroodMinder.com to place orders.

Short Summary

The BroodMinder Team is very pleased to announce that we are ready to begin production of our second device, the BroodMinder-W, wireless beehive scale.   

The BroodMinder-W is a professional-grade beehive scale developed specifically for the backyard apiarist. The BroodMinder-W will allow you to track changes in the weight of your hive, giving you evidence of important factors such as brood growth, honey flow, winter honey stores, and swarming.

Drawing on the design team's many years of consumer and scientific product design, we have created a device that accurately logs the weight of your hive at regular intervals, and sends the data to your smart phone or tablet using low-energy Bluetooth technology.  

The BroodMinder team believes that by performing simple, uniform measurements on tens of thousands of hives, the beekeeping community will gain insights into hive distress and that as a community, we will develop interventions to improve outcomes. 

Therefore, in partnership with Beekeeping.io, we store your data free of charge in the cloud, with the only condition being that you allow free/public access to the data. At Beekeeping.io, your data can be graphed and examined for trends demonstrating health or distress in your hive. 

The BroodMinder-W

Following the successful BroodMinder-TH campaign, the team has spent the last six months researching, designing, building, and testing the BroodMinder-W. We have been through literally dozens of prototypes and gathered user feedback from clubs and beekeeping conferences. We now have a design that we know will meet the needs of our backyard beekeeping community.

We are employing the hive-tip method of weighing the hive. The scale goes under either the front or the back of the hive. The other end of the hive is then propped up by a 2x4 block of wood. Thus, the scale sees half of the hive weight. 

This approach has several advantages:

  1. Reduced the size and complexity, resulting in lower cost
  2. Easily moved from hive to hive by simply swapping the scale with a 2x4
  3. Remains clear of any debris falling through the bottom board
  4. Sexy asthetics

The main features of the BroodMinder-W are:

  • 400-pound total hive weight measurement (250% overload capacity)
  • 0.01 pound (5 gram) resolution
  • Temperature compensated
  • Can be paired with a second unit for accurate determination of total hive weight
  • Stores weight once per hour for six months (user configurable)
  • Replaceable coin cell battery lasts six months
  • Bluetooth Low Energy communication, no wires, no setup dance. It just works!
  • 16.25” x 2.5” x 1.5” Durable white oak body top and aluminum base
  • Weatherproof, UV resistant cover
  • Free iPhone or Android app to wirelessly collect data from the scale.
  • Free cloud storage of collected data
  • Open BLE advertisement protocol for the hacking enthusiast

It's very easy to remove and replace the scale, even with many supers installed.

There is more information at BroodMinder.com

What We Need

Achieving a low cost requires purchasing components in high volumes. Our initial production run will be 500 units and the capital outlay is around $50,000 for materials, tooling, and setup. Because our company is financed by the heart and not a venture capital company, we need your help to make this possible.

What You Get

It’s simple.  For $149, you get a beehive scale and the satisfaction that you are contributing to the beekeeping knowledge base.

While we believe this is an excellent value at $149, our target price was initially $99. We still plan to reach that target in the future through higher production volumes. However, we have decided to use higher quality, American-designed weight sensors rather than the ultra-low cost, mass produced weight sensors available from China.  This factor, and the high-quality white oak and aluminum casings, increased our production cost significantly.

We will be releasing the scales in batches, so you can choose when you would like to receive yours. Just be sure to note the delivery date for each individual perk. They will delivered in the order received.

We are also offering a community support perk. This was a successful component of our first campaign. You can donate $50 (or more) that we will use entirely for putting BroodMinders into shared community hives. We have approximately 20 installed currently, and it is a nice way to allow non-beekeepers to peer into the hive on a very personal level.

You’ll be able to personally watch the data collected from these hives on Beekeping.io, and know that the data is being used to educate our children, and aid entomologists in their efforts to improve honey bee heath.


The Impact

Honeybees are under increasing pressure from many factors in their environment, including everything from monocultures to neonicotinoids. With the increase in public awareness of the importance of bees and the stress they are under, scores of new bee enthusiasts have been born.

Beekeeping, while rewarding, is not simple. Losing hives is a disappointing and frustrating experience, and it certainly doesn't help the world's bee population; it mostly helps the suppliers of bees. We believe that our devices will enhance the Zen Art of bee keeping by helping to create the Zen Science of bee keeping.  

By monitoring your hive wirelessly, you can help to minimize stress on the hive by recognizing and reacting to changes. 

The additional benefit of uploading your hive data, free of charge, to our partner, Beekeeping.io, gives you the opportunity to better understand your hive’s trends with graphing and analysis capability.  Beyond this, you will contribute your data for the common good of collecting uniform measurements on thousands of hives.  Through this, the beekeeping community will gain insights into hive distress so that, as a community, we will develop interventions to improve outcomes.

You might think, why BroodMinder? There are other scales already available.

  • Simple operation. We have better things to do than futz around with our phones. The total installation process takes less than a minute with no passwords or device pairing dances. It just works!
  • Very low radio power. We don't want to risk any effect on the bees so we are using Class 3, Bluetooth Low Energy radios.
  • Long battery life and long data log. Logging the data over a season will be very useful for knowing the health of the hive and having actionable data for the coming year.
  • Economical. Other scales cost much more, particularly when you add the communication components. We are using the principles of high volume production to achieve unheard-of prices.

Risks and Challenges

The team is well down the development path. We have working prototypes and software under test. We have also worked hard to mitigate risk by using production partners with many years of product development experience.

While we have learned much about weatherproofing, we are not so bold that we think we know it all. Therefore, we are providing a 6-month warranty for the systems and will stand behind them as we have with the BroodMinder-TH. 

We would also like to say a few words about the BroodMinder-TH that you can order along with the scale if you choose.

The BroodMinder-TH is our second generation temperature and humidity device. It has been redesigned since the first generation that was distributed last December. Unfortunately, 2 weeks after the distribution of our first device, Texas Instruments recalled the humidity sensor in that device because it was inaccurate in a high humidity environment. SIEP#57 recall also fessed up that the sensor would drift up 15% in 18 months. 

Please know that the BroodMinder-TH device you will receive in the Combo Pack in this campaign contains a humidity sensor made by Sensirion. We have tested it extensively for accuracy, and found it to be excellent. 

This is also the device with which all the first generation devices will be replaced, free of charge, to anyone returning the devices they purchased last fall. 

We stand fully behind our products with absolute loyalty to our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, then please pass this campaign on to your beekeeping friends. We are counting on word of mouth and passing of information between beekeeping clubs and enthusiasts.  Please log onto Broodminder.com and Beekeeping.io to get a complete understanding of our history, products, and mission.

By monitoring your hive wirelessly, you can help to minimize stress on
the hive by recognizing and reacting to changes. 
The additional benefit of uploading your hive data, free of charge, to our partner, Beekeeping.io, gives you the opportunity to better understand your hive’s trends with graphing and analysis capability.  Beyond this, you will contribute your data for the common good of collecting uniform measurements on thousands of hives.  Through this, the beekeeping community will gain insights into hive distress so that, as a community, we will develop interventions to improve outcomes.
You might think, why BroodMinder? There are other scales already available.


Simple operation. We have better things to do than futz around with our phones. The total installation process takes less than a minute with no passwords or device pairing dances. It just works!

Very low radio power. We don't want to risk any effect on the bees so we are using Class 3, Bluetooth Low Energy radios.


Long battery life and long data log. Logging the data over a season will be very useful for knowing the health of the hive and having actionable data for the coming year.

Economical. Other scales cost much more, particularly when you add the communication components. We are using the principles of high volume production to achieve unheard-of prices.






Risks and Challenges

The team is well down the development path. We have
working prototypes and software under test. We have also worked hard to mitigate risk by
using production partners with many years of product development experience.
While we have learned
much about weatherproofing, we are not so bold that we think we know it all. Therefore, we
are providing a 6-month warranty for the systems and will stand behind them as
we have with the BroodMinder-TH. 
We would also like to say a few words about the BroodMinder-TH that you can order along with the scale if you choose.
The BroodMinder-TH is our second generation temperature and humidity device. It has been redesigned since the first generation that was distributed last December. Unfortunately, 2 weeks after the distribution of our first device, Texas Instruments recalled the humidity sensor in that device because it was inaccurate in a high humidity environment. SIEP#57 recall also fessed up that the sensor would drift up 15% in 18 months. 
Please know that the BroodMinder-TH device you will receive in the Combo Pack in this campaign contains a humidity sensor made by Sensirion. We have tested it extensively for accuracy, and found it to be excellent. 
This is also the device with which all the first generation devices will be replaced, free of charge, to anyone returning the devices they purchased last fall. 
We stand fully behind our products with absolute loyalty to our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't help financially, then please pass this
campaign on to your beekeeping friends. We are counting on word of mouth and
passing of information between beekeeping clubs and enthusiasts.  Please log onto Broodminder.com and Beekeeping.io to get a complete understanding of our history, products, and
mission.

story:
Did you know that radioactive waste stays severely hazardous to human health for millions of years?

Previously, nuclear waste was carelessly put into containers that got disposed into the seas. Probably people thought the barrels would hold for that long as well...
What is even worse is that these containers have become very hard to find as they've been pushed around by currents and covered by the sea bed.

For instance, lost somewhere outside the coast of Sundsvall, Sweden, are 20 000 barrels containing mercury. 

What's hidden in the water close to you?


What led up to this mess

For many years, people lived in ignorance of how the environment was being harmed by their waste. In a time when rules regarding waste handling either weren’t present or not followed in practice, the seas were considered a convenient dumping site for all kinds of waste. More so, marine dumping was the recommended way to “take care” of chemical waste. 

For companies handling toxic chemicals it was much cheaper to just fill their waste up in containers and sink them, rather than having to pay for costly secure storage. As the waste was capsuled it didn’t pose an immediate threat to the environment. Therefore many companies took the easy way out and sank their problem to the bottom of the sea. Noone will ever find out, they probably thought. Unfortunately, as time has passed the containers have started to corrode and we are now in a race against time to take care of them before an environmental disaster occurs. This is where Naiad comes in.

The project team

Naiad began a bit over a year ago with 18 Master students from Mälardalen University, Sweden. They took the project a long way but is still uncompleted. This year 12 master students, majoring in robotics and intelligent embedded systems, continues with the project aiming to finish the Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV).

Project goal

The long term plan for Naiad is to use a shoal of AUVs to systematically locate hazardous objects at the bottom of (at first) the Baltic Sea to secure a healthy environment for this and future generations. 

A shoal hunting for waste

The first step towards this goal is to develop a prototype, and that’s what you make possible by contributing to our project. The prototype will be used as a testing platform for further research. To put Naiad through some good tests, we’re aiming to compete in the 2015 editions of the RoboSub international AUV competition. This attracts the top schools from all over the world, so the competition will be tough. Naiad builds upon the experience of two previous team from Mälardalen University, Project VASA, which won the “Best Craftsmanship” award at RoboSub 2012 and the last team that began the Naiad project.

The robots will communicate via acoustic modems

Why crowdfunding?

Even though we are more aware of environmental issues today, people tend to forget about problems that they can’t see, until they blow up big time. We want to make people aware of this problem while we still have the chance to do something about it. Therefore we decided to take this opportunity to not only get funding from the crowd, but to vastly spread the word as well. So, if you care about the ocean and feel for this project, we really hope that you help us by sharing this campaign to all your friends.

Where we are right now

Thanks to our sponsoring companies, we have been able to buy most of the components we need. At this moment we are in a development phase, with most parts tested, some ready for testing and others in development.

Right now, our mechanical division is working hard to 3d print prototype wings for naiad while also milling the exchangeable tool plate which will be attached on the bottom of Naiad. The core hull is finished and have been tested to run some simple underwater tests in water together with the electronics. As of right now, the robot is able to have a stable orientation on a desired depth but lack the ability to track motion in the x- and y plane.

Our electronic division is currently building senor cards to for hydrophones, temperature sensor and battery safety. To be able to track the motion in the x- and y plane they are also prototyping different sensor to track the speed.

The design of Naiad

A peek into Naiad

The hull, almost done!

Your help is needed!

So that’s why we turn to you. We need your financial help to be able to both manufacture and buy the parts we’re missing in order to complete the system. The parts that we need to acquire are:

  • Material for milling the rest of the hull.
  • Optics for the vision system.
  • Umbilical cable with Ethernet/fiber and power.
  • Acoustic underwater modem.

Without you, the prototype will be nothing but a shell lacking the sensors needed to be of any use.

The project have a good ground but with your help we can push it through to the finish with a highly capable UAV able to search the depths for threats to the enviroment. Together, we can make this become a true success. Your contribution is of the highest value to us, regardless of its extent.


Think about the consequences if we decide not to act now. We probably won’t be able to eat fish from the seas, if there will be any, or to go for a swim with our children or grandchildren without the risk of getting contaminated. As water gives growth to everything on earth, the pollution of it will affect the whole ecosystem. Thus even the soil, our natural source of food, will be hazardous to us in the long run.

story:
We are 24 students from the University of Southern California passionate about environmental conservation and what we can do as individuals and as a group to make sure future generations can continue to experience the wonders of nature. Every year for the past two decades, this Alternative Spring Break group has traveled to Orcas Island to spend spring break volunteering at Moran State Park and soaking (literally, in the pouring rain) in a week in one of the most beautiful water environments in the US. This year's volunteer projects will include: installing picnic tables, rebuilding rotting bridges, cleaning decaying matter off the side of roads, visiting a salmon hatchery, presenting about college at the local elementary school, and volunteering at the University of Washington student-run farm during our time in Seattle. 

Comprised of diverse individuals of all ages and majors, and driven by a passion for preservation, we hope to come back from our one week journey in March 2014 with newfound knowledge about conservation methods, how the ecosystem is changing with our human footprints, and a renewed vigor for being active ambassadors of the environment. 

With your donation, we will be able to support participants on our trip who are in need of some financial assistance and also have funds to scale our efforts and purchase necessary materials for our volunteer projects! Thank you for reading and supporting, share this with everyone you know, and together we can help save the environment!

story:
Update (8/15/14): Thanks to everyone who contributed to help us reach our $4,000 goal!  We are currently in the midst of a Public Service Commission investigation of the water company that has been delayed by the water company's refusal to answer many questions that we and others have been asking, especially related to their emergency planning and preparedness.  Because of the delay in the case, we are seeking additional funds to support an extension of our organizer's time.   


Who We Are:

Citizens in West Virginia are coming together to create a blueprint for a safe and healthy water system for the nine-county region impacted by the January 2014 chemical spill into the Elk River.  We are paying among the highest water rates but we have one of the leakiest and least safe systems.  Without changes to the system, we risk a needless repeat of this year’s water crisis!

Advocates for a Safe Water System is a community group that formed after the January 9th, 2014 chemical spill that contaminated the drinking water for 300,000 people -- the largest drinking water contamination event in US history.  The chemical mixture that spilled, crude MCHM and PPH, is used in washing coal.  The local health department estimates that 100,000 people experienced symptoms from drinking ,smelling or contacting the chemicals in the weeks following the spill; there is no data on the long-term health impacts from exposure to these chemicals. 

What We Are Doing:

Advocates for a Safe Water System formed because we were outraged that our water utility, WV American Water, continued to bill us for water that was making people sick!  

We then discovered how ill-prepared WV American Water was for the spill:

  • They had no upstream monitoring in place and were not even aware of the potential contaminants to our drinking water supply.  
  • Their water filters absorbed some of the chemical and then slowly released it, so the filters became an ongoing source of MCHM contamination for several months after the spill.  
  • They had no alternative source of water available as back-up when the spill happened.  
  • After the Bureau of Public Health conducted an assessment in 2002 that found that WV American Water's system highly susceptible to contamination, the utility did nothing with this information.  

Our communities deserve a safe and healthy water system.  Our state Public Service Commission, which regulates the water utility, just launched an investigation into WV American Water’s response to the spill, which will be ongoing through the end of 2014.  We are working to ensure that citizen voices and concerns are heard in this investigation.  We are planning to draw on local expertise in sourcewater protection, upstream monitoring, and water treatment and infrastructure to create a blueprint for a safe and healthy water system for the area impacted by the Elk River spill.  This blueprint, a Citizen's Water Utility Plan, will serve as the basis for our advocacy at the Public Service Commission and state legislature.

Why We Need Your Help:

We cannot accomplish all of this without your support!  By donating, you will help us:

  • Support a part-time organizer to coordinate volunteers who will help make our voices heard to the PSC and state legislators for four  months  
  • Fund technical support and expertise to help us come up with our vision for a safer, more robust water system
  • Ensure 300,000 people have clean, safe water

If you want to make a tax-deductible contribution, you may donate through our fiscal sponsor, WV Citizen Action Education Fund, at www.wvcaef.org (please write "Advocates for a Safe Water System" in the "purpose" line of your donation).

story:
Our Story

I am a fourth year University student currently completing the Gold Level of the Duke of Edinburgh Award. An important component of the award is the completion of an "Adventurous Journey"; six days spent on an outdoor expedition.


I am raising funds to participate in this Journey and for the training required. I will be taking a six-day kayak trip from Key River, ON to Killarney Provincial Park, on a group sea-kayaking expedition in Georgian Bay. As this is a potentially dangerous expedition, I will also be participating in the necessary training in order to make sure I take all the necessary safety precautions on my trip and am as knowledgeable as possible when it comes to sea kayaking.

What I Need & What You Get

My funding requirements are a follows:


$1100-- Funding the actual expedition

http://northernedgealgonquin.com/key-river-to-killarney.html 


$400-- Preliminary Practice Journey (Required): Sea Kayaking in the Bay of Fundy, NB

http://www.freshairadventure.com/multiday.html 


$100-- Kayaking Lessons and Training: May to July at the Fredericton Small Craft Aquatic Centre

http://www.fredericton.ca/en/recleisure/smallcraftaquaticcentre.asp 


$300-- Travel and Health Expenses (Toronto to Northern Edge Algonquin), Taxes, and IndieGoGo fees.


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
What do we hope to accomplish?

To study these magnificent creatures,we will embark on a week-long sailing expedition to search for the elusive marine mammals that inhabit the coastal and offshore habitats of Belize!  We’ll be sailing across open waters to photograph and identify animals, using underwater microphones to study their sounds and communication. We’ll fly small drones to capture aerial footage that will give us insight into the movement, behavior, and health of these species, inviting additional scientific collaborators to enrich our findings! Using biopsy sampling and genetic testing, we’ll determine if the whale and dolphin species found here are isolated from other populations which helps to protect them in areas where resources may be threatened or scarce. First and foremost, we will report on the biodiversity we encounter on this expedition and collect information about species habitats for improved conservation management.

Our Impact

With this research, we can better inform authorities about the lives of marine mammals in Belize. Our team works directly in collaboration with many NGO’s and managing authorities in Belize. We’ll translate our findings into practical recommendations that the government can use to make informed decisions about how to protect and maintain local populations. Our team released this publication regarding the presence of aquatic mammals in Belize and expressed the need for future research efforts.


Why we’re here and why you should be a part of ocean conservation.

Belize is home to part of the Mesoamerican Reef, the largest barrier reef in the Western Hemisphere. Its home to more than 16 species of marine mammals including whales, dolphins, and manatees. We still have so much to learn about their lives, and the challenges they face.

But protecting marine mammals requires critical, high-quality data on which species are around and how to best protect them from the threats they face. Before our first research expedition, there have been no systematic surveys of marine mammals in Belize. Expedition Echo will change that! Expedition Echo is our second research expedition to study the whales and dolphins in the deep waters of Belize to fill the knowledge  gap to ensure the long-term protection of marine mammals in Belize.

Seismic surveys

Just last year, Belize opened its waters to seismic testing to assess for offshore drilling. These operations have been shown to harm animals that rely on sound for their survival, like dolphins and whales. Now, it is more important than never that we understand the marine mammal populations in Belize and how vital these waters are to their survival. Having access to this scale of information can help us advocate for their wellbeing. Help us protect the manatees, dolphins and whales of Belize!

Funding

We’ve already raised a fair bit to support our goals, we've applied for grants and even received private funding. WE ARE HALFWAY THERE, please help us strive to embark on a 500 kilometer journey, diving deep into into the lives of whales and dolphins in the Caribbean.

The PERKS of supporting ocean conservation..

 

Other ways to help support whales and dolphin research

1. Share this project!

Please share the campaign on social media. Sharing is one of the best ways to help us reach the right audience.

2. Donate your gear!
We are especially interested in gear that will support ocean research and media. The ocean can be rough on technology and we will happily accept new or used gear in working condition. We are looking for the following: 

  1. DSLR cameras & gear (The salty ocean is rough on our equipment, so your trash may be our treasure since we always need replacements!)
  2. 300-400mm Telephoto Lenses
  3. Cetacean Research Technology SQ/CR hydrophones
  4. A 6-track audio recorder with input for CRT SQ/CR hydrophones.
  5. GPS Units
  6. GPS Trackers for passive acoustic monitoring units
  7. Hero4 Black GoPros
  8. Any long-term passive acoustic monitoring units
  9. Pelican Case / SKB Waterproof Travel Cases
3. Have an idea to help us accomplish our goals? Contact us if you have an offer to help the marine mammals in Belize!
 

Help us launch Expedition Echo and be a part of ocean conservation in action!

 

TEAM LEADERS

Kristi Ashley Collom

Kristi Ashley Collom is an MA student in the Animal Behavior and Conservation Biology program at Hunter College, currently evaluating critical habitats for Bottlenose dolphins (Tursiops truncatus) in the New York Bight and collaborating with researchers on various marine mammal projects in the Caribbean with Dr. Diana Reiss.  She had her first encounter with dolphins at Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve in Northern Belize and was inspired to pursue a career in ocean conservation. At the American Museum of Natural History, you can find her inspiring young minds and fiddling with specimens. Kristi is launching this campaign in an effort to facilitate this week-long expedition which will report on the species of marine mammals in the relatively unexplored regions of Belize. 

Eric Angel Ramos

Eric Angel Ramos is a fourth-year Ph.D. student in Animal Behavior and Comparative Psychology at The Graduate Center, City University of New York. Since, 2011, Eric has lead research trips with students and volunteers to study the behavior of bottlenose dolphins (Tursiops truncatus) and Antillean manatees (Trichechus manatus manatus) at Turneffe Atoll in Belize as a member of Dr. Diana Reiss’ lab at Hunter College and a field scientist for Oceanic Society. His research has focused on the behavioral ecology, communication and conservation of marine mammals in Belize. During his master’s thesis research at Hunter College, Eric investigated the use of foraging-related calls by the small population of bottlenose dolphins at Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve (TAMR) in Belize, providing the first report of this acoustic call in dolphins and demonstrated its contextual use during bottom foraging by a subset of the population; work that is currently being submitted for publication. In collaboration with Dr. Magnasco at The Rockefeller University, he piloted the use of Unmanned Aerial Systems for observing and tracking bottlenose dolphins and Antillean manatees to conduct studies on their communication and behavior in the wild.

We still have so much to learn about their lives, and the challenges they face.But protecting marine mammals requires critical, high-quality data on which species are around and how to best protect them from the threats they face. Before our first research expedition, there have been no systematic surveys of marine mammals in Belize. Expedition Echo will change that! Expedition Echo is our second research expedition to study the whales and dolphins in the deep waters of Belize to fill the knowledge  gap to ensure the long-term protection of marine mammals in Belize.Seismic surveysJust last year, Belize opened its waters to seismic testing to assess for offshore drilling. These operations have been shown to harm animals that rely on sound for their survival, like dolphins and whales. Now, it is more important than never that we understand the marine mammal populations in Belize and how vital these waters are to their survival. Having access to this scale of information can help us advocate for their wellbeing. Help us protect the manatees, dolphins and whales of Belize!FundingWe’ve already raised a fair bit to support our goals, we've applied for grants and even received private funding. WE ARE HALFWAY THERE, please help us strive to embark on a 500 kilometer journey, diving deep into into the lives of whales and dolphins in the Caribbean.The PERKS of supporting ocean conservation.. Other ways to help support whales and dolphin research1. Share this project!Please share the campaign on social media. Sharing is one of the best ways to help us reach the right audience.2. Donate your gear!We are especially interested in gear that will support ocean research and media. The ocean can be rough on technology and we will happily accept new or used gear in working condition. We are looking for the following: 
DSLR cameras & gear (The salty ocean is rough on our equipment, so your trash may be our treasure since we always need replacements!)
300-400mm Telephoto Lenses
Cetacean Research Technology SQ/CR hydrophones
A 6-track audio recorder with input for CRT SQ/CR hydrophones.
GPS Units
GPS Trackers for passive acoustic monitoring units
Hero4 Black GoPros
Any long-term passive acoustic monitoring units
Pelican Case / SKB Waterproof Travel Cases

3. Have an idea to help us accomplish our goals? Contact us if you have an offer to help the marine mammals in Belize!
 
Help us launch Expedition Echo and be a part of ocean conservation in action! TEAM LEADERSKristi Ashley CollomKristi Ashley Collom is an MA student in the Animal Behavior and Conservation Biology program at Hunter College, currently evaluating critical habitats for Bottlenose dolphins (Tursiops truncatus) in the New York Bight and collaborating with researchers on various marine mammal projects in the Caribbean with Dr. Diana Reiss.  She had her first encounter with dolphins at Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve in Northern Belize and was inspired to pursue a career in ocean conservation. At the American Museum of Natural History, you can find her inspiring young minds and fiddling with specimens. Kristi is launching this campaign in an effort to facilitate this week-long expedition which will report on the species of marine mammals in the relatively unexplored regions of Belize. Eric Angel RamosEric Angel Ramos is a fourth-year Ph.D. student in Animal Behavior and Comparative Psychology at The Graduate Center, City University of New York. Since, 2011, Eric has lead research trips with students and volunteers to study the behavior of bottlenose dolphins (Tursiops truncatus) and Antillean manatees (Trichechus manatus manatus) at Turneffe Atoll in Belize as a member of Dr. Diana Reiss’ lab at Hunter College and a field scientist for Oceanic Society. His research has focused on the behavioral ecology, communication and conservation of marine mammals in Belize. During his master’s thesis research at Hunter College, Eric investigated the use of foraging-related calls by the small population of bottlenose dolphins at Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve (TAMR) in Belize, providing the first report of this acoustic call in dolphins and demonstrated its contextual use during bottom foraging by a subset of the population; work that is currently being submitted for publication. In collaboration with Dr. Magnasco at The Rockefeller University, he piloted the use of Unmanned Aerial Systems for observing and tracking bottlenose dolphins and Antillean manatees to conduct studies on their communication and behavior in the wild.

story:
Bref résumé de l’entreprise :

Produits Naturels Fairyza est une entreprise de vente au détail de produits Québécois écologiques ayant ouvert ses portes en avril 2014. Elle se spécialise dans la vente d’une vaste gamme de produits d’entretien et personnels en vrac. En plus de fournir des services de qualité, elle a aussi pour mission d'informer les gens sur l'importance d'utiliser des produits écologiques tout autant pour protéger leur santé que pour l'environnement. La propriétaire Isabelle Grenon, une jeune femme passionnée et dynamique, par sa formation en biologie souhaite informer les gens sur les différentes molécules chimiques contenues dans les produits utilisés au quotidien. Elle a à cœur de vous aider à trouver des alternatives saines.

De plus, l'entreprise par souci écologique et économique, s'approvisionne auprès de compagnies Québécoises afin de minimiser son impact écologique et participer à encourager l'économie de la province. Par souci pour l'environnement, l'entreprise désire tendre vers le zéro-déchets en réduisant ses déchets et en encourageant sa clientèle à adopter de bonnes pratiques pour atteindre cet objectif. L’entreprise est aussi un point de chute pour la distribution de paniers biologiques.

Le projet : Que voulons-nous faire exactement :

Nous essayons de plus en plus de faire attention à notre santé en mangeant des aliments sains et goûteux. Nous faisons des efforts pour que nos soins de santé soient le plus naturel possible,  les produits offerts par l'industrie contenant des ingrédients nocifs à la santé. Une autre problématique s’impose, l'industrie alimentaire utilise des emballages qui sont ensuite jetés et deviennent une nuisance pour l'environnement. Ces mêmes emballages contiennent souvent des molécules chimiques nocives pour la santé humaine. Le concept de zéro déchet prend de l'ampleur au Québec et la population se tourne vers de nouvelles habitudes de consommation. La demande est de plus en plus forte, mais l'offre est très faible, surtout dans des régions éloignées comme la nôtre. On note une augmentation de personnes désirant concevoir leurs propres fabrications de produit d’entretien et de cosmétique pour la consommation quotidienne de leur famille : Le « Do-it-yourself » (DIY) est une tendance en vogue.

Afin de continuer dans sa lancée, Produits naturels Fairyza désire effectuer un changement de cap. Cette restructuration se fera sous 3 (trois) volets qui sont les suivants :

À court terme

  • Volet 1 : Incorporation d’une section alimentaire zéro-déchets en vrac
  • Volet 2 : Ajout de bases de fabrication pour le DIY en vrac

À long terme

  • Volet 3 : Installation d’un café écologique

NOTRE MISSION

  • Fournir des alternatives saines et écologiques aux produits de consommation quotidiens
  • Fournir de l'information sur l'importance d'éliminer les polluants chimiques qui s'accumulent dans le corps humain et dans l'environnement, qui causent un tort immense sur les différents écosystèmes de la planète et sur la santé humaine.
  • Contribuer à diminuer l'impact écologique de l'humain en fournissant des produits en vrac éliminant ainsi l'emballage inutile et l'apport de déchets supplémentaire.
  • Encourager l’économie locale, régionale et provinciale en se s’approvisionnant chez des fournisseurs D’ICI!

Nous souhaitons surtout faire une différence pour rendre le monde plus sain!

 

Pourquoi le socio-financement?

Économiquement, nous pouvons tous faire une différence, voici comment :

Si les gens prennent mieux soin de leur corps et de leur environnement immédiat, moins de frais devront être investis dans des dépenses de santé et ceux-ci pourront être reportés dans l’éducation et d’autres sphères importantes de la société. Si nous produisons moins de déchets, les dépenses qui servent à entretenir les sites d’enfouissement pourront elles aussi être mieux réparties. L’entreprise a la conviction que c’est une question sociale de prendre les mesures nécessaires pour réduire notre empreinte écologique tout en prenant conscience de ce que nous ingérons.

Voici notre slogan d’entreprise ; Pour monde meilleur… chaque petit geste compte! Nous pensons que si chacun fait une action, si petite qu’elle soit, cela aura un effet papillon qui nous permettra de mettre en place une vague qui se répercutera à long terme sur notre avenir, celui de nos enfants et de notre planète. C’est pourquoi nous demandons votre aide pour nous permettre de mettre en place ce projet innovateur!

Le projet d'utiliser une plateforme de financement participatif à été introduit par la clientèle qui désirait faire sa part pour nous aider à réaliser le projet.

La problématique!

Chaque année, des milliers de tonnes de plastique sont déversés dans l’environnement par l’humain. Portés par le vent et l’eau, une grande partie de ces déchets de plastique s’accumulent dans les océans. Ils forment même ce qu’on appelle des continents

Saviez-vous que :

  • La production mondiale de plastique est de 311 millions de tonnes en 2014
  • En 2014, une étude estimait la surface des océans à 5250 milliards de particules, soit 269 000 tonnes de plastique
  • Si nous continuons notre consommation de plastique, en 2050 il y aura plus de plastique que de poissons dans les océans
  • Ces déchets flottants ont une incidence extrême sur la faune et la flore marine
  • Ces déchets peuvent aussi concentrer les polluants organiques et altérer le fonctionnement des chaînes alimentaires
  • Selon la matière plastique, il peut mettre entre 100 à 8000 ans à se dégrader dans l’environnement (une couche jetable peut prendre 500 ans avant de se dégrader)
  • La plupart des plastiques sont recyclés, mais plusieurs sont jetés aux ordures ménagères, comme les emballages alimentaires appelés plastiques mous
  • En 2011, au Québec, nous produisons 13 millions de tonnes de déchets par année : soit un camion de 25 tonnes à la minute.

De plus, les coûts reliés à l’emballage font partie du prix que nous payons lors de nos achats. En supprimant ces dépenses, nous économisons.

Acheter en vrac permet aussi de choisir les quantités appropriés pour les besoins de son foyer. Cela permet d’éliminer le gaspillage et inévitablement la quantité de détritus envoyés dans l’environnement!

Le concept de vrac :

Pourquoi acheter en vrac :

  • Éviter le gaspillage alimentaire en choisissant la quantité qui convient à la consommation de votre famille
  • Réduire ses déchets en éliminant le suremballage
  • Participer à l'élimination d'une parte de la pollution
  • Diminuer les coûts reliés à l’emballage
  • Choisir des produits frais et sains de provenance locale

Pour nous, il est très important d’instaurer un milieu au niveau d’hygiène très élevé. Nous avons décidé de travailler avec des pots de verre style « Mason » afin de contrôler les germes et bactéries.

Lorsque le client apportera un contenant, il sera mis de côté afin qu’il soit aseptisé. Nous fournirons donc nos denrées dans nos propres pots qui auront été stérilisés au préalable.

Les pots seront remplis par notre équipe afin de contrôler les conditions d’hygiène.

Les produits fournis seront des noix, grains, céréales, légumineuses, farines, huiles, vinaigres, riz, pâtes, fruits séchés, épices, tisanes, thés et bien plus…

À quoi serviront vos dons :

Les dons serviront principalement pour acquérir les stocks, les équipements qui serviront au bon fonctionnement du concept de vrac. Ils seront aussi utilisés pour se procurer les permis et les autorisations nécessaires pour l’ouverture de la section vrac. Si l’objectif final n’est pas atteint, les fonds iront quand même dans le projet, car plusieurs scénarios ont été prévus.

D’autres façons d’aider

Toute aide est la bienvenue! Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, il est possible de faire votre part en partageant à vos proches le plus possible les informations concernant le projet, en en parlant autour de vous, en encourageant la boutique ou en proposant de mettre la main à pâte!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
