story:
Looking to be a part of the solution to the worst fire season we have seen in years?

*************Update *********
The Shepherds way camp had very few people left when we arrived. We gave them a water tank to protect their site and diverted 99% percent of materials to the Tunk Valley, where it was desperately needed. The volunteers in Tunk where overwhelming with their gratitude for supplies. Many were still fighting for their homes.  I have never seen such a devastated seen nor more resilience.  All donations from here on out will be sent to fund equipment for the Tunk Valley volunteer fire department and  locals who lost everything.  When I arrived, the volunteer chief was relaying messages via courier, they lacked even radios.

We are The Sea School Cooperative, a nonprofit educational organization assisting in statewide coordination efforts of donations for victims of the wildfires. You can become a link in the chain to make everyone stronger. Our staff has been on the ground in Winthop providing mobile tankers, food and labor.  This is the most effective local effort we know of. They are making a difference, but they need support.  We are looking to get more supplies into the hands of locals to help them in their efforts to save their homes and livelihoods and to support the firefighters risking their lives. We are planning a supply trip for pickup truck pump setups. Rural Tanker Trucks (RTT's), food and sundries.  #getinthefightwa


What We Need & What You Get

Crisis Equipment: Each pump rig is $500 for the water container, pump and hoses (Rural Tanker Truck). These are highly mobile vehicles able to manage the rough terrain of Eastern Washington.  We need gas funds to get them from Long Beach to Springdale. With $3000 we will be able to get them four  RTTs and supplies enough for hundreds. Once we reach that goal, we will expand our reach.

Basic Needs: They are in desperate need for extra large tarps, tents, blankets, non-perishable foods, baby formula, diapers (cloth or disposable), dog food, basic medical supplies (band-aids, saline, q tips, cotton balls/swabs, alcohol, hydrogen pyroxide, etc). Please contact us if you have items to donate as well as funds and we will coordinate pick ups along the I-5 corridor.  Everything helps. We are a 501c3 and every donation is tax deductible.

The Impact

As you can hear in the video, there are not enough firefighters or equipment. Fires are popping up and will grow and combine without equipment on the ground to help in the efforts. Getting water mobile in the area will enable firefighters greater ability to fight small fires before they can grow. Giving them food, a place to sleep and toiletries will enable the fire fighters to fight harder, and for locals to feel they can pick up their lives again.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on all your social media outlets, and spread the word to 

#getinthefightwa !  Every voice is important. If you would like to be a coordination point for goods donations, please contact Lee or Jason. When we come together, nothing can defeat our goodwill. Much love and blessings.

Please contact us if you have items to donate as well as funds and we will coordinate pick ups along the I-5 corridor.  Everything helps. We are a 501c3 and every donation is tax deductible.

Getting water mobile in the area will enable firefighters greater ability to fight small fires before they can grow. Giving them food, a place to sleep and toiletries will enable the fire fighters to fight harder, and for locals to feel they can pick up their lives again.

  Other Ways You Can Help Please share this on all your social media outlets, and spread the word to 
#getinthefightwa !  Every voice is important. If you would like to be a coordination point for goods donations, please contact Lee or Jason. When we come together, nothing can defeat our goodwill. Much love and blessings.

story:
My name is Soren Kurth and I am a Life Scout in Troop 543 of Bristol VT. 

An eagle project is a project to benefit a local church, school, or organization.  For my project I am building sorting stations for the local school's cafeteria. This will make it easier for kids to sort their compost, recycling, and trash into 3 different containers, each going to a different spot. I am building these stations in association with Stark Mountain Woodworking, and designing them with the Environmental Actions Group at Mt. Abraham Union High School. The total cost of the materials is going to be between 1200 and 1500 dollars. Stark Mountain and the Environmental Actions Group are donating a fair portion of the cost. However with that said I still need to raise somewhere around 500 dollars to 700 dollars. Mt. Abe has been working extremely hard to become more and more environmentally friendly, and these sorting stations will be a huge helping hand in their mission. Please consider donating, anything is appreciated!

story:
Summary

A little bit more about the center:

The Audubon Center at Debs Park is an environmental education and conservation center for the communities of Northeast Los Angeles and the region.

The center was the first building in the nation to receive a Platinum LEED rating from the US Green Building Council.

4700 North Griffin Ave.
Los Angeles, CA 90031
(323) 221-2255

Hours:
Tuesday - Saturday
9 a.m to 5 p.m.

What We Need & What You Get

All monies raised will go directly to The Audubon Center.

The Impact

Your donation will help fund much needed environmental programs.  The center serves 16,500 annual visitors.  2,400 students, mostly from low-income schools, visit the center through their Nature's Classroom program and other educational fieldtrips.

The Audubon Center is working with the Los Angeles Conservation Corps and the Arroyo Green Team, their junior naturalists, to restore nearly 80 acres of wildlife habitat in Debs Park.

story:
In Brief

Organic Soul is an online publication and social media platform looking to make a real difference. We pride ourselves on high-quality content, including articles, advice, and reviews, as well as new avenues to engage readers and have readers engage with each other. Over the past few months, we’ve developed a strong base of over 14,000 users (and growing) who are attuned to the world and its issues. Like us, these readers also want to make a difference.

 

To do this, Organic Soul has developed innovative ways of bringing people and information together to promote activism, change, and community growth. Organic Soul looks to connect readers with the medical professionals, academics, researchers, and, most importantly, each other. We strongly believe that pulling together a wealth of knowledge and critically deliberating on its content will produce solutions.

 

By donating to Organic Soul, you’ll enjoy a number of perks (found to the right of this), but also find solace in the fact that you’re helping the world take the next step in the environmental movement. We aren’t trying to simply change things here at Organic Soul; we’re trying to change the way people think about those things. Taking better care of our planet, each other, and ourselves should never go out of style.

 

Our interest is in the movement, the people, and in bettering the world. With your donations, we can come closer to realizing our goals!

Our Story

“Living a natural, holistic, and sustainable (eco-friendly) lifestyle should be simple and attainable for everyone.”

Organic Soul launched in 2010 with powerful goals in mind: increase awareness on environmental issues, while simultaneously creating a community, a place where all people of all ages could come together, learn, and share their thoughts about major issues the world and its people face.

Creator of the site, Jameson Morris, 22, hopes to bring this vision to more people than ever before, and in an all-new way. Organic Soul isn’t just a discussion board, nor is it simply a medium for content to be thrown at you. Organic Soul is something much more – it provides a platform for people to engage with information, to suggest their own ideas, and ask real professionals real questions that concern them. Furthermore, Organic Soul plans to connect those in the community to the most ethical businesses; living an eco-conscious lifestyle shouldn’t be some luxury – it should be simple and attainable for everyone.

The other side of the site is Jesse Richardson, 21, who operates as the Editor-in-Chief. Richardson is scheduled to graduate from the University of California, Los Angeles in June 2011 for political science. He is an avid supporter of grass roots campaigning and has been involved with several college-based initiatives. Richardson will be in Washington D.C. from March to June performing research on green education, its role in the transition to green industry, and potential strategies that can be adopted in the classroom to promote critical thinking style approaches to social problems. He hopes to conduct several research projects, many of which he will publish and seek collaboration on with Organic Soul and its users.

The site has been completely developed by the two, and they hope to continue to move forward in the coming year. Interestingly, Morris and Richardson have been childhood friends since they grew up together in Alta, Wyoming, some 10 years ago.

“We’re really proud with what we’ve done so far, but we know there is still much to be done… We’ve faced a lot of hurdles and we’re ready to face the next.” – Organic Soul

 

The Impact

Donating to Organic Soul creates a generous ripple effect. Organic Soul has already begun developing a platform for user-based charity, targeting initiatives like green charter schools, organic consumer think tanks, forest protection initiatives, urban redevelopment and support for charities. 5% of all donations will be set aside for the launch of this feature to help with maintenance, user support, charity outreach initiatives, and promotions.

In addition to direct community donations, however, Organic Soul will be able to aggressively pursue new styles of information delivery, community integration, and user-based deliberation. Organic Soul plans to provide direct access to health care professionals, having doctors answer real questions by users. On top of that, Organic Soul will be able to present a new style of content: a two-sided article – a social science approach to information, laying out the facts and implications, and a health science approach, presenting tips and commentary from professionals.

We strongly believe that the best approach to combating our most pressing issues is community awareness and organization. Whether it is new information and solutions to our energy crisis, or ways to combat the genetically modified food epidemic, Organic Soul hopes to provide users with the resources to make wise and balanced decisions. Organic Soul hopes to lead in the pursuit of institutionalized social responsibility, both in mind and in practice.

Organic Soul is about giving the community information that is both practical and useful. By donating, you’ll help us reach our goal, which is, in essence, what enables this movement to have such a great impact on the world.

To see some of the content, ideas, and opinions expressed on Organic Soul, we recommend such articles as 10 Reasons Why Going Organic Makes a Difference, Disease on the Dinner Plate? How GMOs are Affecting our Health, Social Responsibility: Fact or Fiction?, and Turn that Frown Upside Down: Food Therapy for Depression.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Organic Soul is looking to take the web by storm, pulling in new audiences from around the world to start a truly global community. To do this, Organic Soul must redevelop its web site in addition to hiring a freelnace staff to manage, produce, and publish content that is both informative and engaging. The site must also attract users in a fashion that is creative; as the web becomes saturated with content, it’s crucial for successful ideas to stand out and produce something outside the norm.

Donations will go to three major pools of funding: website development and maintenance, content production and management, and community outreach/marketing development. Ideally, the site will be able to pull in larger sponsorships, and eventually, the community will drive the site, removing the need for donation-based funding. Already, the site has posted a 34.4% monthly average unique visitor increase with little to no cost marketing. All in all, the site has made a total jump of 213% (roughly 14000 users) over a 5-month period.

This proves that Organic Soul, its mission, and its values are acting as a clarion call for people concerned with their health and who are attuned to the world and its problems. The success so far, however, is just a drop in the bucket: to be truly successful, the site must continue to expand and offer unique avenues for users to engage with their peers. Spreading information on new ways to engage in education, holistic health care, and community togetherness is the means by which we will achieve a better functioning society, nation, and world as a whole.

 

So, what’s in it for the donors?

 

Every donor will have access to our unique list of perks displayed next to this listing.

Above all, donors get the satisfaction of knowing they are contributing to a grass roots campaign with world-wide ambitions. It is both of the creators’ dream to be able to provide a real platform for change, and they confidently believe in their project. For supporting that, we thank you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Organic Soul is just that – a movement that requires its users to help it grow organically. Spreading news about the site by word of mouth, social networking, newsletters, or any other means is the best thing our supporters can do. Get your friends, family and loved ones involved! Be sure to get involved yourself! Ask us questions, join our discussions, and express your opinions!

Finally, Organic Soul is also always looking for collaborators to come on board as content providers. Whether it’s a great organic dish or a unique look at urban development, we’d love to hear your ideas. We strongly believe the seed of one good idea can turn into the reality of a revolution; let’s get that seed planted!

If you have any questions, comments, or suggestions, please do not hesitate to contact us.

 

With love,

 

-Organic Soul

 

Contact:

Jameson Morris: jmorris@organicsoul.org

Jesse Richardson: jesse@organicsoul.org

www.organicsoul.org

story:
My Story

Volunteering has always been a huge part of my life. I have worked for many years now with the Volunteers of America, Snohomish Health and Safety Network, Boys and Girls Club, and many other organizations. Working at food banks or with underprivileged children are just a couple of things I have done. I was recognized by the Wall Street Journal as their National Student of the Month in December 2009 and Snohomish Boys and Girls Clubâ€™s Youth of the Year 2010. However with all that aside, it has always been my dream to take this passion for volunteering abroad, and make a difference around the world. I may now finally have the chance as I have been selected to serve as an international ambassador of the United States to volunteer in Australia this summer with International Student Volunteers (ISV), a U.S.-based non-profit organization. I am seeking your sponsorship, so that I can make a difference abroad this summer.

 

ISV is an internationally recognized and awarded organization that appoints university students from the U.S., Canada, Australia and the U.K. to various countries around the world in an effort to impact entire communities and endangered habitats in need. 

The Impact

While on my environmental conservation program, Iâ€™ll receive hands-on, practical experience supporting such issues as endangered species preservation or habitat restoration, which will strengthen my understanding of the world at large and lead me on a path of ecological conservation to impact our world for years to come. Past ISV volunteers have rescued sea turtles, rehabilitated cheetahs, and assisted with reforestation and organic farming efforts, among other assignments. With your help, I will be able to broaden my awareness of environmental issues and sustainability, as well as aid in the safekeeping of flora and fauna. If we don't care for the earth we live on, there won't be one anymore.

What We Need & What You Get

I am so excited to have an opportunity to assist others in the world, but, as you may know, international travel can be somewhat costly. This is why Iâ€™m asking for your help. I would genuinely appreciate, however large or small, any financial support you might offer.


Your donation will go toward my program and travel costs (approx. $5,000), covering my accommodations, most meals, project materials and support, ground transportation, and tour guidance.


The video I have provided mentions an additional trip to the beautiful Fiji, however I will not be doing that so you can be reassured that your money is going towards making a difference in the world and not a vacation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If helping financially is not an option for you or if you would just like to help in another way, please spread the word! Sharing my campaign with friends or family would be immensely helpful. Post it on your Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media sites out there! Also, if your business, or if you know of one, that would be willing to sponsor me, let me know! I have tax-deductible forms for them as they are donating to a U.S. non-profit, and I would be more than happy to talk with them about it!  


Your support means so much to me and I wouldn't be able to volunteer in the ways I have always dreamed of without the help of all you out there.

story:
If you live or work in anywhere along the coastal zones bordering the Mediterranean Sea, Central and Southern California in the US, North Mexico, coastal Western Australia and South Australia, the Chilean coast and the Western Cape region in South Africa... you enjoy a very favourable combination of outdoor temperature, solar radiation, rain and wind - environments that are ideal for Humans, animals and plants to live and prosper. Often though these favourable conditions don’t exist in your home – and if they do, it is at the cost of a lot of resources – energy, water and materials... that weigh on your pocket and the environment.

Did you know that in if you live in one of these areas your home can be super comfortable with no energy input? Learn how to “unplug” your home!

In 2007 the Sustainable Construction Team published the “Sustainable Construction” book in Portugal (10.500 copies sold) and launched the web page www.construcaosustentavel.pt(www.sustainableconstruction.eu). These soon became the reference of sustainable construction for the Mediterranean Climate Region. In order to reach a larger proportion of the population living in regions that enjoy the Mediterranean Climate, all this relevant information, essential to improve the quality of the built environment, must now be made available also in English.

For a complete rundown of the cost structure, check the FAQ.

Buildings must add value to our lives 

The first task of the Sustainable Construction Team is to translate the book into English, with updated contents and links to inspiring complementary information and the second task is to develop a simple to use “e-Tool of Thumb”, both in Portuguese and English, in order to support good decision making among those who wish to improve their living conditions at home.

People need healthy and comfortable Indoor Environments 

Whether you live in coastal zones bordering the Mediterranean Sea, Central and Southern California in the US, North Mexico, coastal Western Australia and South Australia, the Chilean coast and the Cape Town region of South Africa – with the support of the e-Book and “e-Tool of Thumb” you will be able to make the right decisions about improving the energy environmental performance of your home!

 

Where the Mediterranean Climate prevails the built environment must aim to provide excellent living conditions with minimal finite resource input!

The Sustainable Construction Team is convinced that making widely available in Portuguese and English the concepts and robust measures leading to sustainable construction on the web, in the e-Book and in the “e-Tool of Thumb”, will constitute an effective step towards overcoming one of the main barriers that is preventing the mainstreaming of sustainable construction and refurbishment: the lack of reliable and robust information available to decision makers at the right time, language and place.

Decision makers need access to the relevant information in a language they understand

With your support and funding of this project, you will make it possible for the Sustainable Construction Team to translate and to update the contents of the present book into English and to make all the information available in the following formats:

·       Thee-Book in an illustrated PDF format, with hyperlinks to complementary information available online (audio and visual) in Portuguese and English – on sale one month after you get it in case you select this perk;

·       The online “e-Tool of Thumb”to help you make the right decisions to improve your living conditions at home, in Portuguese and English – on sale one month after you get it in case you select this perk.

·       Online in the sustainable construction web page, using an open format, in Portuguese and English;

Win - Inhabitants enjoy health and comfort

Win - The construction sector’s activity becomes recognized for adding value to society

Win - The Planet’s resources are put to excellent use

By funding our project you will not only be able to get your copy of the e-Book “39 Steps: Sustainable Construction and Refurbishment in the Mediterranean Climate” (in English or Portuguese) and access to the online “e-Tool of Thumb” – all of which will help you to make the right decisions on improving the living conditions in your home - you will also help us to make available all this relevant information on how to make buildings add value to people’s lives, online in a simpler format, so that anyone whose actions and decisions influence the quality of the built environment you inhabit, anywhere where the Mediterranean Climate prevails world wide, will be in a position to make better decisions...

This is not only a way you can improve the living conditions in your own home, it is also an effective way you can really influence the quality of the wider built environment you inhabit!

Total Quality = more health, more comfort, less energy, less water and better environment 

Support this project by selecting one of the Funding options we propose and share it with your friends...

About the “e-Tool of Thumb”:

Introduce simple specific data about your home into the “e-Tool of Thumb” and you will understand how the holistic bioclimatic design principles, presented in the e-book, apply to the specific context and conditions of your home. You will then be encouraged to make the right decisions to improve the health and comfort of your home while reducing your energy and water bills and while improving the environment.

About the Sustainable Construction® Team:

The brand Construção Sustentável® belongs to Bluecity Construction Ltd, a private company that builds on the experience gathered over more than 20 years, centred on designing, promoting, selling, monitoring and managing some of the benchmark buildings that flag sustainable construction in the Mediterranean Climate Region. Bluecity focuses on disseminating all the content gathered over many years of experience and on facilitating the development of new contents by participating in and coordinating open innovation networks, involving the relevant actors of the sustainable construction value chain. Check out the Company Profile.

FAQ:

Why is Sustainable Construction relevant?

If you live in a home that is ill adapted to the prevalent climate, you won’t enjoy healthy and comfortable indoor conditions – often you won’t achieve health and comfort, even when you try to create these conditions artificially.

Also, almost 40% of the energy produced world wide is used to make buildings inhabitable – how can this statistic make sense when applied to the Mediterranean Climate - where average temperatures are so favourable to people?

Isn’t Sustainable Construction expensive?

Did you know that in some continents (Europe as an example) a building will, on average, double its construction costs in between 7 to 20 years? So the answer to this question is another more pertinent one: can we afford not to mainstream Sustainable Construction?

Economy is an important facet of sustainable construction and it is addressed holistically – buildings need to minimize their dependency on finite resources by integrating efficiency by design and by substituting the inevitable demand with renewable resources.

Why does it cost so much to translate an e-book and create an e-tool?

We've heard this question a couple of times too many now, and decided to address it. We are not paying ourselves any wage from the $20,000 we are pitching for as we will have a product we can sell as a result. Whom we do have to pay are the experts we will outsource to for the total quality of the products. This is the full breakdown of the $20k:

e-Book

Translation of the book by experts (translating and revising) - $2K

Experts to revise new technical contents for the new chapter - $1K

Graphic designer - $1K

e-Tool of Thumb 

The technical programme for the questions answers and recommendations, experts in construction, energy, water and indoor air quality - $10K

Web designer - 2K

Graphic Designer - 1,2K

Photos - 1K

Indiegogo fees - 1,8K

Where do People come into the Sustainable Construction Equation?

The spaces we inhabit should enrich our lives! They should enhance the scope of our thoughts and experiences and facilitate our relations with the people we share them with. They should equally allow us to effectively and freely perform our daily functions, while engaging positively with our local community.

How can we implement Sustainable Construction in the existing built environment?

This is why the Sustainable Construction® Team has developed the book and is now pitching for the “39 Steps: Sustainable Construction and Refurbishment in the Mediterranean Climate” project. To overcome one of the main barriers to mainstreaming Sustainable Construction: the availability of information to make the right decisions!

What does the Perk “e-Book's double fold thank you page as a contributor” look like?

Your name will appear among 300 contributors’ names in the “Thank You” page – look below.

How will the Sustainable Construction® Team invest any funding over and above the target?

If we surpass our funding goal we will take your suggestions into account when we decide our next steps! We will create a survey on the basis of the feasible suggestions you leave us and address all contributors. Should we translate the e-Book and e-Tool of Thumb into Spanish, French, Italian or Greek? Do you have any other suggestions? Leave us your ideas and comments below!
story_txt:
If you live or work in anywhere along the coastal zones bordering the Mediterranean Sea, Central and Southern California in the US, North Mexico, coastal Western Australia and South Australia, the Chilean coast and the Western Cape region in South Africa... you enjoy a very favourable combination of outdoor temperature, solar radiation, rain and wind - environments that are ideal for Humans, animals and plants to live and prosper. Often though these favourable conditions don’t exist in your home – and if they do, it is at the cost of a lot of resources – energy, water and materials... that weigh on your pocket and the environment.
Did you know that in if you live in one of these areas your home can be super comfortable with no energy input? Learn how to “unplug” your home!

In 2007 the Sustainable Construction Team published the “Sustainable Construction” book in Portugal (10.500 copies sold) and launched the web page www.construcaosustentavel.pt(www.sustainableconstruction.eu). These soon became the reference of sustainable construction for the Mediterranean Climate Region. In order to reach a larger proportion of the population living in regions that enjoy the Mediterranean Climate, all this relevant information, essential to improve the quality of the built environment, must now be made available also in English.
For a complete rundown of the cost structure, check the FAQ.

Buildings must add value to our lives 
The first task of the Sustainable Construction Team is to translate the book into English, with updated contents and links to inspiring complementary information and the second task is to develop a simple to use “e-Tool of Thumb”, both in Portuguese and English, in order to support good decision making among those who wish to improve their living conditions at home.

People need healthy and comfortable Indoor Environments 
Whether you live in coastal zones bordering the Mediterranean Sea, Central and Southern California in the US, North Mexico, coastal Western Australia and South Australia, the Chilean coast and the Cape Town region of South Africa – with the support of the e-Book and “e-Tool of Thumb” you will be able to make the right decisions about improving the energy environmental performance of your home!
 
Where the Mediterranean Climate prevails the built environment must aim to provide excellent living conditions with minimal finite resource input!
The Sustainable Construction Team is convinced that making widely available in Portuguese and English the concepts and robust measures leading to sustainable construction on the web, in the e-Book and in the “e-Tool of Thumb”, will constitute an effective step towards overcoming one of the main barriers that is preventing the mainstreaming of sustainable construction and refurbishment: the lack of reliable and robust information available to decision makers at the right time, language and place.

Decision makers need access to the relevant information in a language they understand
With your support and funding of this project, you will make it possible for the Sustainable Construction Team to translate and to update the contents of the present book into English and to make all the information available in the following formats:
·       Thee-Book in an illustrated PDF format, with hyperlinks to complementary information available online (audio and visual) in Portuguese and English – on sale one month after you get it in case you select this perk;
·       The online “e-Tool of Thumb”to help you make the right decisions to improve your living conditions at home, in Portuguese and English – on sale one month after you get it in case you select this perk.
·       Online in the sustainable construction web page, using an open format, in Portuguese and English;

Win - Inhabitants enjoy health and comfort
Win - The construction sector’s activity becomes recognized for adding value to society
Win - The Planet’s resources are put to excellent use
By funding our project you will not only be able to get your copy of the e-Book “39 Steps: Sustainable Construction and Refurbishment in the Mediterranean Climate” (in English or Portuguese) and access to the online “e-Tool of Thumb” – all of which will help you to make the right decisions on improving the living conditions in your home - you will also help us to make available all this relevant information on how to make buildings add value to people’s lives, online in a simpler format, so that anyone whose actions and decisions influence the quality of the built environment you inhabit, anywhere where the Mediterranean Climate prevails world wide, will be in a position to make better decisions...
This is not only a way you can improve the living conditions in your own home, it is also an effective way you can really influence the quality of the wider built environment you inhabit!

Total Quality = more health, more comfort, less energy, less water and better environment 
Support this project by selecting one of the Funding options we propose and share it with your friends...
About the “e-Tool of Thumb”:
Introduce simple specific data about your home into the “e-Tool of Thumb” and you will understand how the holistic bioclimatic design principles, presented in the e-book, apply to the specific context and conditions of your home. You will then be encouraged to make the right decisions to improve the health and comfort of your home while reducing your energy and water bills and while improving the environment.
About the Sustainable Construction® Team:
The brand Construção Sustentável® belongs to Bluecity Construction Ltd, a private company that builds on the experience gathered over more than 20 years, centred on designing, promoting, selling, monitoring and managing some of the benchmark buildings that flag sustainable construction in the Mediterranean Climate Region. Bluecity focuses on disseminating all the content gathered over many years of experience and on facilitating the development of new contents by participating in and coordinating open innovation networks, involving the relevant actors of the sustainable construction value chain. Check out the Company Profile.
FAQ:
Why is Sustainable Construction relevant?
If you live in a home that is ill adapted to the prevalent climate, you won’t enjoy healthy and comfortable indoor conditions – often you won’t achieve health and comfort, even when you try to create these conditions artificially.
Also, almost 40% of the energy produced world wide is used to make buildings inhabitable – how can this statistic make sense when applied to the Mediterranean Climate - where average temperatures are so favourable to people?
Isn’t Sustainable Construction expensive?
Did you know that in some continents (Europe as an example) a building will, on average, double its construction costs in between 7 to 20 years? So the answer to this question is another more pertinent one: can we afford not to mainstream Sustainable Construction?

Photos - 1K
Indiegogo fees - 1,8K

They should equally allow us to effectively and freely perform our daily functions, while engaging positively with our local community.

story:
California state parks are going to close unless we do something.

Funding for state parks has been diminishing for years. In January 2011 it got even worse when California Governor Jerry Brown unveiled his state budget, which included significant cuts to state parks. After all those years of underfunding, this budget cut was a final blow for state parks.  The state determined it could no longer afford to keep all of the parks open. So in May 2011, it was announced that 70 state parks will be permanently closed by July 2012. (See photos of the 70 threatened parks here.)


Thatâ€™s 25% of Californiaâ€™s state parks that will be closed to the public!  This is the first time in the 100 year history of California state parks that a serious, deliberate effort has been made to significantly reduce the state parks system. Anyone who has visited a state park, lives in California, or simply loves the outdoors is impacted by this. But we canâ€™t just sit by and let this happen, we need to do something â€¦ together.


Defend Whatâ€™s Yours is all about doing just that! The state parks belong to all of us, and we believe if we work together we can find a way to defend these precious places. As someone who loves and appreciates access to nature in an increasingly developed world, we hope you will stand with us to defend whatâ€™s yours.


Get more information at calparks.org/defend


 Help Us Help You

As the largest nonprofit dedicated to state parks in California, the California State Parks Foundation is working on several fronts to keep parks open and to improve parks. We are building broad awareness of park closures and engaging you, the public, in helping. (HINT, THIS PAGE IS ONE OF THE MANY WAYS YOU CAN HELP!) We are working to help our numerous partners around the state who are attempting to reopen parks by giving them assistance and financial support.  Additionally, several groups are working with California State Parks to keep a few parks open. We can support these partners and help find new solutions with help from all of you.

story:
The Quick Summary

The Problem

South Africa is facing a water crises. To make matters worse, a leaking toilet can waste up to 80 000 gallons of water a year.

Our Solution

We have created a technology we call the Leak-Less Valve that can save 132 gallons of water a day, in one toilet. It is patented, we have 5 Letters Of Interest from ideal customers: 3 from South African government agencies, 2 from USA based construction companies and requests from numerous individuals for the technology.

You Can Make Every Drop Count

We want to mass produce this technology to save as much water as possible. Your contribution will help take our prototype and develop a market ready product to save as much water as possible. 

If you believe that every drop of water counts; let us count your dollar.

======================

If you've got more time...

My name is Paseka Lesolang. I am a 2012 Unreasonable Fellow. I run a company called WHC. It stands for Water, Hygiene, Convenience. We create water saving technologies. Water is life and a commodity that is running out faster than gas.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $120 000 to get to a market ready product and to create the tooling for small scale manufacturing. Therefore, all the money we raise will be going towards this objective.

We also need access to the USA markets through construction companies and convenient distributors and sales outlets i.e. WalMart etc.

The Impact

When South Africa was facing a critical energy supply crises in 2009, the government purchased solar water heaters for 1 million of the 2.4 million Low Cost Houses they built, in order to mitigate the demand. Water is a prerequisite to generating energy in South Africa and the government has indicated interest to purchase our product as done with the Solar Water Heater project. Therefore, if they do we could save approximately 1 000 000 x 132 gallons of water a day (= 132 000 000) x 365 days a year... Not to mention all the other homes with leaking toilets in the world. We can also create more than 300 jobs at the installation phase alone. 

We managed to raise $10 000 through the Unreasonable Institute Market place, which was our first crowd funding experience. We have numerous awards and accolades for our product. Government had given us a matching grant to the value of $60 000. We have other interested investors that would like us to put more money on the table from our behalf and they will follow with the rest.

Imagine how many toilets in the world are leaking. Imagine how much more water we can save!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you very much for reading to this extent. It would be highly appreciated if you could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. If you would like to purchase this technology or have any other suggestions we can achieve the above request faster and/or easier, please s. end us an email at info@whcpty.com. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Let us make every drop of water count. Let us use the Leak-Less Valve!

 

Disclaimer

This campaign was designed for the SOCAP conference community for it's annual gathering on October 1-4th. A group of 100 entrepreneurs selected 5 entrepreneurs to showcase their work through a small crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo. The entrepreneurs were given 2 hours to develop their campaign page. The campaign will run for 1 week to an audience of 1500 global social innovators at SOCAP. SOCAP attendees were given a wooden token representative of $5 that they will choose to designate towards 1 of the 5 project, in total worth $10,000. Additionally, attendees are encouraged to further contribute both financially and otherwise. Though the entrepreneurs have financial goals far exceeding the small amount they will raise through the campaign, this exercise is a symbol of how crowd and community support towards inspiring and innovative individuals can leverage great resources to change the world.
